member.name: T:Godot.Node
member.summary: Nodes are Godot's building blocks. They can be assigned as the child of another node, resulting in a tree arrangement. A given node can contain any number of nodes as children with the requirement that all siblings (direct children of a node) should have unique names. A tree of nodes is called a [i]scene[/i]. Scenes can be saved to the disk and then instanced into other scenes. This allows for very high flexibility in the architecture and data model of Godot projects. [b]Scene tree:[/b] The [SceneTree] contains the active tree of nodes. When a node is added to the scene tree, it receives the NOTIFICATION_ENTER_TREE notification and its [method _enter_tree] callback is triggered. Child nodes are always added [i]after[/i] their parent node, i.e. the [method _enter_tree] callback of a parent node will be triggered before its child's. Once all nodes have been added in the scene tree, they receive the NOTIFICATION_READY notification and their respective [method _ready] callbacks are triggered. For groups of nodes, the [method _ready] callback is called in reverse order, starting with the children and moving up to the parent nodes. This means that when adding a node to the scene tree, the following order will be used for the callbacks: [method _enter_tree] of the parent, [method _enter_tree] of the children, [method _ready] of the children and finally [method _ready] of the parent (recursively for the entire scene tree). [b]Processing:[/b] Nodes can override the "process" state, so that they receive a callback on each frame requesting them to process (do something). Normal processing (callback [method _process], toggled with [method set_process]) happens as fast as possible and is dependent on the frame rate, so the processing time [i]delta[/i] is passed as an argument. Physics processing (callback [method _physics_process], toggled with [method set_physics_process]) happens a fixed number of times per second (60 by default) and is useful for code related to the physics engine. Nodes can also process input events. When present, the [method _input] function will be called for each input that the program receives. In many cases, this can be overkill (unless used for simple projects), and the [method _unhandled_input] function might be preferred; it is called when the input event was not handled by anyone else (typically, GUI [Control] nodes), ensuring that the node only receives the events that were meant for it. To keep track of the scene hierarchy (especially when instancing scenes into other scenes), an "owner" can be set for the node with the [member owner] property. This keeps track of who instanced what. This is mostly useful when writing editors and tools, though. Finally, when a node is freed with [method Object.free] or [method queue_free], it will also free all its children. [b]Groups:[/b] Nodes can be added to as many groups as you want to be easy to manage, you could create groups like "enemies" or "collectables" for example, depending on your game. See [method add_to_group], [method is_in_group] and [method remove_from_group]. You can then retrieve all nodes in these groups, iterate them and even call methods on groups via the methods on [SceneTree]. [b]Networking with nodes:[/b] After connecting to a server (or making one, see [NetworkedMultiplayerENet]) it is possible to use the built-in RPC (remote procedure call) system to communicate over the network. By calling [method rpc] with a method name, it will be called locally and in all connected peers (peers = clients and the server that accepts connections). To identify which node receives the RPC call Godot will use its [NodePath] (make sure node names are the same on all peers). Also take a look at the high-level networking tutorial and corresponding demos.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationEnterTree
member.summary: Notification received when the node enters a [SceneTree].

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationExitTree
member.summary: Notification received when the node is about to exit a [SceneTree].

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationMovedInParent
member.summary: Notification received when the node is moved in the parent.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationReady
member.summary: Notification received when the node is ready. See [method _ready].

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationPaused
member.summary: Notification received when the node is paused.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationUnpaused
member.summary: Notification received when the node is unpaused.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationPhysicsProcess
member.summary: Notification received every frame when the physics process flag is set (see [method set_physics_process]).

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationProcess
member.summary: Notification received every frame when the process flag is set (see [method set_process]).

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationParented
member.summary: Notification received when a node is set as a child of another node. Note that this doesn't mean that a node entered the Scene Tree.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationUnparented
member.summary: Notification received when a node is unparented (parent removed it from the list of children).

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationInstanced
member.summary: Notification received when the node is instanced.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationDragBegin
member.summary: Notification received when a drag begins.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationDragEnd
member.summary: Notification received when a drag ends.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationPathChanged
member.summary: Notification received when the node's [NodePath] changed.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationTranslationChanged
member.summary: Notification received when translations may have changed. Can be triggered by the user changing the locale. Can be used to respond to language changes, for example to change the UI strings on the fly. Useful when working with the built-in translation support, like [method Object.tr].

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationInternalProcess
member.summary: Notification received every frame when the internal process flag is set (see [method set_process_internal]).

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NotificationInternalPhysicsProcess
member.summary: Notification received every frame when the internal physics process flag is set (see [method set_physics_process_internal]).

member.name: F:Godot.Node.PauseModeEnum.Inherit
member.summary: Inherits pause mode from the node's parent. For the root node, it is equivalent to PAUSE_MODE_STOP. Default.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.PauseModeEnum.Stop
member.summary: Stop processing when the [SceneTree] is paused.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.PauseModeEnum.Process
member.summary: Continue to process regardless of the [SceneTree] pause state.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.DuplicateFlags.Signals
member.summary: Duplicate the node's signals.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.DuplicateFlags.Groups
member.summary: Duplicate the node's groups.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.DuplicateFlags.Scripts
member.summary: Duplicate the node's scripts.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.DuplicateFlags.UseInstancing
member.summary: Duplicate using instancing.

member.name: P:Godot.Node.PauseMode
member.summary: Pause mode. How the node will behave if the [SceneTree] is paused.

member.name: P:Godot.Node.Name
member.summary: The name of the node. This name is unique among the siblings (other child nodes from the same parent). When set to an existing name, the node will be automatically renamed

member.name: P:Godot.Node.Filename
member.summary: When a scene is instanced from a file, its topmost node contains the filename from which it was loaded.

member.name: P:Godot.Node.Owner
member.summary: The node owner. A node can have any other node as owner (as long as it is a valid parent, grandparent, etc. ascending in the tree). When saving a node (using [PackedScene]) all the nodes it owns will be saved with it. This allows for the creation of complex [SceneTree]s, with instancing and subinstancing.

member.name: P:Godot.Node.Multiplayer
member.summary: The [MultiplayerAPI] instance associated with this node. Either the [member custom_multiplayer], or the default SceneTree one (if inside tree).

member.name: P:Godot.Node.CustomMultiplayer
member.summary: The override to the default [MultiplayerAPI]. Set to null to use the default SceneTree one.

member.name: M:Godot.Node._EnterTree
member.summary: Called when the node enters the [SceneTree] (e.g. upon instancing, scene changing, or after calling [method add_child] in a script). If the node has children, its [method _enter_tree] callback will be called first, and then that of the children. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_ENTER_TREE notification in [method Object._notification].

member.name: M:Godot.Node._ExitTree
member.summary: Called when the node is about to leave the [SceneTree] (e.g. upon freeing, scene changing, or after calling [method remove_child] in a script). If the node has children, its [method _exit_tree] callback will be called last, after all its children have left the tree. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_EXIT_TREE notification in [method Object._notification] and signal [signal tree_exiting]. To get notified when the node has already left the active tree, connect to the [signal tree_exited]

member.name: M:Godot.Node._Input(Godot.InputEvent)
member.summary: Called when there is an input event. The input event propagates up through the node tree until a node consumes it. It is only called if input processing is enabled, which is done automatically if this method is overridden, and can be toggled with [method set_process_input]. To consume the input event and stop it propagating further to other nodes, [method SceneTree.set_input_as_handled] can be called. For gameplay input, [method _unhandled_input] and [method _unhandled_key_input] are usually a better fit as they allow the GUI to intercept the events first.

member.name: M:Godot.Node._PhysicsProcess(System.Single)
member.summary: Called during the physics processing step of the main loop. Physics processing means that the frame rate is synced to the physics, i.e. the [code]delta[/code] variable should be constant. It is only called if physics processing is enabled, which is done automatically if this method is overridden, and can be toggled with [method set_physics_process]. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_PHYSICS_PROCESS notification in [method Object._notification].

member.name: M:Godot.Node._Process(System.Single)
member.summary: Called during the processing step of the main loop. Processing happens at every frame and as fast as possible, so the [code]delta[/code] time since the previous frame is not constant. It is only called if processing is enabled, which is done automatically if this method is overridden, and can be toggled with [method set_process]. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_PROCESS notification in [method Object._notification].

member.name: M:Godot.Node._Ready
member.summary: Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their [method _ready] callbacks get triggered first, and the parent node will receive the ready notification afterwards. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_READY notification in [method Object._notification]. See also the [code]onready[/code] keyword for variables. Usually used for initialization. For even earlier initialization, [method Object._init] may be used. Also see [method _enter_tree].

member.name: M:Godot.Node._UnhandledInput(Godot.InputEvent)
member.summary: Called when an [InputEvent] hasn't been consumed by [method _input] or any GUI. The input event propagates up through the node tree until a node consumes it. It is only called if unhandled input processing is enabled, which is done automatically if this method is overridden, and can be toggled with [method set_process_unhandled_input]. To consume the input event and stop it propagating further to other nodes, [method SceneTree.set_input_as_handled] can be called. For gameplay input, this and [method _unhandled_key_input] are usually a better fit than [method _input] as they allow the GUI to intercept the events first.

member.name: M:Godot.Node._UnhandledKeyInput(Godot.InputEventKey)
member.summary: Called when an [InputEventKey] hasn't been consumed by [method _input] or any GUI. The input event propagates up through the node tree until a node consumes it. It is only called if unhandled key input processing is enabled, which is done automatically if this method is overridden, and can be toggled with [method set_process_unhandled_key_input]. To consume the input event and stop it propagating further to other nodes, [method SceneTree.set_input_as_handled] can be called. For gameplay input, this and [method _unhandled_input] are usually a better fit than [method _input] as they allow the GUI to intercept the events first.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.AddChildBelowNode(Godot.Node,Godot.Node,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a child node. The child is placed below the given node in the list of children. Setting "legible_unique_name" [code]true[/code] creates child nodes with human-readable names, based on the name of the node being instanced instead of its type.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.AddChild(Godot.Node,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a child node. Nodes can have any number of children, but every child must have a unique name. Child nodes are automatically deleted when the parent node is deleted, so an entire scene can be removed by deleting its topmost node. Setting "legible_unique_name" [code]true[/code] creates child nodes with human-readable names, based on the name of the node being instanced instead of its type.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RemoveChild(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Removes a child node. The node is NOT deleted and must be deleted manually.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetChildCount
member.summary: Returns the number of child nodes.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetChildren
member.summary: Returns an array of references to node's children.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetChild(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a child node by its index (see [method get_child_count]). This method is often used for iterating all children of a node. To access a child node via its name, use [method get_node].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.HasNode(Godot.NodePath)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the node that the [NodePath] points to exists.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetNode(Godot.NodePath)
member.summary: Fetches a node. The [NodePath] can be either a relative path (from the current node) or an absolute path (in the scene tree) to a node. If the path does not exist, a [code]null instance[/code] is returned and attempts to access it will result in an "Attempt to call <method> on a null instance." error. [b]Note:[/b] Fetching absolute paths only works when the node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]). [b]Example:[/b] Assume your current node is Character and the following tree: [codeblock] /root /root/Character /root/Character/Sword /root/Character/Backpack/Dagger /root/MyGame /root/Swamp/Alligator /root/Swamp/Mosquito /root/Swamp/Goblin [/codeblock] Possible paths are: [codeblock] get_node("Sword") get_node("Backpack/Dagger") get_node("../Swamp/Alligator") get_node("/root/MyGame") [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetNodeOrNull(Godot.NodePath)
member.summary: Similar to [method get_node], but does not raise an error when [code]path[/code] does not point to a valid [code]Node[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetParent
member.summary: Returns the parent node of the current node, or an empty [code]Node[/code] if the node lacks a parent.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.FindNode(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds a descendant of this node whose name matches [code]mask[/code] as in [method String.match] (i.e. case sensitive, but '*' matches zero or more characters and '?' matches any single character except '.'). Note that it does not match against the full path, just against individual node names. If [code]owned[/code] is [code]true[/code], this method only finds nodes whose owner is this node. This is especially important for scenes instantiated through script, because those scenes don't have an owner.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.FindParent(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the first parent of the current node whose name matches [code]mask[/code] as in [method String.match] (i.e. case sensitive, but '*' matches zero or more characters and '?' matches any single character except '.'). Note that it does not match against the full path, just against individual node names.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsInsideTree
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if this node is currently inside a [SceneTree].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsAParentOf(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given node is a direct or indirect child of the current node.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsGreaterThan(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given node occurs later in the scene hierarchy than the current node.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetPath
member.summary: Returns the absolute path of the current node. This only works if the current node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetPathTo(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Returns the relative [NodePath] from this node to the specified [code]node[/code]. Both nodes must be in the same scene or the function will fail.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.AddToGroup(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds the node to a group. Groups are helpers to name and organize a subset of nodes, for example "enemies" or "collectables". A node can be in any number of groups. Nodes can be assigned a group at any time, but will not be added until they are inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]). See notes in the description, and the group methods in [SceneTree].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RemoveFromGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a node from a group. See notes in the description, and the group methods in [SceneTree].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsInGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if this node is in the specified group. See notes in the description, and the group methods in [SceneTree].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.MoveChild(Godot.Node,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves a child node to a different position (order) amongst the other children. Since calls, signals, etc are performed by tree order, changing the order of children nodes may be useful.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetGroups
member.summary: Returns an array listing the groups that the node is a member of.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.Raise
member.summary: Moves this node to the top of the array of nodes of the parent node. This is often useful in GUIs ([Control] nodes), because their order of drawing depends on their order in the tree.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RemoveAndSkip
member.summary: Removes a node and sets all its children as children of the parent node (if it exists). All event subscriptions that pass by the removed node will be unsubscribed.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetIndex
member.summary: Returns the node's index, i.e. its position among the siblings of its parent.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.PrintTree
member.summary: Prints the tree to stdout. Used mainly for debugging purposes. This version displays the path relative to the current node, and is good for copy/pasting into the [method get_node] function. Example output: [codeblock] TheGame TheGame/Menu TheGame/Menu/Label TheGame/Menu/Camera2D TheGame/SplashScreen TheGame/SplashScreen/Camera2D [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.Node.PrintTreePretty
member.summary: Similar to [method print_tree], this prints the tree to stdout. This version displays a more graphical representation similar to what is displayed in the scene inspector. It is useful for inspecting larger trees. Example output: [codeblock] ┖╴TheGame ┠╴Menu ┃ ┠╴Label ┃ ┖╴Camera2D ┖-SplashScreen ┖╴Camera2D [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.Node.PropagateNotification(System.Int32)
member.summary: Notifies the current node and all its children recursively by calling notification() on all of them.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.PropagateCall(System.String,Godot.Collections.Array,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calls the given method (if present) with the arguments given in [code]args[/code] on this node and recursively on all its children. If the parent_first argument is [code]true[/code] then the method will be called on the current node first, then on all children. If it is [code]false[/code] then the children will be called first. <param name="args">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetPhysicsProcess(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables physics (i.e. fixed framerate) processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PHYSICS_PROCESS at a fixed (usually 60 fps, see [OS] to change) interval (and the [method _physics_process] callback will be called if exists). Enabled automatically if [method _physics_process] is overridden. Any calls to this before [method _ready] will be ignored.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetPhysicsProcessDeltaTime
member.summary: Returns the time elapsed since the last physics-bound frame (see [method _physics_process]). This is always a constant value in physics processing unless the frames per second is changed in [OS].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsPhysicsProcessing
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if physics processing is enabled (see [method set_physics_process]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetProcessDeltaTime
member.summary: Returns the time elapsed (in seconds) since the last process callback. This value may vary from frame to frame.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetProcess(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PROCESS on every drawn frame (and the [method _process] callback will be called if exists). Enabled automatically if [method _process] is overridden. Any calls to this before [method _ready] will be ignored.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsProcessing
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if processing is enabled (see [method set_process]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetProcessInput(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables input processing. This is not required for GUI controls! Enabled automatically if [method _input] is overridden. Any calls to this before [method _ready] will be ignored.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsProcessingInput
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the node is processing input (see [method set_process_input]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetProcessUnhandledInput(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables unhandled input processing. This is not required for GUI controls! It enables the node to receive all input that was not previously handled (usually by a [Control]). Enabled automatically if [method _unhandled_input] is overridden. Any calls to this before [method _ready] will be ignored.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsProcessingUnhandledInput
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the node is processing unhandled input (see [method set_process_unhandled_input]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetProcessUnhandledKeyInput(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables unhandled key input processing. Enabled automatically if [method _unhandled_key_input] is overridden. Any calls to this before [method _ready] will be ignored.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsProcessingUnhandledKeyInput
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the node is processing unhandled key input (see [method set_process_unhandled_key_input]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.CanProcess
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the node can process while the scene tree is paused (see [member pause_mode]). Always returns [code]true[/code] if the scene tree is not paused, and [code]false[/code] if the node is not in the tree.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.PrintStrayNodes
member.summary: Prints all stray nodes (nodes outside the [SceneTree]). Used for debugging. Works only in debug builds.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetPositionInParent
member.summary: Returns the node's order in the scene tree branch. For example, if called on the first child node the position is [code]0[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetDisplayFolded(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the folded state of the node in the Scene dock.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsDisplayedFolded
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the node is folded (collapsed) in the Scene dock.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetProcessInternal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disabled internal processing for this node. Internal processing happens in isolation from the normal [method _process] calls and is used by some nodes internally to guarantee proper functioning even if the node is paused or processing is disabled for scripting ([method set_process]). Only useful for advanced uses to manipulate built-in nodes behaviour.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsProcessingInternal
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if internal processing is enabled (see [method set_process_internal]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetPhysicsProcessInternal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables internal physics for this node. Internal physics processing happens in isolation from the normal [method _physics_process] calls and is used by some nodes internally to guarantee proper functioning even if the node is paused or physics processing is disabled for scripting ([method set_physics_process]). Only useful for advanced uses to manipulate built-in nodes behaviour.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsPhysicsProcessingInternal
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if internal physics processing is enabled (see [method set_physics_process_internal]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetTree
member.summary: Returns the [SceneTree] that contains this node.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.Duplicate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Duplicates the node, returning a new node. You can fine-tune the behavior using the [code]flags[/code] (see [enum Node.DuplicateFlags]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.ReplaceBy(Godot.Node,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces a node in a scene by the given one. Subscriptions that pass through this node will be lost.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetSceneInstanceLoadPlaceholder(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether this is an instance load placeholder. See [InstancePlaceholder].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetSceneInstanceLoadPlaceholder
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if this is an instance load placeholder. See [InstancePlaceholder].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetViewport
member.summary: Returns the node's [Viewport].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.QueueFree
member.summary: Queues a node for deletion at the end of the current frame. When deleted, all of its child nodes will be deleted as well. This method ensures it's safe to delete the node, contrary to [method Object.free]. Use [method Object.is_queued_for_deletion] to check whether a node will be deleted at the end of the frame.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RequestReady
member.summary: Requests that [code]_ready[/code] be called again.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetNetworkMaster(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the node's network master to the peer with the given peer ID. The network master is the peer that has authority over the node on the network. Useful in conjunction with the [code]master[/code] and [code]puppet[/code] keywords. Inherited from the parent node by default, which ultimately defaults to peer ID 1 (the server). If [code]recursive[/code], the given peer is recursively set as the master for all children of this node.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetNetworkMaster
member.summary: Returns the peer ID of the network master for this node. See [method set_network_master].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsNetworkMaster
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the local system is the master of this node.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RpcConfig(System.String,Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode)
member.summary: Changes the RPC mode for the given [code]method[/code] to the given [code]mode[/code]. See [enum MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode]. An alternative is annotating methods and properties with the corresponding keywords ([code]remote[/code], [code]master[/code], [code]puppet[/code], [code]remotesync[/code], [code]mastersync[/code], [code]puppetsync[/code]). By default, methods are not exposed to networking (and RPCs). Also see [method rset] and [method rset_config] for properties.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RsetConfig(System.String,Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode)
member.summary: Changes the RPC mode for the given [code]property[/code] to the given [code]mode[/code]. See [enum MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode]. An alternative is annotating methods and properties with the corresponding keywords ([code]remote[/code], [code]master[/code], [code]puppet[/code], [code]remotesync[/code], [code]mastersync[/code], [code]puppetsync[/code]). By default, properties are not exposed to networking (and RPCs). Also see [method rpc] and [method rpc_config] for methods.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.Rpc(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Sends a remote procedure call request for the given [code]method[/code] to peers on the network (and locally), optionally sending all additional arguments as arguments to the method called by the RPC. The call request will only be received by nodes with the same [NodePath], including the exact same node name. Behaviour depends on the RPC configuration for the given method, see [method rpc_config]. Methods are not exposed to RPCs by default. Also see [method rset] and [method rset_config] for properties. Returns an empty [Variant]. Note that you can only safely use RPCs on clients after you received the [code]connected_to_server[/code] signal from the [SceneTree]. You also need to keep track of the connection state, either by the [SceneTree] signals like [code]server_disconnected[/code] or by checking [code]SceneTree.network_peer.get_connection_status() == CONNECTION_CONNECTED[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RpcUnreliable(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Sends a [method rpc] using an unreliable protocol. Returns an empty [Variant].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RpcId(System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Sends a [method rpc] to a specific peer identified by [code]peer_id[/code] (see [method NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.set_target_peer]). Returns an empty [Variant].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RpcUnreliableId(System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Sends a [method rpc] to a specific peer identified by [code]peer_id[/code] using an unreliable protocol (see [method NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.set_target_peer]). Returns an empty [Variant].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.Rset(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Remotely changes a property's value on other peers (and locally). Behaviour depends on the RPC configuration for the given property, see [method rset_config]. Also see [method rpc] for RPCs for methods, most information applies to this method as well.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RsetId(System.Int32,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Remotely changes the property's value on a specific peer identified by [code]peer_id[/code] (see [method NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.set_target_peer]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RsetUnreliable(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Remotely changes the property's value on other peers (and locally) using an unreliable protocol.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RsetUnreliableId(System.Int32,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Remotely changes property's value on a specific peer identified by [code]peer_id[/code] using an unreliable protocol (see [method NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.set_target_peer]).

member.name: T:Godot.Object
member.summary: Base class for all non built-in types. Everything which is not a built-in type starts the inheritance chain from this class. Objects can be constructed from scripting languages, using [code]Object.new()[/code] in GDScript, [code]new Object[/code] in C#, or the "Construct Object" node in VisualScript. Objects do not manage memory, if inheriting from one the object will most likely have to be deleted manually (call the [method free] function from the script or delete from C++). Some derivatives add memory management, such as [Reference] (which keeps a reference count and deletes itself automatically when no longer referenced) and [Node], which deletes the children tree when deleted. Objects export properties, which are mainly useful for storage and editing, but not really so much in programming. Properties are exported in [method _get_property_list] and handled in [method _get] and [method _set]. However, scripting languages and C++ have simpler means to export them. Objects also receive notifications ([method _notification]). Notifications are a simple way to notify the object about simple events, so they can all be handled together.

member.name: F:Godot.Object.NotificationPostinitialize
member.summary: Called right when the object is initialized. Not available in script.

member.name: F:Godot.Object.NotificationPredelete
member.summary: Called before the object is about to be deleted.

member.name: F:Godot.Object.ConnectFlags.Deferred
member.summary: Connect a signal in deferred mode. This way, signal emissions are stored in a queue, then set on idle time.

member.name: F:Godot.Object.ConnectFlags.Persist
member.summary: Persisting connections are saved when the object is serialized to file.

member.name: F:Godot.Object.ConnectFlags.Oneshot
member.summary: One shot connections disconnect themselves after emission.

member.name: M:Godot.Object._Get(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the given property. Returns [code]null[/code] if the [code]property[/code] does not exist.

member.name: M:Godot.Object._GetPropertyList
member.summary: Returns the object's property list as an [Array] of dictionaries. Dictionaries must contain: name:String, type:int (see TYPE_* enum in [@GlobalScope]) and optionally: hint:int (see PROPERTY_HINT_* in [@GlobalScope]), hint_string:String, usage:int (see PROPERTY_USAGE_* in [@GlobalScope]).

member.name: M:Godot.Object._Init
member.summary: The virtual method called upon initialization.

member.name: M:Godot.Object._Notification(System.Int32)
member.summary: Notify the object internally using an ID.

member.name: M:Godot.Object._Set(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a property. Returns [code]true[/code] if the [code]property[/code] exists.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.Free
member.summary: Deletes the object from memory.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetClass
member.summary: Returns the object's class as a [String].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.IsClass(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the object inherits from the given [code]type[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.Set(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Set property into the object.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a [Variant] for a [code]property[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetIndexed(Godot.NodePath)
member.summary: Get indexed object property by String. Property indices get accessed with colon separation, for example: [code]position:x[/code]

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetPropertyList
member.summary: Returns the list of properties as an [Array] of dictionaries. Dictionaries contain: name:String, type:int (see TYPE_* enum in [@GlobalScope]) and optionally: hint:int (see PROPERTY_HINT_* in [@GlobalScope]), hint_string:String, usage:int (see PROPERTY_USAGE_* in [@GlobalScope]).

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetMethodList
member.summary: Returns the object's methods and their signatures as an [Array].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.Notification(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Notify the object of something.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetInstanceId
member.summary: Returns the object's unique instance ID.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.SetScript(Godot.Reference)
member.summary: Set a script into the object, scripts extend the object functionality.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetScript
member.summary: Returns the object's [Script] or [code]null[/code] if one doesn't exist.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.SetMeta(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Set a metadata into the object. Metadata is serialized. Metadata can be [i]anything[/i].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetMeta(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the object's metadata for the given [code]name[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.HasMeta(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if a metadata is found with the given [code]name[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetMetaList
member.summary: Returns the object's metadata as a [PoolStringArray].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.AddUserSignal(System.String,Godot.Collections.Array)
member.summary: Adds a user-defined [code]signal[/code]. Arguments are optional, but can be added as an [Array] of dictionaries, each containing "name" and "type" (from [@GlobalScope] TYPE_*). <param name="arguments">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Object.HasUserSignal(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given user-defined [code]signal[/code] exists.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.EmitSignal(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Emits the given [code]signal[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.Call(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls the [code]method[/code] on the object and returns a result. Pass parameters as a comma separated list.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.CallDeferred(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls the [code]method[/code] on the object during idle time and returns a result. Pass parameters as a comma separated list.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.Callv(System.String,Godot.Collections.Array)
member.summary: Calls the [code]method[/code] on the object and returns a result. Pass parameters as an [Array].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.HasMethod(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the object contains the given [code]method[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetSignalList
member.summary: Returns the list of signals as an [Array] of dictionaries.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetSignalConnectionList(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an [Array] of connections for the given [code]signal[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetIncomingConnections
member.summary: Returns an [Array] of dictionaries with information about signals that are connected to the object. Inside each [Dictionary] there are 3 fields: - "source" is a reference to signal emitter. - "signal_name" is name of connected signal. - "method_name" is a name of method to which signal is connected.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.Connect(System.String,Godot.Object,System.String,Godot.Collections.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Connects a [code]signal[/code] to a [code]method[/code] on a [code]target[/code] object. Pass optional [code]binds[/code] to the call. Use [code]flags[/code] to set deferred or one shot connections. See [code]CONNECT_*[/code] constants. A [code]signal[/code] can only be connected once to a [code]method[/code]. It will throw an error if already connected. To avoid this, first use [method is_connected] to check for existing connections. <param name="binds">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Object.Disconnect(System.String,Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Disconnects a [code]signal[/code] from a [code]method[/code] on the given [code]target[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.IsConnected(System.String,Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if a connection exists for a given [code]signal[/code], [code]target[/code], and [code]method[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.SetBlockSignals(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to true, signal emission is blocked.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.IsBlockingSignals
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if signal emission blocking is enabled.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.SetMessageTranslation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Define whether the object can translate strings (with calls to [method tr]). Default is true.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.CanTranslateMessages
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the object can translate strings.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.Tr(System.String)
member.summary: Translate a message. Only works if message translation is enabled (which it is by default). See [method set_message_translation].

member.name: M:Godot.Object.IsQueuedForDeletion
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [code]queue_free[/code] method was called for the object.

member.name: T:Godot.ResourceLoader

member.name: F:Godot.PropertyHint.None
member.summary: No hint for edited property.

member.name: F:Godot.PropertyHint.Range
member.summary: Hints that the string is a range, defined as "min,max" or "min,max,step". This is valid for integers and floats.

member.name: F:Godot.PropertyHint.ExpRange
member.summary: Hints that the string is an exponential range, defined as "min,max" or "min,max,step". This is valid for integers and floats.

member.name: F:Godot.PropertyHint.Enum
member.summary: Property hint for an enumerated value, like "Hello,Something,Else". This is valid for integer, float and string properties.

member.name: F:Godot.PropertyHint.Flags
member.summary: Property hint for a bitmask description, for bits 0,1,2,3 and 5 the hint would be like "Bit0,Bit1,Bit2,Bit3,,Bit5". Valid only for integers.

member.name: F:Godot.PropertyHint.File
member.summary: String property is a file (so pop up a file dialog when edited). Hint string can be a set of wildcards like "*.doc".

member.name: F:Godot.PropertyHint.Dir
member.summary: String property is a directory (so pop up a file dialog when edited).

member.name: F:Godot.PropertyHint.ResourceType
member.summary: String property is a resource, so open the resource popup menu when edited.

member.name: F:Godot.PropertyHint.ImageCompressLossy
member.summary: Hints that the image is compressed using lossy compression.

member.name: F:Godot.PropertyHint.ImageCompressLossless
member.summary: Hints that the image is compressed using lossless compression.

member.name: T:Godot.AcceptDialog
member.summary: This dialog is useful for small notifications to the user about an event. It can only be accepted or closed, with the same result.

member.name: P:Godot.AcceptDialog.DialogText
member.summary: The text displayed by this dialog.

member.name: P:Godot.AcceptDialog.DialogHideOnOk
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the dialog is hidden when the OK button is pressed. You can set it to [code]false[/code] if you want to do e.g. input validation when receiving the [signal confirmed] signal, and handle hiding the dialog in your own logic. Default value: [code]true[/code]. Note: Some nodes derived from this class can have a different default value, and potentially their own built-in logic overriding this setting. For example [FileDialog] defaults to [code]false[/code], and has its own input validation code that is called when you press OK, which eventually hides the dialog if the input is valid. As such this property can't be used in [FileDialog] to disable hiding the dialog when pressing OK.

member.name: M:Godot.AcceptDialog.GetOk
member.summary: Return the OK Button.

member.name: M:Godot.AcceptDialog.GetLabel
member.summary: Return the label used for built-in text.

member.name: M:Godot.AcceptDialog.AddButton(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a button with label [i]text[/i] and a custom [i]action[/i] to the dialog and returns the created button. [i]action[/i] will be passed to the [signal custom_action] signal when pressed. If [code]true[/code], [i]right[/i] will place the button to the right of any sibling buttons. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.AcceptDialog.AddCancel(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a button with label [i]name[/i] and a cancel action to the dialog and returns the created button.

member.name: M:Godot.AcceptDialog.RegisterTextEnter(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Registers a [LineEdit] in the dialog. When the enter key is pressed, the dialog will be accepted.

member.name: T:Godot.AnimatedSprite
member.summary: Animations are created using a [SpriteFrames] resource, which can be configured in the editor via the SpriteFrames panel.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite.Frames
member.summary: The [SpriteFrames] resource containing the animation(s).

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite.Animation
member.summary: The current animation from the [code]frames[/code] resource. If this value changes, the [code]frame[/code] counter is reset.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite.Frame
member.summary: The displayed animation frame's index.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite.Playing
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the [member animation] is currently playing.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite.Centered
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], texture will be centered. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite.Offset
member.summary: The texture's drawing offset.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite.FlipH
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], texture is flipped horizontally. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite.FlipV
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], texture is flipped vertically. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.AnimatedSprite.Play(System.String)
member.summary: Play the animation set in parameter. If no parameter is provided, the current animation is played.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimatedSprite.Stop
member.summary: Stop the current animation (does not reset the frame counter).

member.name: M:Godot.AnimatedSprite.IsPlaying
member.summary: Return true if an animation if currently being played.

member.name: T:Godot.AnimatedSprite3D
member.summary: Animations are created using a [SpriteFrames] resource, which can be configured in the editor via the SpriteFrames panel.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite3D.Frames
member.summary: The [SpriteFrames] resource containing the animation(s).

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite3D.Animation
member.summary: The current animation from the [code]frames[/code] resource. If this value changes, the [code]frame[/code] counter is reset.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite3D.Frame
member.summary: The displayed animation frame's index.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedSprite3D.Playing
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the [member animation] is currently playing.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimatedSprite3D.Play(System.String)
member.summary: Play the animation set in parameter. If no parameter is provided, the current animation is played.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimatedSprite3D.Stop
member.summary: Stop the current animation (does not reset the frame counter).

member.name: M:Godot.AnimatedSprite3D.IsPlaying
member.summary: Return true if an animation if currently being played.

member.name: T:Godot.AnimatedTexture
member.summary: [code]AnimatedTexture[/code] is a resource format for simple frame-based animations, where multiple frames textures can be chained automatically with a predefined delay for each frame. It's not a [Node], contrarily to [AnimationPlayer] or [AnimatedSprite], but has the advantage of being usable at any place where a [Texture] resource can be used, e.g. in a [TileSet]. The playback of the animation is controlled by the [member fps] property as well as each frame's optional delay (see [method set_frame_delay]). The animation loops, i.e. it will restart at frame 0 automatically after playing the last frame. [code]AnimatedTexture[/code] currently requires all frame textures to have the same size, otherwise the bigger ones will be cropped to match the smallest one.

member.name: F:Godot.AnimatedTexture.MaxFrames
member.summary: The maximum number of frames supported by [code]AnimatedTexture[/code]. If you need more frames in your animation, use [AnimationPlayer] or [AnimatedSprite].

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedTexture.Frames
member.summary: Number of frames to use in the animation. While you can create the frames independently with [method set_frame_texture], you need to set this value for the animation to take new frames into account. The maximum number of frames is [constant MAX_FRAMES]. Default value: 1.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimatedTexture.Fps
member.summary: Number of frames per second. This value defines the default time interval between two frames of the animation, and thus the overall duration of the animation loop based on the [member frames] property. A value of 0 means no predefined number of frames per second, the animation will play according to each frame's frame delay (see [method set_frame_delay]). Default value: 4. For example, an animation with 8 frames, no frame delay and a [code]fps[/code] value of 2 will run over 4 seconds, with one frame each 0.5 seconds.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimatedTexture.SetFrameTexture(System.Int32,Godot.Texture)
member.summary: Assigns a [Texture] to the given [code]frame[/code] ID. IDs start at 0 (so the first frame has ID 0, and the last frame of the animation has ID [member frames] - 1). You can define any frame texture up to [constant MAX_FRAMES], but keep in mind that only frames from 0 to [member frames] - 1 will be part of the animation.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimatedTexture.GetFrameTexture(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the [Texture] assigned to the given [code]frame[/code] ID.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimatedTexture.SetFrameDelay(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Defines an additional delay (in seconds) between this frame and the next one, that will be added to the time interval defined by [member fps]. By default, frames have no delay defined. If a delay value is defined, the final time interval between this frame and the next will be [code]1.0 / fps + delay[/code]. For example, for an animation with 3 frames, 2 FPS and a frame delay on the second frame of 1.2, the resulting playback will be: [codeblock] Frame 0: 0.5 s (1 / fps) Frame 1: 1.7 s (1 / fps + 1.2) Frame 2: 0.5 s (1 / fps) Total duration: 2.7 s [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.AnimatedTexture.GetFrameDelay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the delayed assigned to the given [code]frame[/code] ID.

member.name: T:Godot.Animation
member.summary: An Animation resource contains data used to animate everything in the engine. Animations are divided into tracks, and each track must be linked to a node. The state of that node can be changed through time, by adding timed keys (events) to the track. [codeblock] # This creates an animation that makes the node "Enemy" move to the right by # 100 pixels in 1 second. var animation = Animation.new() var track_index = animation.add_track(Animation.TYPE_VALUE) animation.track_set_path(track_index, "Enemy:position.x") animation.track_insert_key(track_index, 0.0, 0) animation.track_insert_key(track_index, 0.5, 100) [/codeblock] Animations are just data containers, and must be added to nodes such as an [AnimationPlayer] or [AnimationTreePlayer] to be played back.

member.name: F:Godot.Animation.TrackType.Value
member.summary: Value tracks set values in node properties, but only those which can be Interpolated.

member.name: F:Godot.Animation.TrackType.Transform
member.summary: Transform tracks are used to change node local transforms or skeleton pose bones. Transitions are Interpolated.

member.name: F:Godot.Animation.TrackType.Method
member.summary: Method tracks call functions with given arguments per key.

member.name: F:Godot.Animation.UpdateMode.Continuous
member.summary: Update between keyframes.

member.name: F:Godot.Animation.UpdateMode.Discrete
member.summary: Update at the keyframes and hold the value.

member.name: F:Godot.Animation.UpdateMode.Trigger
member.summary: Update at the keyframes.

member.name: F:Godot.Animation.InterpolationType.Nearest
member.summary: No interpolation (nearest value).

member.name: F:Godot.Animation.InterpolationType.Linear
member.summary: Linear interpolation.

member.name: F:Godot.Animation.InterpolationType.Cubic
member.summary: Cubic interpolation.

member.name: P:Godot.Animation.Length
member.summary: The total length of the animation (in seconds). Note that length is not delimited by the last key, as this one may be before or after the end to ensure correct interpolation and looping.

member.name: P:Godot.Animation.Loop
member.summary: A flag indicating that the animation must loop. This is uses for correct interpolation of animation cycles, and for hinting the player that it must restart the animation.

member.name: P:Godot.Animation.Step

member.summary: Called when a custom node is processed. The argument "time" is relative, unless "seek" is true (in which case it is absolute). Here, call the [method blend_input], [method blend_node] or [method blend_animation] functions. You can also use [method get_parameter] and [method set_parameter] to modify local memory. This function returns the time left for the current animation to finish (if unsure, just pass the value from the main blend being called).

member.name: T:Godot.AnimationPlayer
member.summary: An animation player is used for general purpose playback of [Animation] resources. It contains a dictionary of animations (referenced by name) and custom blend times between their transitions. Additionally, animations can be played and blended in different channels.

member.name: F:Godot.AnimationPlayer.AnimationProcessMode.Physics
member.summary: Process animation during the physics process. This is especially useful when animating physics bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.AnimationPlayer.AnimationProcessMode.Idle
member.summary: Process animation during the idle process.

member.name: F:Godot.AnimationPlayer.AnimationProcessMode.Manual
member.summary: Do not process animation. Use the 'advance' method to process the animation manually.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimationPlayer.RootNode
member.summary: The node from which node path references will travel. Default value: [code]".."[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.AnimationPlayer.CurrentAnimation
member.summary: The name of the current animation, "" if not playing anything. When being set, does not restart the animation. See also [method play]. Default value: [code]""[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.AnimationPlayer.AssignedAnimation
member.summary: If playing, the current animation; otherwise, the animation last played. When set, would change the animation, but would not play it unless currently playing. See also [member current_animation].

member.name: P:Godot.AnimationPlayer.Autoplay
member.summary: The name of the animation to play when the scene loads. Default value: [code]""[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.AnimationPlayer.CurrentAnimationLength
member.summary: The length (in seconds) of the currently being played animation.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimationPlayer.CurrentAnimationPosition
member.summary: The position (in seconds) of the currently playing animation.

member.name: P:Godot.AnimationPlayer.PlaybackProcessMode
member.summary: The process notification in which to update animations. Default value: [code]ANIMATION_PROCESS_IDLE[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.AnimationPlayer.PlaybackDefaultBlendTime
member.summary: The default time in which to blend animations. Ranges from 0 to 4096 with 0.01 precision. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.AnimationPlayer.PlaybackActive
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], updates animations in response to process-related notifications. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.AnimationPlayer.PlaybackSpeed
member.summary: The speed scaling ratio. For instance, if this value is 1 then the animation plays at normal speed. If it's 0.5 then it plays at half speed. If it's 2 then it plays at double speed. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.AddAnimation(System.String,Godot.Animation)
member.summary: Adds [code]animation[/code] to the player accessible with the key [code]name[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.RemoveAnimation(System.String)
member.summary: Remove the animation with key [code]name[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.RenameAnimation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Rename an existing animation with key [code]name[/code] to [code]newname[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.HasAnimation(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [code]AnimationPlayer[/code] stores an [Animation] with key [code]name[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.GetAnimation(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the [Animation] with key [code]name[/code] or [code]null[/code] if not found.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.GetAnimationList
member.summary: Returns the list of stored animation names.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.AnimationSetNext(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Triggers the [code]anim_to[/code] animation when the [code]anim_from[/code] animation completes.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.AnimationGetNext(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the name of the next animation in the queue.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.SetBlendTime(System.String,System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Specify a blend time (in seconds) between two animations, referenced by their names.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.GetBlendTime(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the blend time (in seconds) between two animations, referenced by their names.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.Play(System.String,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Play the animation with key [code]name[/code]. Custom speed and blend times can be set. If custom speed is negative (-1), 'from_end' being true can play the animation backwards. If the animation has been paused by [code]stop(true)[/code] it will be resumed. Calling [code]play()[/code] without arguments will also resume the animation.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.PlayBackwards(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Play the animation with key [code]name[/code] in reverse. If the animation has been paused by [code]stop(true)[/code] it will be resumed backwards. Calling [code]play_backwards()[/code] without arguments will also resume the animation backwards.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stop the currently playing animation. If [code]reset[/code] is [code]true[/code], the animation position is reset to [code]0[/code] and the playback speed is reset to [code]1.0[/code]. If [code]reset[/code] is [code]false[/code], then calling [code]play()[/code] without arguments or [code]play("same_as_before")[/code] will resume the animation. Works the same for the [code]play_backwards()[/code] method.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.IsPlaying
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if playing an animation.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.Queue(System.String)
member.summary: Queue an animation for playback once the current one is done.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.ClearQueue
member.summary: Clears all queued, unplayed animations.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.GetPlayingSpeed
member.summary: Get the actual playing speed of current animation or 0 if not playing. This speed is the [code]playback_speed[/code] property multiplied by [code]custom_speed[/code] argument specified when calling the [code]play[/code] method.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.FindAnimation(Godot.Animation)
member.summary: Returns the name of [code]animation[/code] or empty string if not found.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.ClearCaches
member.summary: [code]AnimationPlayer[/code] caches animated nodes. It may not notice if a node disappears, so clear_caches forces it to update the cache again.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.Seek(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Seek the animation to the [code]seconds[/code] point in time (in seconds). If [code]update[/code] is [code]true[/code], the animation updates too, otherwise it updates at process time. Events between the current frame and [code]seconds[/code] are skipped.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationPlayer.Advance(System.Single)
member.summary: Shifts position in the animation timeline. Delta is the time in seconds to shift. Events between the current frame and [code]delta[/code] are handled.

member.name: T:Godot.AnimationTreePlayer
member.summary: A node graph tool for blending multiple animations bound to an [AnimationPlayer]. Especially useful for animating characters or other skeleton-based rigs. It can combine several animations to form a desired pose. It takes [Animation]s from an [AnimationPlayer] node and mixes them depending on the graph.

member.summary: Sets mix amount of a Mix node given its name and value. A Mix node adds input b to input a by a the amount given by ratio.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationTreePlayer.Blend2NodeSetAmount(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the blend amount of a Blend2 node given its name and value. A Blend2 Node blends two animations with the amount between 0 and 1. At 0, Output is input a. Towards 1, the influence of a gets lessened, the influence of b gets raised. At 1, Output is input b.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationTreePlayer.Blend2NodeGetAmount(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the blend amount of a Blend2 node given its name.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationTreePlayer.Blend2NodeSetFilterPath(System.String,Godot.NodePath,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If [code]enable[/code] is [code]true[/code], the blend2 node with ID [code]id[/code] turns off the track modifying the property at [code]path[/code]. The modified node's children continue to animate.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationTreePlayer.Blend3NodeSetAmount(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the blend amount of a Blend3 node given its name and value. A Blend3 Node blends three animations with the amount between -1 and 1. At -1, Output is input b-. From -1 to 0, the influence of b- gets lessened, the influence of a gets raised and the influence of b+ is 0. At 0, Output is input a. From 0 to 1, the influence of a gets lessened, the influence of b+ gets raised and the influence of b+ is 0. At 1, Output is input b+.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationTreePlayer.Blend3NodeGetAmount(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the blend amount of a Blend3 node given its name.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationTreePlayer.Blend4NodeSetAmount(System.String,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the blend amount of a Blend4 node given its name and value. A Blend4 Node blends two pairs of animations. The two pairs are blended like blend2 and then added together.

member.name: M:Godot.AnimationTreePlayer.Blend4NodeGetAmount(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the blend amount of a Blend4 node given its name.

member.name: T:Godot.Area
member.summary: 3D area that detects [CollisionObject] nodes overlapping, entering, or exiting. Can also alter or override local physics parameters (gravity, damping).

member.name: F:Godot.Area.SpaceOverrideEnum.Disabled
member.summary: This area does not affect gravity/damping.

member.name: F:Godot.Area.SpaceOverrideEnum.Combine
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damping values to whatever has been calculated so far (in [member priority] order).

member.name: F:Godot.Area.SpaceOverrideEnum.CombineReplace
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damping values to whatever has been calculated so far (in [member priority] order), ignoring any lower priority areas.

member.name: F:Godot.Area.SpaceOverrideEnum.Replace
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damping, even the defaults, ignoring any lower priority areas.

member.name: F:Godot.Area.SpaceOverrideEnum.ReplaceCombine
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damping calculated so far (in [member priority] order), but keeps calculating the rest of the areas.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.SpaceOverride
member.summary: Override mode for gravity and damping calculations within this area. See [enum Area.SpaceOverride] for possible values.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.GravityPoint
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], gravity is calculated from a point (set via [member gravity_vec]). Also see [member space_override]. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Area.GravityDistanceScale
member.summary: The falloff factor for point gravity. The greater the value, the faster gravity decreases with distance.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.GravityVec
member.summary: The area's gravity vector (not normalized). If gravity is a point (see [member gravity_point]), this will be the point of attraction.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.Gravity
member.summary: The area's gravity intensity (ranges from -1024 to 1024). This value multiplies the gravity vector. This is useful to alter the force of gravity without altering its direction.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.LinearDamp
member.summary: The rate at which objects stop moving in this area. Represents the linear velocity lost per second. Values range from [code]0[/code] (no damping) to [code]1[/code] (full damping).

member.name: P:Godot.Area.AngularDamp
member.summary: The rate at which objects stop spinning in this area. Represents the angular velocity lost per second. Values range from [code]0[/code] (no damping) to [code]1[/code] (full damping).

member.name: P:Godot.Area.Priority
member.summary: The area's priority. Higher priority areas are processed first. Default value: 0.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.Monitoring
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the area detects bodies or areas entering and exiting it. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Area.Monitorable
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], other monitoring areas can detect this area. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Area.CollisionLayer
member.summary: The area's physics layer(s). Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layers that object A scans. See also [member collision_mask].

member.name: P:Godot.Area.CollisionMask
member.summary: The physics layers this area scans to determine collision detection.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.AudioBusOverride
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the area's audio bus overrides the default audio bus. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Area.AudioBusName
member.summary: The name of the area's audio bus.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.ReverbBusEnable
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the area applies reverb to its associated audio.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.ReverbBusName
member.summary: The reverb bus name to use for this area's associated audio.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.ReverbBusAmount
member.summary: The degree to which this area applies reverb to its associated audio. Ranges from [code]0[/code] to [code]1[/code] with [code]0.1[/code] precision.

member.name: P:Godot.Area.ReverbBusUniformity
member.summary: The degree to which this area's reverb is a uniform effect. Ranges from [code]0[/code] to [code]1[/code] with [code]0.1[/code] precision.

member.name: M:Godot.Area.SetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set/clear individual bits on the collision mask. This simplifies editing which [code]Area[/code] layers this [code]Area[/code] scans.

member.name: M:Godot.Area.GetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask.

member.name: M:Godot.Area.SetCollisionLayerBit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set/clear individual bits on the layer mask. This simplifies editing this [code]Area[/code]'s layers.

member.name: M:Godot.Area.GetCollisionLayerBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an individual bit on the layer mask.

member.name: M:Godot.Area.GetOverlappingBodies
member.summary: Returns a list of intersecting [PhysicsBody]s. For performance reasons (collisions are all processed at the same time) this list is modified once during the physics step, not immediately after objects are moved. Consider using signals instead.

member.name: M:Godot.Area.GetOverlappingAreas
member.summary: Returns a list of intersecting [code]Area[/code]s. For performance reasons (collisions are all processed at the same time) this list is modified once during the physics step, not immediately after objects are moved. Consider using signals instead.

member.name: M:Godot.Area.OverlapsBody(Godot.Node)
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the given body overlaps the Area. Note that the result of this test is not immediate after moving objects. For performance, list of overlaps is updated once per frame and before the physics step. Consider using signals instead.

member.name: M:Godot.Area.OverlapsArea(Godot.Node)
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the given area overlaps the Area. Note that the result of this test is not immediate after moving objects. For performance, list of overlaps is updated once per frame and before the physics step. Consider using signals instead.

member.name: T:Godot.ArrayMesh
member.summary: The [code]ArrayMesh[/code] is used to construct a [Mesh] by specifying the attributes as arrays. The most basic example is the creation of a single triangle [codeblock] var vertices = PoolVector3Array() vertices.push_back(Vector3(0, 1, 0)) vertices.push_back(Vector3(1, 0, 0)) vertices.push_back(Vector3(0, 0, 1)) # Initialize the ArrayMesh. var arr_mesh = ArrayMesh.new() var arrays = [] arrays.resize(ArrayMesh.ARRAY_MAX) arrays[ArrayMesh.ARRAY_VERTEX] = vertices # Create the Mesh. arr_mesh.add_surface_from_arrays(Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES, arrays) var m = MeshInstance.new() m.mesh = arr_mesh [/codeblock] The [code]MeshInstance[/code] is ready to be added to the SceneTree to be shown.

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.NoIndexArray
member.summary: Default value used for index_array_len when no indices are present.

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayWeightsSize
member.summary: Amount of weights/bone indices per vertex (always 4).

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayFormat.Vertex
member.summary: Array format will include vertices (mandatory).

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayFormat.Normal
member.summary: Array format will include normals

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayFormat.Tangent
member.summary: Array format will include tangents

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayFormat.Color
member.summary: Array format will include a color array.

member.summary: Array format will include UVs.

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayFormat.TexUv2
member.summary: Array format will include another set of UVs.

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayFormat.Bones
member.summary: Array format will include bone indices.

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayFormat.Weights
member.summary: Array format will include bone weights.

member.summary: Index array will be used.

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayType.Vertex
member.summary: Vertex array (array of [Vector3] vertices).

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayType.Normal
member.summary: Normal array (array of [Vector3] normals).

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayType.Tangent
member.summary: Tangent array, array of groups of 4 floats. first 3 floats determine the tangent, and the last the binormal direction as -1 or 1.

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayType.Color
member.summary: Vertex array (array of [Color] colors).

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayType.TexUv
member.summary: UV array (array of [Vector3] UVs or float array of groups of 2 floats (u,v)).

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayType.TexUv2
member.summary: Second UV array (array of [Vector3] UVs or float array of groups of 2 floats (u,v)).

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayType.Bones
member.summary: Array of bone indices, as a float array. Each element in groups of 4 floats.

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayType.Weights
member.summary: Array of bone weights, as a float array. Each element in groups of 4 floats.

member.name: F:Godot.ArrayMesh.ArrayType.Index
member.summary: [Array] of integers used as indices referencing vertices, colors, normals, tangents, and textures. All of those arrays must have the same number of elements as the vertex array. No index can be beyond the vertex array size. When this index array is present, it puts the function into "index mode," where the index selects the *i*'th vertex, normal, tangent, color, UV, etc. This means if you want to have different normals or colors along an edge, you have to duplicate the vertices. For triangles, the index array is interpreted as triples, referring to the vertices of each triangle. For lines, the index array is in pairs indicating the start and end of each line.

member.name: P:Godot.ArrayMesh.CustomAabb
member.summary: An overriding bounding box for this mesh.

member.name: M:Godot.ArrayMesh.GetBlendShapeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of blend shapes that the [code]ArrayMesh[/code] holds.

member.name: M:Godot.ArrayMesh.GetBlendShapeName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the name of the blend shape at this index.

member.name: M:Godot.ArrayMesh.ClearBlendShapes
member.summary: Remove all blend shapes from this [code]ArrayMesh[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.ArrayMesh.AddSurfaceFromArrays(Godot.Mesh.PrimitiveType,Godot.Collections.Array,Godot.Collections.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new surface. Surfaces are created to be rendered using a "primitive", which may be PRIMITIVE_POINTS, PRIMITIVE_LINES, PRIMITIVE_LINE_STRIP, PRIMITIVE_LINE_LOOP, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_STRIP, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_FAN. See [Mesh] for details. (As a note, when using indices, it is recommended to only use points, lines or triangles). [method Mesh.get_surface_count] will become the [code]surf_idx[/code] for this new surface. The [code]arrays[/code] argument is an array of arrays. See [enum ArrayType] for the values used in this array. For example, [code]arrays[0][/code] is the array of vertices. That first vertex sub-array is always required; the others are optional. Adding an index array puts this function into "index mode" where the vertex and other arrays become the sources of data and the index array defines the vertex order. All sub-arrays must have the same length as the vertex array or be empty, except for [code]ARRAY_INDEX[/code] if it is used. Adding an index array puts this function into "index mode" where the vertex and other arrays become the sources of data, and the index array defines the order of the vertices. Godot uses clockwise winding order for front faces of triangle primitive modes. <param name="blendShapes">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>
