member.name: F:Godot.Container.NotificationSortChildren
member.summary: Notification for when sorting the children, it must be obeyed immediately.

member.name: M:Godot.Container.QueueSort
member.summary: Queue resort of the contained children. This is called automatically anyway, but can be called upon request.

member.name: M:Godot.Container.FitChildInRect(Godot.Control,Godot.Rect2)
member.summary: Fit a child control in a given rect. This is mainly a helper for creating custom container classes.

member.name: T:Godot.Control
member.summary: Base class for all User Interface or [i]UI[/i] related nodes. [code]Control[/code] features a bounding rectangle that defines its extents, an anchor position relative to its parent and margins that represent an offset to the anchor. The margins update automatically when the node, any of its parents, or the screen size change. For more information on Godot's UI system, anchors, margins, and containers, see the related tutorials in the manual. To build flexible UIs, you'll need a mix of UI elements that inherit from [code]Control[/code] and [Container] nodes. [b]User Interface nodes and input[/b] Godot sends input events to the scene's root node first, by calling [method Node._input]. [method Node._input] forwards the event down the node tree to the nodes under the mouse cursor, or on keyboard focus. To do so, it calls [method MainLoop._input_event]. Call [method accept_event] so no other node receives the event. Once you accepted an input, it becomes handled so [method Node._unhandled_input] will not process it. Only one [code]Control[/code] node can be in keyboard focus. Only the node in focus will receive keyboard events. To get the focus, call [method grab_focus]. [code]Control[/code] nodes lose focus when another node grabs it, or if you hide the node in focus. Set [member mouse_filter] to [constant MOUSE_FILTER_IGNORE] to tell a [code]Control[/code] node to ignore mouse or touch events. You'll need it if you place an icon on top of a button. [Theme] resources change the Control's appearance. If you change the [Theme] on a [code]Control[/code] node, it affects all of its children. To override some of the theme's parameters, call one of the [code]add_*_override[/code] methods, like [method add_font_override]. You can override the theme with the inspector.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NotificationResized
member.summary: Sent when the node changes size. Use [member rect_size] to get the new size.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NotificationMouseEnter
member.summary: Sent when the mouse pointer enters the node.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NotificationMouseExit
member.summary: Sent when the mouse pointer exits the node.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NotificationFocusEnter
member.summary: Sent when the node grabs focus.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NotificationFocusExit
member.summary: Sent when the node loses focus.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NotificationThemeChanged
member.summary: Sent when the node's [member theme] changes, right before Godot redraws the control. Happens when you call one of the [code]add_*_override[/code] methods.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NotificationModalClose
member.summary: Sent when an open modal dialog closes. See [method show_modal].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NotificationScrollBegin
member.summary: Sent when this node is inside a [ScrollContainer] which has begun being scrolled.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NotificationScrollEnd
member.summary: Sent when this node is inside a [ScrollContainer] which has stopped being scrolled.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.Anchor.Begin
member.summary: Snaps one of the 4 anchor's sides to the origin of the node's [code]Rect[/code], in the top left. Use it with one of the [code]anchor_*[/code] member variables, like [member anchor_left]. To change all 4 anchors at once, use [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.Anchor.End
member.summary: Snaps one of the 4 anchor's sides to the end of the node's [code]Rect[/code], in the bottom right. Use it with one of the [code]anchor_*[/code] member variables, like [member anchor_left]. To change all 4 anchors at once, use [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.FocusModeEnum.None
member.summary: The node cannot grab focus. Use with [member focus_mode].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.FocusModeEnum.Click
member.summary: The node can only grab focus on mouse clicks. Use with [member focus_mode].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.FocusModeEnum.All
member.summary: The node can grab focus on mouse click or using the arrows and the Tab keys on the keyboard. Use with [member focus_mode].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.MouseFilterEnum.Stop
member.summary: The control will receive mouse button input events through [method _gui_input] if clicked on. And the control will receive the [signal mouse_entered] and [signal mouse_exited] signals. These events are automatically marked as handled and they will not propagate further to other controls. This also results in blocking signals in other controls.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.MouseFilterEnum.Pass
member.summary: The control will receive mouse button input events through [method _gui_input] if clicked on. And the control will receive the [signal mouse_entered] and [signal mouse_exited] signals. If this control does not handle the event, the parent control (if any) will be considered, and so on until there is no more parent control to potentially handle it. This also allows signals to fire in other controls. Even if no control handled it at all, the event will still be handled automatically, so unhandled input will not be fired.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.MouseFilterEnum.Ignore
member.summary: The control will not receive mouse button input events through [method _gui_input]. Also the control will not receive the [signal mouse_entered] nor [signal mouse_exited] signals. This will not block other controls from receiving these events or firing the signals. Ignored events will not be handled automatically.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Arrow
member.summary: Show the system's arrow mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. Use with [member mouse_default_cursor_shape].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Ibeam
member.summary: Show the system's I-beam mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. The I-beam pointer has a shape similar to "I". It tells the user they can highlight or insert text.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.PointingHand
member.summary: Show the system's pointing hand mouse cursor when the user hovers the node.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Cross
member.summary: Show the system's cross mouse cursor when the user hovers the node.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Wait
member.summary: Show the system's wait mouse cursor, often an hourglass, when the user hovers the node.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Busy
member.summary: Show the system's busy mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. Often an hourglass.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Drag
member.summary: Show the system's drag mouse cursor, often a closed fist or a cross symbol, when the user hovers the node. It tells the user they're currently dragging an item, like a node in the Scene dock.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.CanDrop
member.summary: Show the system's drop mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. It can be an open hand. It tells the user they can drop an item they're currently grabbing, like a node in the Scene dock.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Forbidden
member.summary: Show the system's forbidden mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. Often a crossed circle.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Vsize
member.summary: Show the system's vertical resize mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. A double headed vertical arrow. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel vertically.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Hsize
member.summary: Show the system's horizontal resize mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. A double headed horizontal arrow. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel horizontally.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Bdiagsize
member.summary: Show the system's window resize mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. The cursor is a double headed arrow that goes from the bottom left to the top right. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Fdiagsize
member.summary: Show the system's window resize mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. The cursor is a double headed arrow that goes from the top left to the bottom right, the opposite of [code]CURSOR_BDIAGSIZE[/code]. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Move
member.summary: Show the system's move mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. It shows 2 double-headed arrows at a 90 degree angle. It tells the user they can move a UI element freely.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Vsplit
member.summary: Show the system's vertical split mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. On Windows, it's the same as [code]CURSOR_VSIZE[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Hsplit
member.summary: Show the system's horizontal split mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. On Windows, it's the same as [code]CURSOR_HSIZE[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CursorShape.Help
member.summary: Show the system's help mouse cursor when the user hovers the node, a question mark.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.GrowDirection.Begin
member.summary: The control will grow to the left or top to make up if its minimum size is changed to be greater than its current size on the respective axis.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.GrowDirection.End
member.summary: The control will grow to the right or bottom to make up if its minimum size is changed to be greater than its current size on the respective axis.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.GrowDirection.Both
member.summary: The control will grow in both directions equally to make up if its minimum size is changed to be greater than its current size.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.SizeFlags.Fill
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] to expand the bounds of this node to fill all the available space without pushing any other node. Use with [member size_flags_horizontal] and [member size_flags_vertical].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.SizeFlags.Expand
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] to let this node take all the available space on the axis you flag. If multiple neighboring nodes are set to expand, they'll share the space based on their stretch ratio. See [member size_flags_stretch_ratio]. Use with [member size_flags_horizontal] and [member size_flags_vertical].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.SizeFlags.ExpandFill
member.summary: Sets the node's size flags to both fill and expand. See the 2 constants above for more information.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.SizeFlags.ShrinkCenter
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] to center the node in itself. It centers the control based on its bounding box, so it doesn't work with the fill or expand size flags. Use with [member size_flags_horizontal] and [member size_flags_vertical].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.SizeFlags.ShrinkEnd
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] to align the node with its end, either the bottom or the right edge. It doesn't work with the fill or expand size flags. Use with [member size_flags_horizontal] and [member size_flags_vertical].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.TopLeft
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the top-left of the parent control's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.TopRight
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the top-right of the parent control's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.BottomLeft
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the bottom-left of the parent control's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.BottomRight
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the bottom-right of the parent control's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.CenterLeft
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the center of the left edge of the parent control's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.CenterTop
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the center of the top edge of the parent control's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.CenterRight
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the center of the right edge of the parent control's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.CenterBottom
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the center of the bottom edge of the parent control's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.Center
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the center of the parent control's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.LeftWide
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the left edge of the parent control. The left margin becomes relative to the left edge and the top margin relative to the top left corner of the node's parent. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.TopWide
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the top edge of the parent control. The left margin becomes relative to the top left corner, the top margin relative to the top edge, and the right margin relative to the top right corner of the node's parent. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.RightWide
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the right edge of the parent control. The right margin becomes relative to the right edge and the top margin relative to the top right corner of the node's parent. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.BottomWide
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the bottom edge of the parent control. The left margin becomes relative to the bottom left corner, the bottom margin relative to the bottom edge, and the right margin relative to the bottom right corner of the node's parent. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.VcenterWide
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to a vertical line that cuts the parent control in half. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.HcenterWide
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to a horizontal line that cuts the parent control in half. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.LayoutPreset.Wide
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the respective corners of the parent control. Set all 4 margins to 0 after you applied this preset and the [code]Control[/code] will fit its parent control. This is equivalent to to the "Full Rect" layout option in the editor. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.AnchorLeft
member.summary: Anchors the left edge of the node to the origin, the center or the end of its parent control. It changes how the left margin updates when the node moves or changes size. You can use one of the [code]ANCHOR_*[/code] constants for convenience.Default value: [code]ANCHOR_BEGIN[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.AnchorTop
member.summary: Anchors the top edge of the node to the origin, the center or the end of its parent control. It changes how the top margin updates when the node moves or changes size. You can use one of the [code]ANCHOR_*[/code] constants for convenience. Default value: [code]ANCHOR_BEGIN[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.AnchorRight
member.summary: Anchors the right edge of the node to the origin, the center or the end of its parent control. It changes how the right margin updates when the node moves or changes size. You can use one of the [code]ANCHOR_*[/code] constants for convenience. Default value: [code]ANCHOR_BEGIN[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.AnchorBottom
member.summary: Anchors the bottom edge of the node to the origin, the center, or the end of its parent control. It changes how the bottom margin updates when the node moves or changes size. You can use one of the [code]ANCHOR_*[/code] constants for convenience. Default value: [code]ANCHOR_BEGIN[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.MarginLeft
member.summary: Distance between the node's left edge and its parent control, based on [member anchor_left]. Margins are often controlled by one or multiple parent [Container] nodes, so you should not modify them manually if your node is a direct child of a [Container]. Margins update automatically when you move or resize the node.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.MarginTop
member.summary: Distance between the node's top edge and its parent control, based on [member anchor_top]. Margins are often controlled by one or multiple parent [Container] nodes, so you should not modify them manually if your node is a direct child of a [Container]. Margins update automatically when you move or resize the node.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.MarginRight
member.summary: Distance between the node's right edge and its parent control, based on [member anchor_right]. Margins are often controlled by one or multiple parent [Container] nodes, so you should not modify them manually if your node is a direct child of a [Container]. Margins update automatically when you move or resize the node.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.MarginBottom
member.summary: Distance between the node's bottom edge and its parent control, based on [member anchor_bottom]. Margins are often controlled by one or multiple parent [Container] nodes, so you should not modify them manually if your node is a direct child of a [Container]. Margins update automatically when you move or resize the node.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.GrowHorizontal
member.summary: Controls the direction on the horizontal axis in which the control should grow if its horizontal minimum size is changed to be greater than its current size, as the control always has to be at least the minimum size.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.GrowVertical
member.summary: Controls the direction on the vertical axis in which the control should grow if its vertical minimum size is changed to be greater than its current size, as the control always has to be at least the minimum size.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectPosition
member.summary: The node's position, relative to its parent. It corresponds to the rectangle's top-left corner. The property is not affected by [member rect_pivot_offset].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectGlobalPosition
member.summary: The node's global position, relative to the world (usually to the top-left corner of the window).

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectSize
member.summary: The size of the node's bounding rectangle, in pixels. [Container] nodes update this property automatically.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectMinSize
member.summary: The minimum size of the node's bounding rectangle. If you set it to a value greater than (0, 0), the node's bounding rectangle will always have at least this size, even if its content is smaller. If it's set to (0, 0), the node sizes automatically to fit its content, be it a texture or child nodes.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectRotation
member.summary: The node's rotation around its pivot, in degrees. See [member rect_pivot_offset] to change the pivot's position.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectScale
member.summary: The node's scale, relative to its [member rect_size]. Change this property to scale the node around its [member rect_pivot_offset].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectPivotOffset
member.summary: By default, the node's pivot is its top-left corner. When you change its [member rect_scale], it will scale around this pivot. Set this property to [member rect_size] / 2 to center the pivot in the node's rectangle.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectClipContent
member.summary: Enables whether rendering of children should be clipped to this control's rectangle. If true, parts of a child which would be visibly outside of this control's rectangle will not be rendered.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.HintTooltip
member.summary: Changes the tooltip text. The tooltip appears when the user's mouse cursor stays idle over this control for a few moments, provided that the [member mouse_filter] property is not [constant MOUSE_FILTER_IGNORE].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusNeighbourLeft
member.summary: Tells Godot which node it should give keyboard focus to if the user presses the left arrow on the keyboard or left on a gamepad by default. You can change the key by editing the [code]ui_left[/code] input action. The node must be a [code]Control[/code]. If this property is not set, Godot will give focus to the closest [code]Control[/code] to the left of this one.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusNeighbourTop
member.summary: Tells Godot which node it should give keyboard focus to if the user presses the top arrow on the keyboard or top on a gamepad by default. You can change the key by editing the [code]ui_top[/code] input action. The node must be a [code]Control[/code]. If this property is not set, Godot will give focus to the closest [code]Control[/code] to the bottom of this one.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusNeighbourRight
member.summary: Tells Godot which node it should give keyboard focus to if the user presses the right arrow on the keyboard or right on a gamepad by default. You can change the key by editing the [code]ui_right[/code] input action. The node must be a [code]Control[/code]. If this property is not set, Godot will give focus to the closest [code]Control[/code] to the bottom of this one.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusNeighbourBottom
member.summary: Tells Godot which node it should give keyboard focus to if the user presses the down arrow on the keyboard or down on a gamepad by default. You can change the key by editing the [code]ui_down[/code] input action. The node must be a [code]Control[/code]. If this property is not set, Godot will give focus to the closest [code]Control[/code] to the bottom of this one.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusNext
member.summary: Tells Godot which node it should give keyboard focus to if the user presses Tab on a keyboard by default. You can change the key by editing the [code]ui_focus_next[/code] input action. If this property is not set, Godot will select a "best guess" based on surrounding nodes in the scene tree.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusPrevious
member.summary: Tells Godot which node it should give keyboard focus to if the user presses Shift+Tab on a keyboard by default. You can change the key by editing the [code]ui_focus_prev[/code] input action. If this property is not set, Godot will select a "best guess" based on surrounding nodes in the scene tree.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusMode
member.summary: The focus access mode for the control (None, Click or All). Only one Control can be focused at the same time, and it will receive keyboard signals.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.MouseFilter
member.summary: Controls whether the control will be able to receive mouse button input events through [method _gui_input] and how these events should be handled. Also controls whether the control can receive the [signal mouse_entered], and [signal mouse_exited] signals. See the constants to learn what each does.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.MouseDefaultCursorShape
member.summary: The default cursor shape for this control. Useful for Godot plugins and applications or games that use the system's mouse cursors. [b]Note:[/b] On Linux, shapes may vary depending on the cursor theme of the system.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.SizeFlagsHorizontal
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] nodes how they should resize and place the node on the X axis. Use one of the [code]SIZE_*[/code] constants to change the flags. See the constants to learn what each does.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.SizeFlagsVertical
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] nodes how they should resize and place the node on the Y axis. Use one of the [code]SIZE_*[/code] constants to change the flags. See the constants to learn what each does.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.SizeFlagsStretchRatio
member.summary: If the node and at least one of its neighbours uses the [code]SIZE_EXPAND[/code] size flag, the parent [Container] will let it take more or less space depending on this property. If this node has a stretch ratio of 2 and its neighbour a ratio of 1, this node will take two thirds of the available space.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.Theme
member.summary: Changing this property replaces the current [Theme] resource this node and all its [code]Control[/code] children use.

member.name: M:Godot.Control._GetMinimumSize
member.summary: Returns the minimum size for this control. See [member rect_min_size].

member.name: M:Godot.Control._GuiInput(Godot.InputEvent)
member.summary: Use this method to process and accept inputs on UI elements. See [method accept_event]. Replaces Godot 2's [code]_input_event[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Control.CanDropData(Godot.Vector2,System.Object)
member.summary: Godot calls this method to test if [code]data[/code] from a control's [method get_drag_data] can be dropped at [code]position[/code]. [code]position[/code] is local to this control. This method should only be used to test the data. Process the data in [method drop_data]. [codeblock] extends Control func can_drop_data(position, data): # check position if it is relevant to you # otherwise just check data return typeof(data) == TYPE_DICTIONARY and data.has('expected') [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.Control.DropData(Godot.Vector2,System.Object)
M:Godot.Control.GetDragData(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Godot calls this method to get data that can be dragged and dropped onto controls that expect drop data. Return null if there is no data to drag. Controls that want to receive drop data should implement [method can_drop_data] and [method drop_data]. [code]position[/code] is local to this control. Drag may be forced with [method force_drag]. A preview that will follow the mouse that should represent the data can be set with [method set_drag_preview]. A good time to set the preview is in this method. [codeblock] extends Control func get_drag_data(position): var mydata = make_data() set_drag_preview(make_preview(mydata)) return mydata [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AcceptEvent
member.summary: Marks an input event as handled. Once you accept an input event, it stops propagating, even to nodes listening to [method Node._unhandled_input] or [method Node._unhandled_key_input].

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetMinimumSize
member.summary: Returns the minimum size for this control. See [member rect_min_size].

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetBegin(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets [member margin_left] and [member margin_top] at the same time.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetEnd(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets [member margin_right] and [member margin_bottom] at the same time.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetRotation(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the rotation (in radians).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetBegin
member.summary: Returns [member margin_left] and [member margin_top]. See also [member rect_position].

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetEnd
member.summary: Returns [member margin_right] and [member margin_bottom].

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetRotation
member.summary: Returns the rotation (in radians).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetParentAreaSize
member.summary: Returns the width/height occupied in the parent control.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetRect
member.summary: Returns the position and size of the control relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control. See [member rect_position] and [member rect_size].

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetGlobalRect
member.summary: Returns the position and size of the control relative to the top-left corner of the screen. See [member rect_position] and [member rect_size].

member.name: M:Godot.Control.ShowModal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Displays a control as modal. Control must be a subwindow. Modal controls capture the input signals until closed or the area outside them is accessed. When a modal control loses focus, or the ESC key is pressed, they automatically hide. Modal controls are used extensively for popup dialogs and menus.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.HasFocus
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if this is the current focused control. See [member focus_mode].

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GrabFocus
member.summary: Steal the focus from another control and become the focused control (see [member focus_mode]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.ReleaseFocus
member.summary: Give up the focus. No other control will be able to receive keyboard input.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetFocusOwner
member.summary: Returns the control that has the keyboard focus or [code]null[/code] if none.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddIconOverride(System.String,Godot.Texture)
member.summary: Overrides the [code]name[/code] icon in the [member theme] resource the node uses. If [code]icon[/code] is empty, Godot clears the override.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddShaderOverride(System.String,Godot.Shader)
member.summary: Overrides the [code]name[/code] shader in the [member theme] resource the node uses. If [code]shader[/code] is empty, Godot clears the override.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddStyleboxOverride(System.String,Godot.StyleBox)
member.summary: Overrides the [code]name[/code] [StyleBox] in the [member theme] resource the node uses. If [code]stylebox[/code] is empty, Godot clears the override.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddFontOverride(System.String,Godot.Font)
member.summary: Overrides the [code]name[/code] font in the [member theme] resource the node uses. If [code]font[/code] is empty, Godot clears the override.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddColorOverride(System.String,Godot.Color)
member.summary: Overrides the color in the [member theme] resource the node uses.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddConstantOverride(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Overrides an integer constant in the [member theme] resource the node uses. If the [code]constant[/code] is invalid, Godot clears the override.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetParentControl
member.summary: Returns the parent control node.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetTooltip(System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2})
member.summary: Returns the tooltip, which will appear when the cursor is resting over this control. <param name="atPosition">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetCursorShape(System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2})
member.summary: Returns the mouse cursor shape the control displays on mouse hover. See [enum CursorShape]. <param name="position">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Control.ForceDrag(System.Object,Godot.Control)
member.summary: Forces drag and bypasses [method get_drag_data] and [method set_drag_preview] by passing [code]data[/code] and [code]preview[/code]. Drag will start even if the mouse is neither over nor pressed on this control. The methods [method can_drop_data] and [method drop_data] must be implemented on controls that want to receive drop data.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetDragForwarding(Godot.Control)
member.summary: Forwards the handling of this control's drag and drop to [code]target[/code] control. Forwarding can be implemented in the target control similar to the methods [method get_drag_data], [method can_drop_data], and [method drop_data] but with two differences: 1. The function name must be suffixed with [b]_fw[/b] 2. The function must take an extra argument that is the control doing the forwarding [codeblock] # ThisControl.gd extends Control func _ready(): set_drag_forwarding(target_control) # TargetControl.gd extends Control func can_drop_data_fw(position, data, from_control): return true func drop_data_fw(position, data, from_control): my_handle_data(data) func get_drag_data_fw(position, from_control): set_drag_preview(my_preview) return my_data() [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetDragPreview(Godot.Control)
member.summary: Shows the given control at the mouse pointer. A good time to call this method is in [method get_drag_data].

member.name: T:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape
member.summary: Convex polygon shape resource, which can be added to a [PhysicsBody] or area.

member.name: P:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape.Points
member.summary: The list of 3D points forming the convex polygon shape.

member.name: T:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape2D
member.summary: Convex Polygon Shape for 2D physics. A convex polygon, whatever its shape, is internally decomposed into as many convex polygons as needed to ensure all collision checks against it are always done on convex polygons (which are faster to check). The main difference between a [code]ConvexPolygonShape2D[/code] and a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] is that a concave polygon assumes it is concave and uses a more complex method of collision detection, and a convex one forces itself to be convex in order to speed up collision detection.

member.name: P:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape2D.Points
member.summary: The polygon's list of vertices. Can be in either clockwise or counterclockwise order.

member.name: M:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape2D.SetPointCloud(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Based on the set of points provided, this creates and assigns the [member points] property using the convex hull algorithm. Removing all unneeded points. See [method Geometry.convex_hull_2d] for details.

member.name: P:Godot.CPUParticles.ColorRamp
member.summary: Each particle's vertex color will vary along this [GradientTexture].

member.name: T:Godot.CSGBox
member.summary: This node allows you to create a box for use with the CSG system.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGBox.Width
member.summary: Width of the box measured from the center of the box.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGBox.Height
member.summary: Height of the box measured from the center of the box.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGBox.Depth
member.summary: Depth of the box measured from the center of the box.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGBox.Material
member.summary: The material used to render the box.

member.name: T:Godot.CSGCombiner
member.summary: For complex arrangements of shapes, it is sometimes needed to add structure to your CSG nodes. The CSGCombiner node allows you to create this structure. The node encapsulates the result of the CSG operations of its children. In this way, it is possible to do operations on one set of shapes that are children of one CSGCombiner node, and a set of separate operations on a second set of shapes that are children of a second CSGCombiner node, and then do an operation that takes the two end results as its input to create the final shape.

member.name: T:Godot.CSGCylinder
member.summary: This node allows you to create a cylinder (or cone) for use with the CSG system.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGCylinder.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the cylinder.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGCylinder.Height
member.summary: The height of the cylinder.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGCylinder.Sides
member.summary: The number of sides of the cylinder, the higher this number the more detail there will be in the cylinder.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGCylinder.Cone
member.summary: If true a cone is created, the [member radius] will only apply to one side.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGCylinder.SmoothFaces
member.summary: If true the normals of the cylinder are set to give a smooth effect making the cylinder seem rounded. When false the cylinder will have a flat shaded look.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGCylinder.Material
member.summary: The material used to render the cylinder.

member.name: T:Godot.CSGMesh
member.summary: This CSG node allows you to use any mesh resource as a CSG shape, provided it is closed, does not self-intersect, does not contain internal faces and has no edges that connect to more then two faces.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGMesh.Mesh
member.summary: The mesh resource to use as a CSG shape.

member.name: T:Godot.CSGPolygon
member.summary: This node takes a 2D polygon shape and extrudes it to create a 3D mesh.

member.name: F:Godot.CSGPolygon.PathRotationEnum.Path
member.summary: Slice is rotated around the up vector of the path.

member.name: F:Godot.CSGPolygon.PathRotationEnum.PathFollow
member.summary: Slice is rotate to match the path exactly.

member.name: F:Godot.CSGPolygon.ModeEnum.Depth
member.summary: Shape is extruded to [member depth].

member.summary: Degrees to rotate our extrusion for each slice when [member mode] is [constant MODE_SPIN].

member.name: P:Godot.CSGPolygon.SpinSides
member.summary: Number of extrusion when [member mode] is [constant MODE_SPIN].

member.name: P:Godot.CSGPolygon.PathNode
member.summary: The [Shape] object containing the path along which we extrude when [member mode] is [constant MODE_PATH].

member.name: P:Godot.CSGPolygon.PathInterval
member.summary: Interval at which a new extrusion slice is added along the path when [member mode] is [constant MODE_PATH].

member.name: P:Godot.CSGPolygon.PathRotation
member.summary: The method by which each slice is rotated along the path when [member mode] is [constant MODE_PATH].

member.name: P:Godot.CSGPolygon.PathLocal
member.summary: If false we extrude centered on our path, if true we extrude in relation to the position of our CSGPolygon when [member mode] is [constant MODE_PATH].

member.name: P:Godot.CSGPolygon.PathContinuousU
member.summary: If true the u component of our uv will continuously increase in unison with the distance traveled along our path when [member mode] is [constant MODE_PATH].

member.name: P:Godot.CSGPolygon.PathJoined
member.summary: If true the start and end of our path are joined together ensuring there is no seam when [member mode] is [constant MODE_PATH].

member.name: P:Godot.CSGPolygon.SmoothFaces
member.summary: Generates smooth normals so smooth shading is applied to our mesh.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGPolygon.Material
member.summary: Material to use for the resulting mesh.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGPrimitive.InvertFaces
member.summary: Invert the faces of the mesh.

member.name: T:Godot.CSGShape
member.summary: This is the CSG base class that provides CSG operation support to the various CSG nodes in Godot.

member.name: F:Godot.CSGShape.OperationEnum.Union
member.summary: Geometry of both primitives is merged, intersecting geometry is removed.

member.name: F:Godot.CSGShape.OperationEnum.Intersection
member.summary: Only intersecting geometry remains, the rest is removed.

member.name: F:Godot.CSGShape.OperationEnum.Subtraction
member.summary: The second shape is susbtracted from the first, leaving a dent with it's shape.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGShape.Operation
member.summary: The operation that is performed on this shape. This is ignored for the first CSG child node as the operation is between this node and the previous child of this nodes parent.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGShape.CalculateTangents
member.summary: Calculate tangents for the CSG shape which allows the use of normal maps. This is only applied on the root shape, this setting is ignored on any child.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGShape.UseCollision
member.summary: Adds a collision shape to the physics engine for our CSG shape. This will always act like a static body. Note that the collision shape is still active even if the CSG shape itself is hidden.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGShape.CollisionLayer
member.summary: The physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers work like a tagging system, and are not visual. A collidable can use these layers to select with which objects it can collide, using the collision_mask property. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

member.name: P:Godot.CSGShape.CollisionMask
member.summary: The physics layers this CSG shape scans for collisions.

member.name: M:Godot.CSGShape.IsRootShape
member.summary: Returns true if this is a root shape and is thus the object that is rendered.

member.name: M:Godot.CSGShape.SetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets individual bits on the collision mask. Use this if you only need to change one layer's value.

member.name: M:Godot.CSGShape.GetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask.

member.name: M:Godot.CSGShape.SetCollisionLayerBit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets individual bits on the layer mask. Use this if you only need to change one layer's value.

member.name: M:Godot.CSGShape.GetCollisionLayerBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask.

member.name: T:Godot.Curve

member.name: F:Godot.Curve.TangentMode.Free
member.summary: The tangent on this side of the point is user-defined.

member.name: F:Godot.Curve.TangentMode.Linear
member.summary: The curve calculates the tangent on this side of the point as the slope halfway towards the adjacent point.

member.name: F:Godot.Curve.TangentMode.ModeCount
member.summary: The total number of available tangent modes.

member.name: P:Godot.Curve.MinValue
member.summary: The minimum value the curve can reach. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Curve.MaxValue
member.summary: The maximum value the curve can reach. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.summary: Adds a point to the curve. For each side, if the [code]*_mode[/code] is [code]TANGENT_LINEAR[/code], the [code]*_tangent[/code] angle (in degrees) uses the slope of the curve halfway to the adjacent point. Allows custom assignments to the [code]*_tangent[/code] angle if [code]*_mode[/code] is set to [code]TANGENT_FREE[/code].

member.summary: Assigns the vertical position [code]y[/code] to the point at [code]index[/code].

member.summary: Sets the offset from [code]0.5[/code]

member.name: M:Godot.Curve.Interpolate(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the y value for the point that would exist at x-position [code]offset[/code] along the curve.

member.summary: Returns the y value for the point that would exist at x-position [code]offset[/code] along the curve using the baked cache. Bakes the curve's points if not already baked.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve.CleanDupes
member.summary: Removes points that are closer than [code]CMP_EPSILON[/code] (0.00001) units to their neighbor on the curve.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve.Bake
member.summary: Recomputes the baked cache of points for the curve.

member.name: T:Godot.Curve2D
member.summary: This class describes a Bezier curve in 2D space. It is mainly used to give a shape to a [Path2D], but can be manually sampled for other purposes. It keeps a cache of precalculated points along the curve, to speed further calculations up.

member.name: P:Godot.Curve2D.BakeInterval
member.summary: The distance in pixels between two adjacent cached points. Changing it forces the cache to be recomputed the next time the [method get_baked_points] or [method get_baked_length] function is called. The smaller the distance, the more points in the cache and the more memory it will consume, so use with care.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetPointCount
member.summary: Returns the number of points describing the curve.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.AddPoint(Godot.Vector2,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2},System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2},System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a point to a curve, at [code]position[/code], with control points [code]in[/code] and [code]out[/code]. If [code]at_position[/code] is given, the point is inserted before the point number [code]at_position[/code], moving that point (and every point after) after the inserted point. If [code]at_position[/code] is not given, or is an illegal value ([code]at_position <0[/code] or [code]at_position >= [method get_point_count][/code]), the point will be appended at the end of the point list. <param name="@in">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param> <param name="@out">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.SetPointPosition(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the position for the vertex [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetPointPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the vertex [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns [code](0, 0)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.SetPointIn(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the position of the control point leading to the vertex [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetPointIn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the control point leading to the vertex [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns [code](0, 0)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.SetPointOut(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the position of the control point leading out of the vertex [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetPointOut(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the control point leading out of the vertex [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns [code](0, 0)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.RemovePoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the point [code]idx[/code] from the curve. Sends an error to the console if [code]idx[/code] is out of bounds.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.ClearPoints
member.summary: Removes all points from the curve.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.Interpolate(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the position between the vertex [code]idx[/code] and the vertex [code]idx + 1[/code], where [code]t[/code] controls if the point is the first vertex ([code]t = 0.0[/code]), the last vertex ([code]t = 1.0[/code]), or in between. Values of [code]t[/code] outside the range ([code]0.0 >= t <=1[/code]) give strange, but predictable results. If [code]idx[/code] is out of bounds it is truncated to the first or last vertex, and [code]t[/code] is ignored. If the curve has no points, the function sends an error to the console, and returns [code](0, 0)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.Interpolatef(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the position at the vertex [code]fofs[/code]. It calls [method interpolate] using the integer part of [code]fofs[/code] as [code]idx[/code], and its fractional part as [code]t[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetBakedLength
member.summary: Returns the total length of the curve, based on the cached points. Given enough density (see [member bake_interval]), it should be approximate enough.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.InterpolateBaked(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a point within the curve at position [code]offset[/code], where [code]offset[/code] is measured as a pixel distance along the curve. To do that, it finds the two cached points where the [code]offset[/code] lies between, then interpolates the values. This interpolation is cubic if [code]cubic[/code] is set to true, or linear if set to false. Cubic interpolation tends to follow the curves better, but linear is faster (and often, precise enough).

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetBakedPoints
member.summary: Returns the cache of points as a [PoolVector2Array].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetClosestPoint(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the closest point (in curve's local space) to [code]to_point[/code]. [code]to_point[/code] must be in this curve's local space.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetClosestOffset(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the closest offset to [code]to_point[/code]. This offset is meant to be used in [method interpolate_baked]. [code]to_point[/code] must be in this curve's local space.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.Tessellate(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a list of points along the curve, with a curvature controlled point density. That is, the curvier parts will have more points than the straighter parts. This approximation makes straight segments between each point, then subdivides those segments until the resulting shape is similar enough. [code]max_stages[/code] controls how many subdivisions a curve segment may face before it is considered approximate enough. Each subdivision splits the segment in half, so the default 5 stages may mean up to 32 subdivisions per curve segment. Increase with care! [code]tolerance_degrees[/code] controls how many degrees the midpoint of a segment may deviate from the real curve, before the segment has to be subdivided.

member.name: T:Godot.Curve3D
member.summary: This class describes a Bezier curve in 3D space. It is mainly used to give a shape to a [Path], but can be manually sampled for other purposes. It keeps a cache of precalculated points along the curve, to speed further calculations up.

member.name: P:Godot.Curve3D.BakeInterval
member.summary: The distance in meters between two adjacent cached points. Changing it forces the cache to be recomputed the next time the [method get_baked_points] or [method get_baked_length] function is called. The smaller the distance, the more points in the cache and the more memory it will consume, so use with care.

member.name: P:Godot.Curve3D.UpVectorEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the curve will bake up vectors used for orientation. This is used when a [member PathFollow.rotation_mode] is set to [code]ROTATION_ORIENTED[/code], see [PathFollow] for details. Changing it forces the cache to be recomputed.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetPointCount
member.summary: Returns the number of points describing the curve.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.AddPoint(Godot.Vector3,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector3},System.Nullable{Godot.Vector3},System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a point to a curve, at [code]position[/code], with control points [code]in[/code] and [code]out[/code]. If [code]at_position[/code] is not given, or is an illegal value ([code]at_position <0[/code] or [code]at_position >= [method get_point_count][/code]), the point will be appended at the end of the point list. <param name="@in">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector3(0, 0, 0)</param> <param name="@out">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector3(0, 0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.SetPointPosition(System.Int32,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the position for the vertex [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetPointPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the vertex [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns [code](0, 0, 0)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.SetPointTilt(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the tilt angle in radians for the point [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console. The tilt controls the rotation along the look-at axis an object traveling the path would have. In the case of a curve controlling a [PathFollow], this tilt is an offset over the natural tilt the [PathFollow] calculates.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetPointTilt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the tilt angle in radians for the point [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns [code]0[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.SetPointIn(System.Int32,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the position of the control point leading to the vertex [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.summary: Returns the position of the control point leading to the vertex [code]idx[/code]. If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns [code](0, 0, 0)[/code].

member.summary: Returns the position between the vertex [code]idx[/code] and the vertex [code]idx + 1[/code], where [code]t[/code] controls if the point is the first vertex ([code]t = 0.0[/code]), the last vertex ([code]t = 1.0[/code]), or in between. Values of [code]t[/code] outside the range ([code]0.0 >= t <=1[/code]) give strange, but predictable results. If [code]idx[/code] is out of bounds it is truncated to the first or last vertex, and [code]t[/code] is ignored. If the curve has no points, the function sends an error to the console, and returns [code](0, 0, 0)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.Interpolatef(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the position at the vertex [code]fofs[/code]. It calls [method interpolate] using the integer part of [code]fofs[/code] as [code]idx[/code], and its fractional part as [code]t[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetBakedLength
member.summary: Returns the total length of the curve, based on the cached points. Given enough density (see [member bake_interval]), it should be approximate enough.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.InterpolateBaked(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a point within the curve at position [code]offset[/code], where [code]offset[/code] is measured as a pixel distance along the curve. To do that, it finds the two cached points where the [code]offset[/code] lies between, then interpolates the values. This interpolation is cubic if [code]cubic[/code] is set to true, or linear if set to false. Cubic interpolation tends to follow the curves better, but linear is faster (and often, precise enough).

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.InterpolateBakedUpVector(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an up vector within the curve at position [code]offset[/code], where [code]offset[/code] is measured as a distance in 3D units along the curve. To do that, it finds the two cached up vectors where the [code]offset[/code] lies between, then interpolates the values. If [code]apply_tilt[/code] is [code]true[/code], an interpolated tilt is applied to the interpolated up vector. If the curve has no up vectors, the function sends an error to the console, and returns [code](0, 1, 0)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetBakedPoints
member.summary: Returns the cache of points as a [PoolVector3Array].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetBakedTilts
member.summary: Returns the cache of tilts as a [PoolRealArray].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetBakedUpVectors
member.summary: Returns the cache of up vectors as a [PoolVector3Array]. If [member up_vector_enabled] is [code]false[/code], the cache will be empty.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetClosestPoint(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the closest point (in curve's local space) to [code]to_point[/code]. [code]to_point[/code] must be in this curve's local space.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetClosestOffset(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the closest offset to [code]to_point[/code]. This offset is meant to be used in [method interpolate_baked] or [method interpolate_baked_up_vector]. [code]to_point[/code] must be in this curve's local space.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.Tessellate(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a list of points along the curve, with a curvature controlled point density. That is, the curvier parts will have more points than the straighter parts. This approximation makes straight segments between each point, then subdivides those segments until the resulting shape is similar enough. [code]max_stages[/code] controls how many subdivisions a curve segment may face before it is considered approximate enough. Each subdivision splits the segment in half, so the default 5 stages may mean up to 32 subdivisions per curve segment. Increase with care! [code]tolerance_degrees[/code] controls how many degrees the midpoint of a segment may deviate from the real curve, before the segment has to be subdivided.

member.name: T:Godot.CurveTexture
member.summary: Renders a given [Curve] provided to it. Simplifies the task of drawing curves and/or saving them as image files.

member.name: P:Godot.CurveTexture.Width
member.summary: The width of the texture.

member.name: P:Godot.CurveTexture.Curve
member.summary: The [code]curve[/code] rendered onto the texture.

member.name: T:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D
member.summary: Damped spring constraint for 2D physics. This resembles a spring joint that always wants to go back to a given length.

member.name: P:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.Length
member.summary: The spring joint's maximum length. The two attached bodies cannot stretch it past this value. Default value: [code]50[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.RestLength
member.summary: When the bodies attached to the spring joint move they stretch or squash it. The joint always tries to resize towards this length. Default value: [code]0[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.Stiffness
member.summary: The higher the value, the less the bodies attached to the joint will deform it. The joint applies an opposing force to the bodies, the product of the stiffness multiplied by the size difference from its resting length. Default value: [code]20[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.Damping
member.summary: The spring joint's damping ratio. A value between [code]0[/code] and [code]1[/code]. When the two bodies move into different directions the system tries to align them to the spring axis again. A high [code]damping[/code] value forces the attached bodies to align faster. Default value: [code]1[/code]

member.name: T:Godot.DirectionalLight
member.summary: A directional light is a type of [Light] node that models an infinite number of parallel rays covering the entire scene. It is used for lights with strong intensity that are located far away from the scene to model sunlight or moonlight. The worldspace location of the DirectionalLight transform (origin) is ignored. Only the basis is used do determine light direction.

member.name: F:Godot.DirectionalLight.ShadowMode.Orthogonal
member.summary: Renders the entire scene's shadow map from an orthogonal point of view. May result in blockier shadows on close objects.

member.name: F:Godot.DirectionalLight.ShadowMode.Parallel2Splits
member.summary: Splits the view frustum in 2 areas, each with its own shadow map.

member.name: F:Godot.DirectionalLight.ShadowMode.Parallel4Splits
member.summary: Splits the view frustum in 4 areas, each with its own shadow map.

member.name: F:Godot.DirectionalLight.ShadowDepthRange.Stable
member.summary: Keeps the shadow stable when the camera moves, at the cost of lower effective shadow resolution. Default value.

member.name: F:Godot.DirectionalLight.ShadowDepthRange.Optimized
member.summary: Tries to achieve maximum shadow resolution. May result in saw effect on shadow edges.

member.name: P:Godot.DirectionalLight.DirectionalShadowMode
member.summary: The light's shadow rendering algorithm. See [enum ShadowMode].

member.name: P:Godot.DirectionalLight.DirectionalShadowSplit1
member.summary: The distance from camera to shadow split 1. Relative to [member directional_shadow_max_distance]. Only used when [member directional_shadow_mode] is one of the [code]SHADOW_PARALLEL_*_SPLITS[/code] constants.

member.name: P:Godot.DirectionalLight.DirectionalShadowSplit2
member.summary: The distance from shadow split 1 to split 2. Relative to [member directional_shadow_max_distance]. Only used when [member directional_shadow_mode] is [code]SHADOW_PARALLEL_3_SPLITS[/code] or [code]SHADOW_PARALLEL_4_SPLITS[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.DirectionalLight.DirectionalShadowSplit3
member.summary: The distance from shadow split 2 to split 3. Relative to [member directional_shadow_max_distance]. Only used when [member directional_shadow_mode] is [code]SHADOW_PARALLEL_4_SPLITS[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.DirectionalLight.DirectionalShadowBlendSplits
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], shadow detail is sacrificed in exchange for smoother transitions between splits. Default value:[code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.DirectionalLight.DirectionalShadowNormalBias
member.summary: Can be used to fix special cases of self shadowing when objects are perpendicular to the light.

member.name: P:Godot.DirectionalLight.DirectionalShadowBiasSplitScale
member.summary: Amount of extra bias for shadow splits that are far away. If self shadowing occurs only on the splits far away, this value can fix them.

member.name: P:Godot.DirectionalLight.DirectionalShadowDepthRange
member.summary: Optimizes shadow rendering for detail versus movement. See [enum ShadowDepthRange].

member.name: P:Godot.DirectionalLight.DirectionalShadowMaxDistance
member.summary: The maximum distance for shadow splits.

member.name: T:Godot.Directory
M:Godot.Directory.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Open an existing directory of the filesystem. The [i]path[/i] argument can be within the project tree ([code]res://folder[/code]), the user directory ([code]user://folder[/code]) or an absolute path of the user filesystem (e.g. [code]/tmp/folder[/code] or [code]C:\tmp\folder[/code]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@GlobalScope] (OK or ERR_*).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.ListDirBegin(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialise the stream used to list all files and directories using the [method get_next] function, closing the current opened stream if needed. Once the stream has been processed, it should typically be closed with [method list_dir_end]. If you pass [code]skip_navigational[/code], then [code].[/code] and [code]..[/code] would be filtered out. If you pass [code]skip_hidden[/code], then hidden files would be filtered out.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetNext
member.summary: Return the next element (file or directory) in the current directory (including [code].[/code] and [code]..[/code], unless [code]skip_navigational[/code] was given to [method list_dir_begin]). The name of the file or directory is returned (and not its full path). Once the stream has been fully processed, the method returns an empty String and closes the stream automatically (i.e. [method list_dir_end] would not be mandatory in such a case).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.CurrentIsDir
member.summary: Return whether the current item processed with the last [method get_next] call is a directory ([code].[/code] and [code]..[/code] are considered directories).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.ListDirEnd
member.summary: Close the current stream opened with [method list_dir_begin] (whether it has been fully processed with [method get_next] or not does not matter).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetDriveCount
member.summary: On Windows, return the number of drives (partitions) mounted on the current filesystem. On other platforms, the method returns 0.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetDrive(System.Int32)
member.summary: On Windows, return the name of the drive (partition) passed as an argument (e.g. [code]C:[/code]). On other platforms, or if the requested drive does not existed, the method returns an empty String.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetCurrentDrive
member.summary: Returns the currently opened directory's drive index. See [method get_drive] to convert returned index to the name of the drive.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.ChangeDir(System.String)
member.summary: Change the currently opened directory to the one passed as an argument. The argument can be relative to the current directory (e.g. [code]newdir[/code] or [code]../newdir[/code]), or an absolute path (e.g. [code]/tmp/newdir[/code] or [code]res://somedir/newdir[/code]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@GlobalScope] (OK or ERR_*).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetCurrentDir
member.summary: Return the absolute path to the currently opened directory (e.g. [code]res://folder[/code] or [code]C:\tmp\folder[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.MakeDir(System.String)
member.summary: Create a directory. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. The target directory should be placed in an already existing directory (to create the full path recursively, see [method make_dir_recursive]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@GlobalScope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.MakeDirRecursive(System.String)
member.summary: Create a target directory and all necessary intermediate directories in its path, by calling [method make_dir] recursively. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@GlobalScope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.FileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Return whether the target file exists. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.DirExists(System.String)
member.summary: Return whether the target directory exists. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetSpaceLeft
member.summary: On Unix desktop systems, return the available space on the current directory's disk. On other platforms, this information is not available and the method returns 0 or -1.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.Copy(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copy the [i]from[/i] file to the [i]to[/i] destination. Both arguments should be paths to files, either relative or absolute. If the destination file exists and is not access-protected, it will be overwritten. Returns one of the error code constants defined in [@GlobalScope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.Rename(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Rename (move) the [i]from[/i] file to the [i]to[/i] destination. Both arguments should be paths to files, either relative or absolute. If the destination file exists and is not access-protected, it will be overwritten. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@GlobalScope] (OK or FAILED).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Delete the target file or an empty directory. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. If the target directory is not empty, the operation will fail. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@GlobalScope] (OK or FAILED).

member.name: T:Godot.DynamicFont
member.summary: DynamicFont renders vector font files (such as TTF or OTF) dynamically at runtime instead of using a prerendered texture atlas like [BitmapFont]. This trades the faster loading time of [BitmapFont]s for the ability to change font parameters like size and spacing during runtime. [DynamicFontData] is used for referencing the font file paths.

member.name: T:Godot.Engine
member.summary: The [code]Engine[/code] class allows you to query and modify the game's run-time parameters, such as frames per second, time scale, and others.

member.name: P:Godot.Engine.EditorHint
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], it is running inside the editor. Useful for tool scripts.

member.name: P:Godot.Engine.IterationsPerSecond
member.summary: The number of fixed iterations per second (for fixed process and physics).

member.name: P:Godot.Engine.TargetFps
member.summary: The desired frames per second. If the hardware cannot keep up, this setting may not be respected. Defaults to 0, which indicates no limit.

member.name: P:Godot.Engine.TimeScale
member.summary: Controls how fast or slow the in-game clock ticks versus the real life one. It defaults to 1.0. A value of 2.0 means the game moves twice as fast as real life, whilst a value of 0.5 means the game moves at half the regular speed.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetFramesDrawn
member.summary: Returns the total number of frames drawn.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetFramesPerSecond
member.summary: Returns the frames per second of the running game.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetMainLoop
member.summary: Returns the main loop object (see [MainLoop] and [SceneTree]).

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetVersionInfo
member.summary: Returns the current engine version information in a Dictionary. "major" - Holds the major version number as an int "minor" - Holds the minor version number as an int "patch" - Holds the patch version number as an int "hex" - Holds the full version number encoded as an hexadecimal int with one byte (2 places) per number (see example below) "status" - Holds the status (e.g. "beta", "rc1", "rc2", ... "stable") as a String "build" - Holds the build name (e.g. "custom-build") as a String "string" - major + minor + patch + status + build in a single String The "hex" value is encoded as follows, from left to right: one byte for the major, one byte for the minor, one byte for the patch version. For example, "3.1.12" would be [code]0x03010C[/code]. Note that it's still an int internally, and printing it will give you its decimal representation, which is not particularly meaningful. Use hexadecimal literals for easy version comparisons from code: [codeblock] if Engine.get_version_info().hex >= 0x030200: # do things specific to version 3.2 or later else: # do things specific to versions before 3.2 [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetAuthorInfo
member.summary: Returns engine author information in a Dictionary. "lead_developers" - Array of Strings, lead developer names "founders" - Array of Strings, founder names "project_managers" - Array of Strings, project manager names "developers" - Array of Strings, developer names

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetCopyrightInfo
member.summary: Returns an Array of copyright information Dictionaries. "name" - String, component name "parts" - Array of Dictionaries {"files", "copyright", "license"} describing subsections of the component

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetDonorInfo
member.summary: Returns a Dictionary of Arrays of donor names. {"platinum_sponsors", "gold_sponsors", "mini_sponsors", "gold_donors", "silver_donors", "bronze_donors"}

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetLicenseInfo
member.summary: Returns Dictionary of licenses used by Godot and included third party components.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetLicenseText
member.summary: Returns Godot license text.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.IsInPhysicsFrame
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the game is inside the fixed process and physics phase of the game loop.

member.name: T:Godot.Environment
member.summary: Resource for environment nodes (like [WorldEnvironment]) that define multiple environment operations (such as background [Sky] or [Color], ambient light, fog, depth-of-field...). These parameters affect the final render of the scene. The order of these operations is: - DOF Blur - Motion Blur - Bloom - Tonemap (auto exposure) - Adjustments

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.ToneMapper.Linear
member.summary: Linear tonemapper operator. Reads the linear data and performs an exposure adjustment.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.ToneMapper.Reinhardt
member.summary: Reinhardt tonemapper operator. Performs a variation on rendered pixels' colors by this formula: color = color / (1 + color).

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.ToneMapper.Filmic
member.summary: Filmic tonemapper operator.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.ToneMapper.Aces
member.summary: Academy Color Encoding System tonemapper operator.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.GlowBlendModeEnum.Additive
member.summary: Additive glow blending mode. Mostly used for particles, glows (bloom), lens flare, bright sources.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.GlowBlendModeEnum.Screen
member.summary: Screen glow blending mode. Increases brightness, used frequently with bloom.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.GlowBlendModeEnum.Softlight
member.summary: Softlight glow blending mode. Modifies contrast, exposes shadows and highlights, vivid bloom.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.GlowBlendModeEnum.Replace
member.summary: Replace glow blending mode. Replaces all pixels' color by the glow value.

A value of 0 means that the sky's light emission has no effect on the scene illumination, thus all ambient illumination is provided by the ambient light. member.name: T:Godot.Expression
M:Godot.Expression.Parse(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Parses the expression and returns a [enum @GlobalScope.Error]. You can optionally specify names of variables that may appear in the expression with [code]input_names[/code], so that you can bind them when it gets executed. <param name="inputNames">If the param is null, then the default value is new string[] {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Expression.Execute(Godot.Collections.Array,Godot.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the expression that was previously parsed by [method parse] and returns the result. Before you use the returned object, you should check if the method failed by calling [method has_execute_failed]. If you defined input variables in [method parse], you can specify their values in the inputs array, in the same order. <param name="inputs">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Expression.HasExecuteFailed
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if [method execute] has failed.

member.name: M:Godot.Expression.GetErrorText
member.summary: Returns the error text if [method parse] has failed.

member.name: F:Godot.File.ModeFlags.Read

member.summary: Opens the file for write operations. Create it if the file does not exist and truncate if it exists.

member.summary: Opens the file for read and write operations. Does not truncate the file.

member.name: P:Godot.File.EndianSwap
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the file's endianness is swapped. Use this if you're dealing with files written in big endian machines. Note that this is about the file format, not CPU type. This is always reset to [code]false[/code] whenever you open the file.

member.name: M:Godot.File.OpenEncrypted(System.String,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Opens an encrypted file in write or read mode. You need to pass a binary key to encrypt/decrypt it.

member.name: M:Godot.File.OpenEncryptedWithPass(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Opens an encrypted file in write or read mode. You need to pass a password to encrypt/decrypt it.

member.name: M:Godot.File.OpenCompressed(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens a compressed file for reading or writing. Use COMPRESSION_* constants to set [code]compression_mode[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.File.Open(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens the file for writing or reading, depending on the flags.

member.name: M:Godot.File.Close
member.summary: Closes the currently opened file.

member.name: M:Godot.File.GetPath
member.summary: Returns the path as a [String] for the current open file.

member.name: M:Godot.File.GetPathAbsolute
member.summary: Returns the absolute path as a [String] for the current open file.

member.name: M:Godot.File.IsOpen
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the file is currently opened.

member.name: M:Godot.File.Seek(System.Int32)
member.summary: Change the file reading/writing cursor to the specified position (in bytes from the beginning of the file).

member.name: M:Godot.File.SeekEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the file reading/writing cursor to the specified position (in bytes from the end of the file). Note that this is an offset, so you should use negative numbers or the cursor will be at the end of the file.

member.name: M:Godot.File.GetPosition
member.summary: Returns the file cursor's position.

member.name: M:Godot.File.GetLen
member.summary: Returns the size of the file in bytes.

member.name: M:Godot.File.EofReached
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the file cursor has read past the end of the file. Note that this function will still return [code]false[/code] while at the end of the file and only activates when reading past it. This can be confusing but it conforms to how low level file access works in all operating systems. There is always [method get_len] and [method get_position] to implement a custom logic.

member.name: M:Godot.File.Get8
