member.name: M:Godot.File.GetPascalString
member.summary: Returns a [String] saved in Pascal format from the file.

member.name: M:Godot.File.FileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the file exists in the given path. Note that many resources types are imported (e.g. textures or sound files), and that their source asset will not be included in the exported game, as only the imported version is used (in the [code]res://.import[/code] folder). To check for the existence of such resources while taking into account the remapping to their imported location, use [method ResourceLoader.exists]. Typically, using [code]File.file_exists[/code] on an imported resource would work while you are developing in the editor (the source asset is present in [code]res://[/code], but fail when exported).

member.name: M:Godot.File.GetModifiedTime(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the last time the [code]file[/code] was modified in unix timestamp format or returns a [String] "ERROR IN [code]file[/code]". This unix timestamp can be converted to datetime by using [method OS.get_datetime_from_unix_time].

member.name: T:Godot.FileDialog
member.summary: FileDialog is a preset dialog used to choose files and directories in the filesystem. It supports filter masks.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.ModeEnum.OpenFile
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of one, and only one file.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.ModeEnum.OpenFiles
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of multiple files.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.ModeEnum.OpenDir
member.summary: The dialog functions as a folder selector, disallowing the selection of any file.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.ModeEnum.OpenAny
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of a file or a directory.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.ModeEnum.SaveFile
member.summary: The dialog will warn when a file exists.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.AccessEnum.Resources
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of file and directory.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.AccessEnum.Userdata
member.summary: The dialog allows access files under [Resource] path(res://) .

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.AccessEnum.Filesystem
member.summary: The dialog allows access files in whole file system.

member.name: P:Godot.FileDialog.ModeOverridesTitle
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], changing the [code]Mode[/code] property will set the window title accordingly (e.g. setting mode to [code]MODE_OPEN_FILE[/code] will change the window title to "Open a File").

member.name: P:Godot.FileDialog.Mode
member.summary: Set dialog to open or save mode, changes selection behavior. See enum [code]Mode[/code] constants.

member.name: P:Godot.FileDialog.Access
member.summary: The file system access scope. See enum [code]Access[/code] constants.

member.name: P:Godot.FileDialog.Filters
member.summary: Set file type filters. This example shows only .png and .gd files [code]set_filters(PoolStringArray(["*.png ; PNG Images","*.gd ; GD Script"]))[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.FileDialog.ShowHiddenFiles
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the dialog will show hidden files.

member.name: P:Godot.FileDialog.CurrentFile

member.name: P:Godot.FileDialog.CurrentPath

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.DeselectItems
member.summary: Clear currently selected items in the dialog.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.Invalidate
member.summary: Invalidate and update the current dialog content list.

member.name: T:Godot.Font
member.summary: Font contains a unicode compatible character set, as well as the ability to draw it with variable width, ascent, descent and kerning. For creating fonts from TTF files (or other font formats), see the editor support for fonts.

member.name: M:Godot.Font.Draw(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector2,System.String,System.Nullable{Godot.Color},System.Int32,System.Nullable{Godot.Color})
member.summary: Draw "string" into a canvas item using the font at a given position, with "modulate" color, and optionally clipping the width. "position" specifies the baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [i]ascent[/i] must be added to the Y axis. <param name="modulate">If the param is null, then the default value is new Color(1, 1, 1, 1)</param> <param name="outlineModulate">If the param is null, then the default value is new Color(1, 1, 1, 1)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Font.GetAscent
member.summary: Return the font ascent (number of pixels above the baseline).

member.name: M:Godot.Font.GetDescent
member.summary: Return the font descent (number of pixels below the baseline).

member.name: M:Godot.Font.GetHeight
member.summary: Return the total font height (ascent plus descent) in pixels.

member.name: M:Godot.Font.GetStringSize(System.String)
member.summary: Return the size of a string, taking kerning and advance into account.

member.name: M:Godot.Font.DrawChar(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector2,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{Godot.Color},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draw character "char" into a canvas item using the font at a given position, with "modulate" color, and optionally kerning if "next" is passed. clipping the width. "position" specifies the baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [i]ascent[/i] must be added to the Y axis. The width used by the character is returned, making this function useful for drawing strings character by character. <param name="modulate">If the param is null, then the default value is new Color(1, 1, 1, 1)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Font.UpdateChanges
member.summary: After editing a font (changing size, ascent, char rects, etc.). Call this function to propagate changes to controls that might use it.

member.name: T:Godot.FuncRef
member.summary: In GDScript, functions are not [i]first-class objects[/i]. This means it is impossible to store them directly as variables, return them from another function, or pass them as arguments. However, by creating a [code]FuncRef[/code] using the [method @GDScript.funcref] function, a reference to a function in a given object can be created, passed around and called.

member.name: M:Godot.FuncRef.CallFunc(System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls the referenced function previously set by [method set_function] or [method @GDScript.funcref].

member.name: M:Godot.FuncRef.SetInstance(Godot.Object)
member.summary: The object containing the referenced function. This object must be of a type actually inheriting from [Object], not a built-in type such as [int], [Vector2] or [Dictionary].

member.name: M:Godot.FuncRef.SetFunction(System.String)
member.summary: The name of the referenced function to call on the object, without parentheses or any parameters.

member.name: T:Godot.GDScript
member.summary: A script implemented in the GDScript programming language. The script exends the functionality of all objects that instance it. [method new] creates a new instance of the script. [method Object.set_script] extends an existing object, if that object's class matches one of the script's base classes.

member.name: M:Godot.GDScript.New(System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns a new instance of the script. For example: [codeblock] var MyClass = load("myclass.gd") var instance = MyClass.new() assert(instance.get_script() == MyClass) [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.GDScript.GetAsByteCode
member.summary: Returns byte code for the script source code.

member.name: T:Godot.GDScriptFunctionState
member.summary: Calling [method @GDScript.yield] within a function will cause that function to yield and return its current state as an object of this type. The yielded function call can then be resumed later by calling [method resume] on this state object.

member.name: M:Godot.GDScriptFunctionState.Resume(System.Object)
member.summary: Resume execution of the yielded function call. If handed an argument, return the argument from the [method @GDScript.yield] call in the yielded function call. You can pass e.g. an [Array] to hand multiple arguments. This function returns what the resumed function call returns, possibly another function state if yielded again.

member.name: M:Godot.GDScriptFunctionState.IsValid(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check whether the function call may be resumed. This is not the case if the function state was already resumed. If [code]extended_check[/code] is enabled, it also checks if the associated script and object still exist. The extended check is done in debug mode as part of [method GDScriptFunctionState.resume], but you can use this if you know you may be trying to resume without knowing for sure the object and/or script have survived up to that point.

member.name: T:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint
member.summary: The first 3 DOF axes are linear axes, which represent translation of Bodies, and the latter 3 DOF axes represent the angular motion. Each axis can be either locked, or limited.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.LinearLowerLimit
member.summary: The minimum difference between the pivot points' axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.LinearUpperLimit
member.summary: The maximum difference between the pivot points' axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.LinearLimitSoftness
member.summary: A factor applied to the movement across the axes The lower, the slower the movement.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.LinearRestitution
member.summary: The amount of restitution on the axes movement The lower, the more momentum gets lost.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.LinearDamping
member.summary: The amount of damping that happens at the linear motion across the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.LinearMotorTargetVelocity
member.summary: The velocity the linear motor will try to reach.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.LinearMotorForceLimit
member.summary: The maximum force the linear motor will apply while trying to reach the velocity target.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.AngularLowerLimit
member.summary: The minimum rotation in negative direction to break loose and rotate around the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.AngularUpperLimit
member.summary: The minimum rotation in positive direction to break loose and rotate around the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.AngularLimitSoftness
member.summary: The speed of all rotations across the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.AngularDamping
member.summary: The amount of rotational damping across the axes. The lower, the more dampening occurs.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.AngularRestitution
member.summary: The amount of rotational restitution across the axes. The lower, the more restitution occurs.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.AngularForceLimit
member.summary: The maximum amount of force that can occur, when rotating around the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.AngularErp
member.summary: When rotating across the axes, this error tolerance factor defines how much the correction gets slowed down. The lower, the slower.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.AngularMotorTargetVelocity
member.summary: Target speed for the motor at the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.AngularMotorForceLimit
member.summary: Maximum acceleration for the motor at the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Param.Max
member.summary: End flag of PARAM_* constants, used internally.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Flag.EnableLinearLimit
member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is linear motion possible within the given limits.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Flag.EnableAngularLimit
member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is rotational motion possible.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Flag.EnableMotor
member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is a rotational motor across these axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.Flag.Max
member.summary: End flag of FLAG_* constants, used internally.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitX__enabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the linear motion across the x-axis is limited.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitX__upperDistance
member.summary: The maximum difference between the pivot points' x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitX__lowerDistance
member.summary: The minimum difference between the pivot points' x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitX__softness

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitX__restitution
member.summary: The amount of restitution on the x-axis movement The lower, the more momentum gets lost.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitX__damping
member.summary: The amount of damping that happens at the x-motion.

member.summary: If [code]true[/code], then there is a linear motor on the x-axis. It will attempt to reach the target velocity while staying within the force limits.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularLimitY__restitution
member.summary: The amount of rotational restitution across the y-axis. The lower, the more restitution occurs.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularLimitY__damping
member.summary: The amount of rotational damping across the y-axis. The lower, the more dampening occurs.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularLimitY__forceLimit
member.summary: The maximum amount of force that can occur, when rotating around y-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularLimitY__erp
member.summary: When rotating across y-axis, this error tolerance factor defines how much the correction gets slowed down. The lower, the slower.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularMotorY__enabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], a rotating motor at the y-axis is enabled.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularMotorY__targetVelocity
member.summary: Target speed for the motor at the y-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularMotorY__forceLimit
member.summary: Maximum acceleration for the motor at the y-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitZ__enabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the linear motion across the z-axis is limited.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitZ__upperDistance
member.summary: The maximum difference between the pivot points' z-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitZ__lowerDistance
member.summary: The minimum difference between the pivot points' z-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitZ__softness
member.summary: A factor applied to the movement across the z-axis The lower, the slower the movement.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitZ__restitution
member.summary: The amount of restitution on the z-axis movement The lower, the more momentum gets lost.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitZ__damping
member.summary: The amount of damping that happens at the z-motion.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearMotorZ__enabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], then there is a linear motor on the z-axis. It will attempt to reach the target velocity while staying within the force limits.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearMotorZ__targetVelocity
member.summary: The speed that the linear motor will attempt to reach on the z-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearMotorZ__forceLimit
member.summary: The maximum force the linear motor can apply on the z-axis while trying to reach the target velocity.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.BuildBoxPlanes(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns an array with 6 [Plane]s that describe the sides of a box centered at the origin. The box size is defined by [code]extents[/code], which represents one (positive) corner of the box (i.e. half its actual size).

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.BuildCylinderPlanes(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,Godot.Vector3.Axis)
member.summary: Returns an array of [Plane]s closely bounding a faceted cylinder centered at the origin with radius [code]radius[/code] and height [code]height[/code]. The parameter [code]sides[/code] defines how many planes will be generated for the round part of the cylinder. The parameter [code]axis[/code] describes the axis along which the cylinder is oriented (0 for X, 1 for Y, 2 for Z).

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.BuildCapsulePlanes(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,Godot.Vector3.Axis)
member.summary: Returns an array of [Plane]s closely bounding a faceted capsule centered at the origin with radius [code]radius[/code] and height [code]height[/code]. The parameter [code]sides[/code] defines how many planes will be generated for the side part of the capsule, whereas [code]lats[/code] gives the number of latitudinal steps at the bottom and top of the capsule. The parameter [code]axis[/code] describes the axis along which the capsule is oriented (0 for X, 1 for Y, 2 for Z).

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.SegmentIntersectsCircle(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,System.Single)
member.summary: Given the 2d segment ([code]segment_from[/code], [code]segment_to[/code]), returns the position on the segment (as a number between 0 and 1) at which the segment hits the circle that is located at position [code]circle_position[/code] and has radius [code]circle_radius[/code]. If the segment does not intersect the circle, -1 is returned (this is also the case if the line extending the segment would intersect the circle, but the segment does not).

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.SegmentIntersectsSegment2d(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Checks if the two segments ([code]from_a[/code], [code]to_a[/code]) and ([code]from_b[/code], [code]to_b[/code]) intersect. If yes, return the point of intersection as [Vector2]. If no intersection takes place, returns an empty [Variant].

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.LineIntersectsLine2d(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Checks if the two lines ([code]from_a[/code], [code]dir_a[/code]) and ([code]from_b[/code], [code]dir_b[/code]) intersect. If yes, return the point of intersection as [Vector2]. If no intersection takes place, returns an empty [Variant]. Note that the lines are specified using direction vectors, not end points.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.GetClosestPointsBetweenSegments2d(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Given the two 2d segments ([code]p1[/code], [code]p2[/code]) and ([code]q1[/code], [code]q2[/code]), finds those two points on the two segments that are closest to each other. Returns a [PoolVector2Array] that contains this point on ([code]p1[/code], [code]p2[/code]) as well the accompanying point on ([code]q1[/code], [code]q2[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.GetClosestPointsBetweenSegments(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Given the two 3d segments ([code]p1[/code], [code]p2[/code]) and ([code]q1[/code], [code]q2[/code]), finds those two points on the two segments that are closest to each other. Returns a [PoolVector3Array] that contains this point on ([code]p1[/code], [code]p2[/code]) as well the accompanying point on ([code]q1[/code], [code]q2[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.GetClosestPointToSegment2d(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the 2d point on the 2d segment ([code]s1[/code], [code]s2[/code]) that is closest to [code]point[/code]. The returned point will always be inside the specified segment.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.GetClosestPointToSegment(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the 3d point on the 3d segment ([code]s1[/code], [code]s2[/code]) that is closest to [code]point[/code]. The returned point will always be inside the specified segment.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.GetClosestPointToSegmentUncapped2d(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the 2d point on the 2d line defined by ([code]s1[/code], [code]s2[/code]) that is closest to [code]point[/code]. The returned point can be inside the segment ([code]s1[/code], [code]s2[/code]) or outside of it, i.e. somewhere on the line extending from the segment.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.GetClosestPointToSegmentUncapped(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the 3d point on the 3d line defined by ([code]s1[/code], [code]s2[/code]) that is closest to [code]point[/code]. The returned point can be inside the segment ([code]s1[/code], [code]s2[/code]) or outside of it, i.e. somewhere on the line extending from the segment.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.RayIntersectsTriangle(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Tests if the 3d ray starting at [code]from[/code] with the direction of [code]dir[/code] intersects the triangle specified by [code]a[/code], [code]b[/code] and [code]c[/code]. If yes, returns the point of intersection as [Vector3]. If no intersection takes place, an empty [Variant] is returned.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.SegmentIntersectsTriangle(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Tests if the segment ([code]from[/code], [code]to[/code]) intersects the triangle [code]a[/code], [code]b[/code], [code]c[/code]. If yes, returns the point of intersection as [Vector3]. If no intersection takes place, an empty [Variant] is returned.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.SegmentIntersectsSphere(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Checks if the segment ([code]from[/code], [code]to[/code]) intersects the sphere that is located at [code]sphere_position[/code] and has radius [code]sphere_radius[/code]. If no, returns an empty [PoolVector3Array]. If yes, returns a [PoolVector3Array] containing the point of intersection and the sphere's normal at the point of intersection.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.SegmentIntersectsCylinder(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Checks if the segment ([code]from[/code], [code]to[/code]) intersects the cylinder with height [code]height[/code] that is centered at the origin and has radius [code]radius[/code]. If no, returns an empty [PoolVector3Array]. If an intersection takes place, the returned array contains the point of intersection and the cylinder's normal at the point of intersection.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.SegmentIntersectsConvex(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Collections.Array)
member.summary: Given a convex hull defined though the [Plane]s in the array [code]planes[/code], tests if the segment ([code]from[/code], [code]to[/code]) intersects with that hull. If an intersection is found, returns a [PoolVector3Array] containing the point the intersection and the hull's normal. If no intersecion is found, an the returned array is empty.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.PointIsInsideTriangle(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns if [code]point[/code] is inside the triangle specified by [code]a[/code], [code]b[/code] and [code]c[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.TriangulatePolygon(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Triangulates the polygon specified by the points in [code]polygon[/code]. Returns a [PoolIntArray] where each triangle consists of three consecutive point indices into [code]polygon[/code] (i.e. the returned array will have [code]n * 3[/code] elements, with [code]n[/code] being the number of found triangles). If the triangulation did not succeed, an empty [PoolIntArray] is returned.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.ConvexHull2d(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Given an array of [Vector2]s, returns the convex hull as a list of points in counter-clockwise order. The last point is the same as the first one.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.ClipPolygon(Godot.Vector3[],Godot.Plane)
member.summary: Clips the polygon defined by the points in [code]points[/code] against the [code]plane[/code] and returns the points of the clipped polygon.

member.name: M:Godot.Geometry.MakeAtlas(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Given an array of [Vector2]s representing tiles, builds an atlas. The returned dictionary has two keys: [code]points[/code] is a vector of [Vector2] that specifies the positions of each tile, [code]size[/code] contains the overall size of the whole atlas as [Vector2].

member.name: T:Godot.GeometryInstance
member.summary: Base node for geometry based visual instances. Shares some common functionality like visibility and custom materials.

member.name: F:Godot.GeometryInstance.Flags.UseBakedLight
member.summary: Will allow the GeometryInstance to be used when baking lights using a [GIProbe] and/or any other form of baked lighting. Added documentation for GeometryInstance and VisualInstance

member.name: F:Godot.GeometryInstance.ShadowCastingSetting.Off
member.summary: Will not cast any shadows.

member.name: F:Godot.GeometryInstance.ShadowCastingSetting.On
member.summary: Will cast shadows from all visible faces in the GeometryInstance. Will take culling into account, so faces not being rendered will not be taken into account when shadow casting.

member.name: F:Godot.GeometryInstance.ShadowCastingSetting.DoubleSided
member.summary: Will cast shadows from all visible faces in the GeometryInstance. Will not take culling into account, so all faces will be taken into account when shadow casting.

member.name: F:Godot.GeometryInstance.ShadowCastingSetting.ShadowsOnly
member.summary: Will only show the shadows casted from this object. In other words: The actual mesh will not be visible, only the shadows casted from the mesh.

member.name: P:Godot.GeometryInstance.MaterialOverride
member.summary: The material override for the whole geometry. If there is a material in material_override, it will be used instead of any material set in any material slot of the mesh.

member.name: P:Godot.GeometryInstance.CastShadow
member.summary: The selected shadow casting flag. See SHADOW_CASTING_SETTING_* constants for values.

member.name: P:Godot.GeometryInstance.ExtraCullMargin
member.summary: The extra distance added to the GeometryInstance's bounding box ([AABB]) to increase its cull box.

member.name: P:Godot.GeometryInstance.UseInBakedLight
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], this GeometryInstance will be used when baking lights using a [GIProbe] and/or any other form of baked lighting.

member.name: P:Godot.GeometryInstance.LodMinDistance
member.summary: The GeometryInstance's min LOD distance.

member.name: P:Godot.GeometryInstance.LodMinHysteresis
member.summary: The GeometryInstance's min LOD margin.

member.name: P:Godot.GeometryInstance.LodMaxDistance
member.summary: The GeometryInstance's max LOD distance.

member.name: P:Godot.GeometryInstance.LodMaxHysteresis
member.summary: The GeometryInstance's max LOD margin.

member.name: T:Godot.Gradient
member.summary: Given a set of colors, this node will interpolate them in order, meaning, that if you have color 1, color 2 and color 3, the ramp will interpolate (generate the colors between two colors) from color 1 to color 2 and from color 2 to color 3. Initially the ramp will have 2 colors (black and white), one (black) at ramp lower offset 0 and the other (white) at the ramp higher offset 1.

member.name: P:Godot.Gradient.Offsets
member.summary: Gradient's offsets returned as a [PoolRealArray].

member.name: P:Godot.Gradient.Colors
member.summary: Gradient's colors returned as a [PoolColorArray].

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.AddPoint(System.Single,Godot.Color)
member.summary: Adds the specified color to the end of the ramp, with the specified offset

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.RemovePoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the color at the index [i]offset[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.SetOffset(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the offset for the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the offset of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.SetColor(System.Int32,Godot.Color)
member.summary: Sets the color of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.GetColor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the color of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.Interpolate(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the interpolated color specified by [i]offset[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.GetPointCount
member.summary: Returns the number of colors in the ramp

member.name: T:Godot.GradientTexture
member.summary: Uses a [Gradient] to fill the texture data, the gradient will be filled from left to right using colors obtained from the gradient, this means that the texture does not necessarily represent an exact copy of the gradient, but instead an interpolation of samples obtained from the gradient at fixed steps (see [member width]).

member.name: P:Godot.GradientTexture.Gradient
member.summary: The [Gradient] that will be used to fill the texture.

member.name: P:Godot.GradientTexture.Width
member.summary: The number of color samples that will be obtained from the [Gradient].

member.name: T:Godot.GraphEdit
member.summary: GraphEdit manages the showing of GraphNodes it contains, as well as connections and disconnections between them. Signals are sent for each of these two events. Disconnection between GraphNodes slots is disabled by default. It is greatly advised to enable low processor usage mode (see [member OS.low_processor_usage_mode]) when using GraphEdits.

member.name: P:Godot.GraphEdit.RightDisconnects
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], enables disconnection of existing connections in the GraphEdit by dragging the right end.

member.name: P:Godot.GraphEdit.ScrollOffset
member.summary: The scroll offset.

member.name: P:Godot.GraphEdit.SnapDistance
member.summary: The snapping distance in pixels.

member.name: P:Godot.GraphEdit.UseSnap
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], enables snapping.

member.name: P:Godot.GraphEdit.Zoom
member.summary: The current zoom value.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphEdit.ConnectNode(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a connection between 'from_port' slot of 'from' GraphNode and 'to_port' slot of 'to' GraphNode. If the connection already exists, no connection is created.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphEdit.IsNodeConnected(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)

member.name: T:Godot.GraphNode
member.summary: A GraphNode is a container defined by a title. It can have 1 or more input and output slots, which can be enabled (shown) or disabled (not shown) and have different (incompatible) types. Colors can also be assigned to slots. A tuple of input and output slots is defined for each GUI element included in the GraphNode. Input and output connections are left and right slots, but only enabled slots are counted as connections.

member.name: P:Godot.GraphNode.Offset
member.summary: The offset of the GraphNode, relative to the scroll offset of the [GraphEdit]. Note that you cannot use position directly, as [GraphEdit] is a [Container].

member.name: M:Godot.GraphNode.ClearSlot(System.Int32)
member.summary: Disable input and output slot whose index is 'idx'.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphNode.ClearAllSlots
member.summary: Disable all input and output slots of the GraphNode.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphNode.GetSlotTypeLeft(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the (integer) type of left (input) 'idx' slot.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphNode.GetSlotColorLeft(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the color set to 'idx' left (input) slot.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphNode.IsSlotEnabledRight(System.Int32)

member.name: T:Godot.GridContainer
member.summary: Grid container will arrange its children in a grid like structure, the grid columns are specified using the [member columns] property and the number of rows will be equal to the number of children in the container divided by the number of columns, for example: if the container has 5 children, and 2 columns, there will be 3 rows in the container. Notice that grid layout will preserve the columns and rows for every size of the container.

member.name: P:Godot.GridContainer.Columns
member.summary: The number of columns in the [code]GridContainer[/code]. If modified, [code]GridContainer[/code] reorders its children to accommodate the new layout.

member.name: T:Godot.GridMap
member.summary: GridMap lets you place meshes on a grid interactively. It works both from the editor and can help you create in-game level editors. GridMaps use a [MeshLibrary] which contain a list of tiles: meshes with materials plus optional collisions and extra elements. A GridMap contains a collection of cells. Each grid cell refers to a [MeshLibrary] item. All cells in the map have the same dimensions. A GridMap is split into a sparse collection of octants for efficient rendering and physics processing. Every octant has the same dimensions and can contain several cells.

member.name: F:Godot.GridMap.InvalidCellItem
member.summary: Invalid cell item that can be used in [method set_cell_item] to clear cells (or represent an empty cell in [method get_cell_item]).

member.name: P:Godot.GridMap.Theme
member.summary: Deprecated, use [member mesh_library] instead.

member.name: P:Godot.GridMap.MeshLibrary
member.summary: The assigned [MeshLibrary].

member.name: P:Godot.GridMap.CellSize
member.summary: The dimensions of the grid's cells.

member.name: P:Godot.GridMap.CellOctantSize
member.summary: The size of each octant measured in number of cells. This applies to all three axis.

member.name: P:Godot.GridMap.CellCenterX
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], grid items are centered on the X axis.

member.name: P:Godot.GridMap.CellCenterY
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], grid items are centered on the Y axis.

member.name: P:Godot.GridMap.CellCenterZ
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], grid items are centered on the Z axis.

member.name: M:Godot.GridMap.SetCellItem(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the mesh index for the cell referenced by its grid-based X, Y and Z coordinates. A negative item index will clear the cell. Optionally, the item's orientation can be passed.

member.name: M:Godot.GridMap.GetCellItem(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The [MeshLibrary] item index located at the grid-based X, Y and Z coordinates. If the cell is empty, [constant INVALID_CELL_ITEM] will be returned.

member.name: M:Godot.GridMap.GetCellItemOrientation(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.name: T:Godot.GrooveJoint2D

member.name: P:Godot.GrooveJoint2D.InitialOffset
member.summary: The body B's initial anchor position defined by the joint's origin and a local offset [member initial_offset] along the joint's y axis (along the groove). Default value: [code]25[/code]

member.name: T:Godot.HTTPClient
member.summary: Hyper-text transfer protocol client (sometimes called "User Agent"). Used to make HTTP requests to download web content, upload files and other data or to communicate with various services, among other use cases. Note that this client only needs to connect to a host once (see [method connect_to_host]) to send multiple requests. Because of this, methods that take URLs usually take just the part after the host instead of the full URL, as the client is already connected to a host. See [method request] for a full example and to get started. A [code]HTTPClient[/code] should be reused between multiple requests or to connect to different hosts instead of creating one client per request. Supports SSL and SSL server certificate verification. HTTP status codes in the 2xx range indicate success, 3xx redirection (i.e. "try again, but over here"), 4xx something was wrong with the request, and 5xx something went wrong on the server's side. For more information on HTTP, see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP (or read RFC 2616 to get it straight from the source: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616).

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Status.Disconnected
member.summary: Status: Disconnected from the server.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Status.Resolving
member.summary: Status: Currently resolving the hostname for the given URL into an IP.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Status.CantResolve
member.summary: Status: DNS failure: Can't resolve the hostname for the given URL.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Status.Connecting
member.summary: Status: Currently connecting to server.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Status.CantConnect
member.summary: Status: Can't connect to the server.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Status.Connected
member.summary: Status: Connection established.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Status.Requesting
member.summary: Status: Currently sending request.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Status.Body
member.summary: Status: HTTP body received.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Status.ConnectionError
member.summary: Status: Error in HTTP connection.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Status.SslHandshakeError
member.summary: Status: Error in SSL handshake.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Method.Get
member.summary: HTTP GET method. The GET method requests a representation of the specified resource. Requests using GET should only retrieve data.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Method.Head
member.summary: HTTP HEAD method. The HEAD method asks for a response identical to that of a GET request, but without the response body. This is useful to request metadata like HTTP headers or to check if a resource exists.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Method.Post
member.summary: HTTP POST method. The POST method is used to submit an entity to the specified resource, often causing a change in state or side effects on the server. This is often used for forms and submitting data or uploading files.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Method.Put
member.summary: HTTP PUT method. The PUT method asks to replace all current representations of the target resource with the request payload. (You can think of [code]POST[/code] as "create or update" and [code]PUT[/code] as "update", although many services tend to not make a clear distinction or change their meaning).

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Method.Delete
member.summary: HTTP DELETE method. The DELETE method requests to delete the specified resource.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Method.Options
member.summary: HTTP OPTIONS method. The OPTIONS method asks for a description of the communication options for the target resource. Rarely used.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Method.Trace
member.summary: HTTP TRACE method. The TRACE method performs a message loop-back test along the path to the target resource. Returns the entire HTTP request received in the response body. Rarely used.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Method.Connect
member.summary: HTTP CONNECT method. The CONNECT method establishes a tunnel to the server identified by the target resource. Rarely used.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Method.Patch
member.summary: HTTP PATCH method. The PATCH method is used to apply partial modifications to a resource.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.Method.Max
member.summary: Marker for end of [code]METHOD_*[/code] enum. Not used.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Continue
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]100 Continue[/code]. Interim response that indicates everything so far is OK and that the client should continue with the request (or ignore this status if already finished).

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.SwitchingProtocols
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]101 Switching Protocol[/code]. Sent in response to an [code]Upgrade[/code] request header by the client. Indicates the protocol the server is switching to.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Processing
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]102 Processing[/code] (WebDAV). Indicates that the server has received and is processing the request, but no response is available yet.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Ok
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]200 OK[/code]. The request has succeeded. Default response for successful requests. Meaning varies depending on the request. GET: The resource has been fetched and is transmitted in the message body. HEAD: The entity headers are in the message body. POST: The resource describing the result of the action is transmitted in the message body. TRACE: The message body contains the request message as received by the server.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Created
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]201 Created[/code]. The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created as a result of it. This is typically the response sent after a PUT request.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Accepted
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]202 Accepted[/code]. The request has been received but not yet acted upon. It is non-committal, meaning that there is no way in HTTP to later send an asynchronous response indicating the outcome of processing the request. It is intended for cases where another process or server handles the request, or for batch processing.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.NonAuthoritativeInformation
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]203 Non-Authoritative Information[/code]. This response code means returned meta-information set is not exact set as available from the origin server, but collected from a local or a third party copy. Except this condition, 200 OK response should be preferred instead of this response.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.NoContent
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]204 No Content[/code]. There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful. The user-agent may update its cached headers for this resource with the new ones.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.ResetContent
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]205 Reset Content[/code]. The server has fulfilled the request and desires that the client resets the "document view" that caused the request to be sent to its original state as received from the origin server.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.PartialContent
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]206 Partial Content[/code]. This response code is used because of a range header sent by the client to separate download into multiple streams.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.MultiStatus
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]207 Multi-Status[/code] (WebDAV). A Multi-Status response conveys information about multiple resources in situations where multiple status codes might be appropriate.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.AlreadyReported
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]208 Already Reported[/code] (WebDAV). Used inside a DAV: propstat response element to avoid enumerating the internal members of multiple bindings to the same collection repeatedly.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.ImUsed
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]226 IM Used[/code] (WebDAV). The server has fulfilled a GET request for the resource, and the response is a representation of the result of one or more instance-manipulations applied to the current instance.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.MultipleChoices
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]300 Multiple Choice[/code]. The request has more than one possible responses and there is no standardized way to choose one of the responses. User-agent or user should choose one of them.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.MovedPermanently
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]301 Moved Permanently[/code]. Redirection. This response code means the URI of requested resource has been changed. The new URI is usually included in the response.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Found
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]302 Found[/code]. Temporary redirection. This response code means the URI of requested resource has been changed temporarily. New changes in the URI might be made in the future. Therefore, this same URI should be used by the client in future requests.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.SeeOther
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]303 See Other[/code]. The server is redirecting the user agent to a different resource, as indicated by a URI in the Location header field, which is intended to provide an indirect response to the original request.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.NotModified
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]304 Not Modified[/code]. A conditional GET or HEAD request has been received and would have resulted in a 200 OK response if it were not for the fact that the condition evaluated to false.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.UseProxy
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]305 Use Proxy[/code]. Deprecated. Do not use.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.SwitchProxy
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]306 Switch Proxy[/code]. Deprecated. Do not use.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.TemporaryRedirect
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]307 Temporary Redirect[/code]. The target resource resides temporarily under a different URI and the user agent MUST NOT change the request method if it performs an automatic redirection to that URI.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.PermanentRedirect
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]308 Permanent Redirect[/code]. The target resource has been assigned a new permanent URI and any future references to this resource ought to use one of the enclosed URIs.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.BadRequest
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]400 Bad Request[/code]. The request was invalid. The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, invalid request contents, or deceptive request routing).

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Unauthorized
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]401 Unauthorized[/code]. Credentials required. The request has not been applied because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.PaymentRequired
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]402 Payment Required[/code]. This response code is reserved for future use. Initial aim for creating this code was using it for digital payment systems, however this is not currently used.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Forbidden
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]403 Forbidden[/code]. The client does not have access rights to the content, i.e. they are unauthorized, so server is rejecting to give proper response. Unlike [code]401[/code], the client's identity is known to the server.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.NotFound
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]404 Not Found[/code]. The server can not find requested resource. Either the URL is not recognized or the endpoint is valid but the resource itself does not exist. May also be sent instead of 403 to hide existence of a resource if the client is not authorized.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]405 Method Not Allowed[/code]. The request's HTTP method is known by the server but has been disabled and cannot be used. For example, an API may forbid DELETE-ing a resource. The two mandatory methods, GET and HEAD, must never be disabled and should not return this error code.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.NotAcceptable
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]406 Not Acceptable[/code]. The target resource does not have a current representation that would be acceptable to the user agent, according to the proactive negotiation header fields received in the request. Used when negotiation content.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]407 Proxy Authentication Required[/code]. Similar to 401 Unauthorized, but it indicates that the client needs to authenticate itself in order to use a proxy.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.RequestTimeout
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]408 Request Timeout[/code]. The server did not receive a complete request message within the time that it was prepared to wait.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Conflict
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]409 Conflict[/code]. The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the target resource. This code is used in situations where the user might be able to resolve the conflict and resubmit the request.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Gone
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]410 Gone[/code]. The target resource is no longer available at the origin server and this condition is likely permanent.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.LengthRequired
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]411 Length Required[/code]. The server refuses to accept the request without a defined Content-Length header.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]412 Precondition Failed[/code]. One or more conditions given in the request header fields evaluated to false when tested on the server.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]413 Entity Too Large[/code]. The server is refusing to process a request because the request payload is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.RequestUriTooLong
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]414 Request-URI Too Long[/code]. The server is refusing to service the request because the request-target is longer than the server is willing to interpret.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]415 Unsupported Media Type[/code]. The origin server is refusing to service the request because the payload is in a format not supported by this method on the target resource.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]416 Requested Range Not Satisfiable[/code]. None of the ranges in the request's Range header field overlap the current extent of the selected resource or the set of ranges requested has been rejected due to invalid ranges or an excessive request of small or overlapping ranges.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.ExpectationFailed
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]417 Expectation Failed[/code]. The expectation given in the request's Expect header field could not be met by at least one of the inbound servers.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.ImATeapot
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]418 I'm A Teapot[/code]. Any attempt to brew coffee with a teapot should result in the error code "418 I'm a teapot". The resulting entity body MAY be short and stout.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.MisdirectedRequest
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]421 Misdirected Request[/code]. The request was directed at a server that is not able to produce a response. This can be sent by a server that is not configured to produce responses for the combination of scheme and authority that are included in the request URI.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.UnprocessableEntity
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]422 Unprocessable Entity[/code] (WebDAV). The server understands the content type of the request entity (hence a 415 Unsupported Media Type status code is inappropriate), and the syntax of the request entity is correct (thus a 400 Bad Request status code is inappropriate) but was unable to process the contained instructions.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.Locked
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]423 Locked[/code] (WebDAV). The source or destination resource of a method is locked.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.FailedDependency
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]424 Failed Dependency[/code] (WebDAV). The method could not be performed on the resource because the requested action depended on another action and that action failed.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.UpgradeRequired
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]426 Upgrade Required[/code]. The server refuses to perform the request using the current protocol but might be willing to do so after the client upgrades to a different protocol.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.PreconditionRequired
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]428 Precondition Required[/code]. The origin server requires the request to be conditional.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.TooManyRequests
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]429 Too Many Requests[/code]. The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time (see "rate limiting"). Back off and increase time between requests or try again later.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.RequestHeaderFieldsTooLarge
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]431 Request Header Fields Too Large[/code]. The server is unwilling to process the request because its header fields are too large. The request MAY be resubmitted after reducing the size of the request header fields.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.UnavailableForLegalReasons
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]451 Response Unavailable For Legal Reasons[/code]. The server is denying access to the resource as a consequence of a legal demand.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.InternalServerError
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]500 Internal Server Error[/code]. The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]501 Not Implemented[/code]. The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.BadGateway
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]502 Bad Gateway[/code]. The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, received an invalid response from an inbound server it accessed while attempting to fulfill the request. Usually returned by load balancers or proxies.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]503 Service Unavailable[/code]. The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overload or scheduled maintenance, which will likely be alleviated after some delay. Try again later.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.GatewayTimeout
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]504 Gateway Timeout[/code]. The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, did not receive a timely response from an upstream server it needed to access in order to complete the request. Usually returned by load balancers or proxies.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.HttpVersionNotSupported
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]505 HTTP Version Not Supported[/code]. The server does not support, or refuses to support, the major version of HTTP that was used in the request message.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.VariantAlsoNegotiates
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]506 Variant Also Negotiates[/code]. The server has an internal configuration error: the chosen variant resource is configured to engage in transparent content negotiation itself, and is therefore not a proper end point in the negotiation process.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.InsufficientStorage
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]507 Insufficient Storage[/code]. The method could not be performed on the resource because the server is unable to store the representation needed to successfully complete the request.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.LoopDetected
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]508 Loop Detected[/code]. The server terminated an operation because it encountered an infinite loop while processing a request with "Depth: infinity". This status indicates that the entire operation failed.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.NotExtended
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]510 Not Extended[/code]. The policy for accessing the resource has not been met in the request. The server should send back all the information necessary for the client to issue an extended request.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPClient.ResponseCode.NetworkAuthRequired
member.summary: HTTP status code [code]511 Network Authentication Required[/code]. The client needs to authenticate to gain network access.

member.name: P:Godot.HTTPClient.BlockingModeEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], execution will block until all data is read from the response.

member.name: P:Godot.HTTPClient.Connection
member.summary: The connection to use for this client.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.ConnectToHost(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Connect to a host. This needs to be done before any requests are sent. The host should not have http:// prepended but will strip the protocol identifier if provided. If no [code]port[/code] is specified (or [code]-1[/code] is used), it is automatically set to 80 for HTTP and 443 for HTTPS (if [code]use_ssl[/code] is enabled). [code]verify_host[/code] will check the SSL identity of the host if set to [code]true[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.RequestRaw(Godot.HTTPClient.Method,System.String,System.String[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends a raw request to the connected host. The URL parameter is just the part after the host, so for [code]http://somehost.com/index.php[/code], it is [code]index.php[/code]. Headers are HTTP request headers. For available HTTP methods, see [code]METHOD_*[/code]. Sends the body data raw, as a byte array and does not encode it in any way.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.Request(Godot.HTTPClient.Method,System.String,System.String[],System.String)
M:Godot.HTTPClient.Close
member.summary: Closes the current connection, allowing reuse of this [code]HTTPClient[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.HasResponse
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], this [code]HTTPClient[/code] has a response available.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.IsResponseChunked
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], this [code]HTTPClient[/code] has a response that is chunked.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetResponseCode
member.summary: Returns the response's HTTP status code.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetResponseHeaders
member.summary: Returns the response headers.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetResponseHeadersAsDictionary
member.summary: Returns all response headers as dictionary where the case-sensitivity of the keys and values is kept like the server delivers it. A value is a simple String, this string can have more than one value where "; " is used as separator. Structure: ("key":"value1; value2") Example: (content-length:12), (Content-Type:application/json; charset=UTF-8)

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetResponseBodyLength
member.summary: Returns the response's body length.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.ReadResponseBodyChunk
member.summary: Reads one chunk from the response.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.SetReadChunkSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the size of the buffer used and maximum bytes to read per iteration. see [method read_response_body_chunk]

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetStatus
member.summary: Returns a STATUS_* enum constant. Need to call [method poll] in order to get status updates.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.Poll
member.summary: This needs to be called in order to have any request processed. Check results with [method get_status]

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.QueryStringFromDict(Godot.Collections.Dictionary)
member.summary: Generates a GET/POST application/x-www-form-urlencoded style query string from a provided dictionary, e.g.: [codeblock] var fields = {"username": "user", "password": "pass"} String query_string = http_client.query_string_from_dict(fields) # returns: "username=user&password=pass" [/codeblock] Furthermore, if a key has a null value, only the key itself is added, without equal sign and value. If the value is an array, for each value in it a pair with the same key is added. [codeblock] var fields = {"single": 123, "not_valued": null, "multiple": [22, 33, 44]} String query_string = http_client.query_string_from_dict(fields) # returns: "single=123&not_valued&multiple=22&multiple=33&multiple=44" [/codeblock]

member.name: T:Godot.HTTPRequest
member.summary: A node with the ability to send HTTP requests. Uses [HTTPClient] internally. Can be used to make HTTP requests, i.e. download or upload files or web content via HTTP.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPRequest.Result.Success
member.summary: Request successful.

member.name: F:Godot.HTTPRequest.Result.CantConnect

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPRequest.Request(System.String,System.String[],System.Boolean,Godot.HTTPClient.Method,System.String)
member.summary: Creates request on the underlying [HTTPClient]. If there is no configuration errors, it tries to connect using [method HTTPClient.connect_to_host] and passes parameters onto [method HTTPClient.request]. Returns [code]OK[/code] if request is successfully created. (Does not imply that the server has responded), [code]ERR_UNCONFIGURED[/code] if not in the tree, [code]ERR_BUSY[/code] if still processing previous request, [code]ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER[/code] if given string is not a valid URL format, or [code]ERR_CANT_CONNECT[/code] if not using thread and the [HTTPClient] cannot connect to host. <param name="customHeaders">If the param is null, then the default value is new string[] {}</param>

member.summary: Returns the amount of bytes this HTTPRequest downloaded.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPRequest.GetBodySize
member.summary: Returns the response body length.

member.name: T:Godot.Image
member.summary: Native image datatype. Contains image data, which can be converted to a [Texture], and several functions to interact with it. The maximum width and height for an [code]Image[/code] are [constant MAX_WIDTH] and [constant MAX_HEIGHT].

member.name: F:Godot.Image.MaxWidth
member.summary: The maximal width allowed for [code]Image[/code] resources.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.MaxHeight
member.summary: The maximal height allowed for [code]Image[/code] resources.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Interpolation.Trilinear
member.summary: Performs bilinear separately on the two most suited mipmap levels, then linearly interpolates between them. It's slower than [code]INTERPOLATE_BILINEAR[/code], but produces higher quality results, with much less aliasing artifacts. If the image does not have mipmaps, they will be generated and used internally, but no mipmaps will be generated on the resulting image. (Note that if you intend to scale multiple copies of the original image, it's better to call [code]generate_mipmaps[/code] on it in advance, to avoid wasting processing power in generating them again and again.) On the other hand, if the image already has mipmaps, they will be used, and a new set will be generated for the resulting image.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.R8
member.summary: OpenGL texture format RED with a single component and a bitdepth of 8.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rg8
member.summary: OpenGL texture format RG with two components and a bitdepth of 8 for each.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgb8
member.summary: OpenGL texture format RGB with three components, each with a bitdepth of 8. Note that when creating an [ImageTexture], an sRGB to linear color space conversion is performed.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgba8
member.summary: OpenGL texture format RGBA with four components, each with a bitdepth of 8. Note that when creating an [ImageTexture], an sRGB to linear color space conversion is performed.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgba4444
member.summary: OpenGL texture format RGBA with four components, each with a bitdepth of 4.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgba5551
member.summary: OpenGL texture format GL_RGB5_A1 where 5 bits of depth for each component of RGB and one bit for alpha.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rf
member.summary: OpenGL texture format GL_R32F where there's one component, a 32-bit floating-point value.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgf
member.summary: OpenGL texture format GL_RG32F where there are two components, each a 32-bit floating-point values.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgbf
member.summary: OpenGL texture format GL_RGB32F where there are three components, each a 32-bit floating-point values.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgbaf
member.summary: OpenGL texture format GL_RGBA32F where there are four components, each a 32-bit floating-point values.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rh
member.summary: OpenGL texture format GL_R32F where there's one component, a 16-bit "half-precision" floating-point value.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgh
member.summary: OpenGL texture format GL_RG32F where there's two components, each a 16-bit "half-precision" floating-point value.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgbh
member.summary: OpenGL texture format GL_RGB32F where there's three components, each a 16-bit "half-precision" floating-point value.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgbah
member.summary: OpenGL texture format GL_RGBA32F where there's four components, each a 16-bit "half-precision" floating-point value.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Rgbe9995
member.summary: A special OpenGL texture format where the three color components have 9 bits of precision and all three share a single exponent.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Dxt1
member.summary: The S3TC texture format that uses Block Compression 1, and is the smallest variation of S3TC, only providing 1 bit of alpha and color data being premultiplied with alpha. More information can be found at https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/S3_Texture_Compression. Note that when creating an [ImageTexture], an sRGB to linear color space conversion is performed.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Dxt3
member.summary: The S3TC texture format that uses Block Compression 2, and color data is interpreted as not having been premultiplied by alpha. Well suited for images with sharp alpha transitions between translucent and opaque areas. Note that when creating an [ImageTexture], an sRGB to linear color space conversion is performed.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Dxt5
member.summary: The S3TC texture format also known as Block Compression 3 or BC3 that contains 64 bits of alpha channel data followed by 64 bits of DXT1-encoded color data. Color data is not premultiplied by alpha, same as DXT3. DXT5 generally produces superior results for transparency gradients than DXT3. Note that when creating an [ImageTexture], an sRGB to linear color space conversion is performed.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.RgtcR
member.summary: Texture format that uses Red Green Texture Compression, normalizing the red channel data using the same compression algorithm that DXT5 uses for the alpha channel. More information can be found here https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Red_Green_Texture_Compression.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.RgtcRg
member.summary: Texture format that uses Red Green Texture Compression, normalizing the red and green channel data using the same compression algorithm that DXT5 uses for the alpha channel.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.BptcRgba
member.summary: Texture format that uses BPTC compression with unsigned normalized RGBA components. More information can be found at https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/BPTC_Texture_Compression. Note that when creating an [ImageTexture], an sRGB to linear color space conversion is performed.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.BptcRgbf
member.summary: Texture format that uses BPTC compression with signed floating-point RGB components.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.BptcRgbfu
member.summary: Texture format that uses BPTC compression with unsigned floating-point RGB components.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Pvrtc2
member.summary: Texture format used on PowerVR-supported mobile platforms, uses 2 bit color depth with no alpha. More information on PVRTC can be found here https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PVRTC. Note that when creating an [ImageTexture], an sRGB to linear color space conversion is performed.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Pvrtc2a
member.summary: Same as PVRTC2, but with an alpha component.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Pvrtc4
member.summary: Similar to PVRTC2, but with 4 bit color depth and no alpha.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Pvrtc4a
member.summary: Same as PVRTC4, but with an alpha component.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Etc
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression format, also referred to as 'ETC1', and is part of the OpenGL ES graphics standard. An overview of the format is given at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ericsson_Texture_Compression#ETC1.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Etc2R11
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression format 2 variant R11_EAC, which provides one channel of unsigned data.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Etc2R11s
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression format 2 variant SIGNED_R11_EAC, which provides one channel of signed data.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Etc2Rg11
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression format 2 variant RG11_EAC, which provides two channels of unsigned data.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Etc2Rg11s
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression format 2 variant SIGNED_RG11_EAC, which provides two channels of signed data.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Etc2Rgb8
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression format 2 variant RGB8, which is a followup of ETC1 and compresses RGB888 data. Note that when creating an [ImageTexture], an sRGB to linear color space conversion is performed.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Etc2Rgba8
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression format 2 variant RGBA8, which compresses RGBA8888 data with full alpha support. Note that when creating an [ImageTexture], an sRGB to linear color space conversion is performed.

member.name: F:Godot.Image.Format.Etc2Rgb8a1
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression format 2 variant RGB8_PUNCHTHROUGH_ALPHA1, which compresses RGBA data to make alpha either fully transparent or fully opaque. Note that when creating an [ImageTexture], an sRGB to linear color space conversion is performed.

member.summary: Resizes the image to the given [code]width[/code] and [code]height[/code]. New pixels are calculated using [code]interpolation[/code]. See [code]interpolation[/code] constants.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Crop(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Crops the image to the given [code]width[/code] and [code]height[/code]. If the specified size is larger than the current size, the extra area is filled with black pixels.

member.summary: Flips the image horizontally.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.FlipY
member.summary: Flips the image vertically.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GenerateMipmaps(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates mipmaps for the image. Mipmaps are pre-calculated and lower resolution copies of the image. Mipmaps are automatically used if the image needs to be scaled down when rendered. This improves image quality and the performance of the rendering. Returns an error if the image is compressed, in a custom format or if the image's width/height is 0.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.ClearMipmaps
member.summary: Removes the image's mipmaps.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Create(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Godot.Image.Format)
member.summary: Creates an empty image of given size and format. See [code]FORMAT_*[/code] constants. If [code]use_mipmaps[/code] is true then generate mipmaps for this image. See the [code]generate_mipmaps[/code] method.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.CreateFromData(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Godot.Image.Format,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new image of given size and format. See [code]FORMAT_*[/code] constants. Fills the image with the given raw data. If [code]use_mipmaps[/code] is true then generate mipmaps for this image. See the [code]generate_mipmaps[/code] method.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the image has no data.

member.summary: Loads an image from file [code]path[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.SavePng(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the image as a PNG file to [code]path[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.DetectAlpha
member.summary: Returns ALPHA_BLEND if the image has data for alpha values. Returns ALPHA_BIT if all the alpha values are below a certain threshold or the maximum value. Returns ALPHA_NONE if no data for alpha values is found.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.IsInvisible
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if all the image's pixels have an alpha value of 0. Returns [code]false[/code] if any pixel has an alpha value higher than 0.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Compress(Godot.Image.CompressMode,Godot.Image.CompressSource,System.Single)
member.summary: Compresses the image to use less memory. Can not directly access pixel data while the image is compressed. Returns error if the chosen compression mode is not available. See [code]COMPRESS_*[/code] constants.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Decompress
member.summary: Decompresses the image if it is compressed. Returns an error if decompress function is not available.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.IsCompressed
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the image is compressed.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.FixAlphaEdges
member.summary: Blends low-alpha pixels with nearby pixels.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.PremultiplyAlpha
member.summary: Multiplies color values with alpha values. Resulting color values for a pixel are [code](color * alpha)/256[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.SrgbToLinear
member.summary: Converts the raw data from the sRGB colorspace to a linear scale.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.NormalmapToXy
member.summary: Converts the image's data to represent coordinates on a 3D plane. This is used when the image represents a normalmap. A normalmap can add lots of detail to a 3D surface without increasing the polygon count.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.BlitRect(Godot.Image,Godot.Rect2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Copies [code]src_rect[/code] from [code]src[/code] image to this image at coordinates [code]dst[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.BlitRectMask(Godot.Image,Godot.Image,Godot.Rect2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Blits [code]src_rect[/code] area from [code]src[/code] image to this image at the coordinates given by [code]dst[/code]. [code]src[/code] pixel is copied onto [code]dst[/code] if the corresponding [code]mask[/code] pixel's alpha value is not 0. [code]src[/code] image and [code]mask[/code] image [b]must[/b] have the same size (width and height) but they can have different formats.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.BlendRect(Godot.Image,Godot.Rect2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Alpha-blends [code]src_rect[/code] from [code]src[/code] image to this image at coordinates [code]dest[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.BlendRectMask(Godot.Image,Godot.Image,Godot.Rect2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Alpha-blends [code]src_rect[/code] from [code]src[/code] image to this image using [code]mask[/code] image at coordinates [code]dst[/code]. Alpha channels are required for both [code]src[/code] and [code]mask[/code]. [code]dst[/code] pixels and [code]src[/code] pixels will blend if the corresponding mask pixel's alpha value is not 0. [code]src[/code] image and [code]mask[/code] image [b]must[/b] have the same size (width and height) but they can have different formats.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Fill(Godot.Color)
member.summary: Fills the image with a given [Color].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetUsedRect
member.summary: Returns a [Rect2] enclosing the visible portion of the image.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetRect(Godot.Rect2)
member.summary: Returns a new image that is a copy of the image's area specified with [code]rect[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.CopyFrom(Godot.Image)
member.summary: Copies [code]src[/code] image to this image.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Lock
member.summary: Locks the data for writing access.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Unlock
member.summary: Unlocks the data and prevents changes.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetPixel(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the color of the pixel at [code](x, y)[/code] if the image is locked. If the image is unlocked it always returns a [Color] with the value [code](0, 0, 0, 1.0)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.SetPixel(System.Int32,System.Int32,Godot.Color)
member.summary: Sets the [Color] of the pixel at [code](x, y)[/code] if the image is locked. Example: [codeblock] var img = Image.new() img.create(img_width, img_height, false, Image.FORMAT_RGBA8) img.lock() img.set_pixel(x, y, color) # Works img.unlock() img.set_pixel(x, y, color) # Does not have an effect [/codeblock]
