member.name: T:Godot.Input
member.summary: A Singleton that deals with inputs. This includes key presses, mouse buttons and movement, joypads, and input actions. Actions and their events can be set in the Project Settings / Input Map tab. Or be set with [InputMap].

member.name: F:Godot.Input.MouseMode.Visible
member.summary: Makes the mouse cursor visible if it is hidden.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.MouseMode.Hidden
member.summary: Makes the mouse cursor hidden if it is visible.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.MouseMode.Captured
member.summary: Captures the mouse. The mouse will be hidden and unable to leave the game window. But it will still register movement and mouse button presses.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.MouseMode.Confined
member.summary: Makes the mouse cursor visible but confines it to the game window.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Arrow
member.summary: Arrow cursor. Standard, default pointing cursor.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Ibeam
member.summary: I-beam cursor. Usually used to show where the text cursor will appear when the mouse is clicked.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.PointingHand
member.summary: Pointing hand cursor. Usually used to indicate the pointer is over a link or other interactable item.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Cross
member.summary: Cross cursor. Typically appears over regions in which a drawing operation can be performed or for selections.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Wait
member.summary: Wait cursor. Indicates that the application is busy performing an operation.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Busy
member.summary: Busy cursor. See [code]CURSOR_WAIT[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Drag
member.summary: Drag cursor. Usually displayed when dragging something.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.CanDrop
member.summary: Can drop cursor. Usually displayed when dragging something to indicate that it can be dropped at the current position.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Forbidden
member.summary: Forbidden cursor. Indicates that the current action is forbidden (for example, when dragging something) or that the control at a position is disabled.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Vsize
member.summary: Vertical resize mouse cursor. A double headed vertical arrow. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel vertically.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Hsize
member.summary: Horizontal resize mouse cursor. A double headed horizontal arrow. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel horizontally.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Bdiagsize
member.summary: Window resize mouse cursor. The cursor is a double headed arrow that goes from the bottom left to the top right. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Fdiagsize
member.summary: Window resize mouse cursor. The cursor is a double headed arrow that goes from the top left to the bottom right, the opposite of [code]CURSOR_BDIAGSIZE[/code]. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Move
member.summary: Move cursor. Indicates that something can be moved.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Vsplit
member.summary: Vertical split mouse cursor. On Windows, it's the same as [code]CURSOR_VSIZE[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Hsplit
member.summary: Horizontal split mouse cursor. On Windows, it's the same as [code]CURSOR_HSIZE[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.Input.CursorShape.Help
member.summary: Help cursor. Usually a question mark.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.IsKeyPressed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if you are pressing the key. You can pass [code]KEY_*[/code], which are pre-defined constants listed in [@GlobalScope].

member.name: M:Godot.Input.IsMouseButtonPressed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if you are pressing the mouse button. You can pass [code]BUTTON_*[/code], which are pre-defined constants listed in [@GlobalScope].

member.name: M:Godot.Input.IsJoyButtonPressed(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if you are pressing the joypad button. (see [code]JOY_*[/code] constants in [@GlobalScope])

member.name: M:Godot.Input.IsActionPressed(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if you are pressing the action event.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.IsActionJustPressed(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] when the user starts pressing the action event, meaning it's true only on the frame that the user pressed down the button. This is useful for code that needs to run only once when an action is pressed, instead of every frame while it's pressed.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.IsActionJustReleased(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] when the user stops pressing the action event, meaning it's true only on the frame that the user released the button.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetActionStrength(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a value between 0 and 1 representing the intensity of the given action. In a joypad, for example, the further away the axis (analog sticks or L2, R2 triggers) is from the dead zone, the closer the value will be to 1. If the action is mapped to a control that has no axis as the keyboard, the value returned will be 0 or 1.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.AddJoyMapping(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a new mapping entry (in SDL2 format) to the mapping database. Optionally update already connected devices.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.RemoveJoyMapping(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all mappings from the internal db that match the given uid.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.IsJoyKnown(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the system knows the specified device. This means that it sets all button and axis indices exactly as defined in the [code]JOY_*[/code] constants (see [@GlobalScope]). Unknown joypads are not expected to match these constants, but you can still retrieve events from them.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyAxis(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the current value of the joypad axis at given index (see [code]JOY_*[/code] constants in [@GlobalScope])

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the name of the joypad at the specified device index

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyGuid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a SDL2 compatible device guid on platforms that use gamepad remapping. Returns "Default Gamepad" otherwise.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetConnectedJoypads
member.summary: Returns an [Array] containing the device IDs of all currently connected joypads.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyVibrationStrength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the strength of the joypad vibration: x is the strength of the weak motor, and y is the strength of the strong motor.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyVibrationDuration(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the duration of the current vibration effect in seconds.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyButtonString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Receives a [code]JOY_BUTTON_*[/code] Enum and returns its equivalent name as a string.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyButtonIndexFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of the provided button name.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyAxisString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Receives a [code]JOY_AXIS_*[/code] Enum and returns its equivalent name as a string.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyAxisIndexFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of the provided axis name.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.StartJoyVibration(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Starts to vibrate the joypad. Joypads usually come with two rumble motors, a strong and a weak one. weak_magnitude is the strength of the weak motor (between 0 and 1) and strong_magnitude is the strength of the strong motor (between 0 and 1). duration is the duration of the effect in seconds (a duration of 0 will try to play the vibration indefinitely). Note that not every hardware is compatible with long effect durations, it is recommended to restart an effect if in need to play it for more than a few seconds.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.StopJoyVibration(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stops the vibration of the joypad.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetGravity
member.summary: If the device has an accelerometer, this will return the gravity. Otherwise, it returns an empty [Vector3].

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetAccelerometer
member.summary: If the device has an accelerometer, this will return the acceleration. Otherwise, it returns an empty [Vector3]. Note this method returns an empty [Vector3] when running from the editor even when your device has an accelerometer. You must export your project to a supported device to read values from the accelerometer.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetMagnetometer
member.summary: If the device has a magnetometer, this will return the magnetic field strength in micro-Tesla for all axes.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetGyroscope
member.summary: If the device has a gyroscope, this will return the rate of rotation in rad/s around a device's x, y, and z axis. Otherwise, it returns an empty [Vector3].

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetLastMouseSpeed
member.summary: Returns the mouse speed for the last time the cursor was moved, and this until the next frame where the mouse moves. This means that even if the mouse is not moving, this function will still return the value of the last motion.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetMouseButtonMask
member.summary: Returns mouse buttons as a bitmask. If multiple mouse buttons are pressed at the same time the bits are added together.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.SetMouseMode(Godot.Input.MouseMode)
member.summary: Set the mouse mode. See the constants for more information.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetMouseMode
member.summary: Return the mouse mode. See the constants for more information.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.WarpMousePosition(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the mouse position to the specified vector.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.ActionPress(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: This will simulate pressing the specified action. The strength can be used for non-boolean actions, it's ranged between 0 and 1 representing the intensity of the given action.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.ActionRelease(System.String)
member.summary: If the specified action is already pressed, this will release it.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.SetDefaultCursorShape(Godot.Input.CursorShape)
member.summary: Sets the default cursor shape to be used in the viewport instead of [code]CURSOR_ARROW[/code]. Note that if you want to change the default cursor shape for [Control]'s nodes, use [member Control.mouse_default_cursor_shape] instead.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.SetCustomMouseCursor(Godot.Resource,Godot.Input.CursorShape,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2})
member.summary: Sets a custom mouse cursor image, which is only visible inside the game window. The hotspot can also be specified. Passing [code]null[/code] to the image parameter resets to the system cursor. See enum [code]CURSOR_*[/code] for the list of shapes. [code]image[/code]'s size must be lower than 256x256. [code]hotspot[/code] must be within [code]image[/code]'s size. <param name="hotspot">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Input.ParseInputEvent(Godot.InputEvent)
member.summary: Feeds an [InputEvent] to the game. Can be used to artificially trigger input events from code.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.SetUseAccumulatedInput(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to accumulate similar input events sent by the operating system. Defaults to [code]true[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.InputEvent
member.summary: Base class of all sort of input event. See [method Node._input].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEvent.Device
member.summary: The event's device ID.

member.name: M:Godot.InputEvent.IsAction(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if this input event matches a pre-defined action of any type.

member.name: M:Godot.InputEvent.IsActionPressed(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given action is being pressed (and is not an echo event for KEY events). Not relevant for the event types [code]MOUSE_MOTION[/code], [code]SCREEN_DRAG[/code] or [code]NONE[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.InputEvent.IsActionReleased(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given action is released (i.e. not pressed). Not relevant for the event types [code]MOUSE_MOTION[/code], [code]SCREEN_DRAG[/code] or [code]NONE[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.InputEvent.IsPressed
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if this input event is pressed. Not relevant for the event types [code]MOUSE_MOTION[/code], [code]SCREEN_DRAG[/code] or [code]NONE[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.InputEvent.IsEcho
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if this input event is an echo event (only for events of type KEY).

member.name: M:Godot.InputEvent.AsText
member.summary: Returns a [String] representation of the event.

member.name: M:Godot.InputEvent.IsActionType
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if this input event's type is one of the [code]InputEvent[/code] constants.

member.name: M:Godot.InputEvent.XformedBy(Godot.Transform2D,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2})
member.summary: <param name="localOfs">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: T:Godot.InputEventAction
member.summary: Contains a generic action which can be targeted from several type of inputs. Actions can be created from the project settings menu [code]Project > Project Settings > Input Map[/code]. See [method Node._input].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventAction.Action
member.summary: The action's name. Actions are accessed via this [String].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventAction.Pressed
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the action's state is pressed. If [code]false[/code], the action's state is released.

member.name: T:Godot.InputEventJoypadButton
member.summary: Input event type for gamepad buttons. For joysticks see [InputEventJoypadMotion].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventJoypadButton.ButtonIndex
member.summary: Button identifier. One of the [code]JOY_BUTTON_*[/code] constants from [@GlobalScope].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventJoypadButton.Pressure
member.summary: Represents the pressure the user puts on the button with his finger, if the controller supports it. Ranges from [code]0[/code] to [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventJoypadButton.Pressed
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the button's state is pressed. If [code]false[/code], the button's state is released.

member.name: T:Godot.InputEventJoypadMotion
member.summary: Stores information about joystick motions. One [code]InputEventJoypadMotion[/code] represents one axis at a time.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventJoypadMotion.Axis
member.summary: Axis identifier. Use one of the [code]JOY_AXIS_*[/code] constants in [@GlobalScope].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventJoypadMotion.AxisValue
member.summary: Current position of the joystick on the given axis. The value ranges from [code]-1.0[/code] to [code]1.0[/code]. A value of [code]0[/code] means the axis is in its resting position.

member.name: T:Godot.InputEventKey
member.summary: Stores key presses on the keyboard. Supports key presses, key releases and [member echo] events.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventKey.Pressed
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the key's state is pressed. If [code]false[/code], the key's state is released.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventKey.Scancode
member.summary: Key scancode, one of the [code]KEY_*[/code] constants in [@GlobalScope].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventKey.Unicode
member.summary: Key unicode identifier when relevant.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventKey.Echo
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the key was already pressed before this event. It means the user is holding the key down.

member.name: M:Godot.InputEventKey.GetScancodeWithModifiers
member.summary: Returns the scancode combined with modifier keys such as [code]Shift[/code] or [code]Alt[/code]. See also [InputEventWithModifiers].

member.name: T:Godot.InputEventMouse
member.summary: Stores general mouse events information.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventMouse.ButtonMask
member.summary: Mouse button mask identifier, one of or a bitwise combination of the BUTTON_MASK_* constants in [@GlobalScope].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventMouse.Position
member.summary: Mouse local position relative to the [Viewport]. If used in [method Control._gui_input] the position is relative to the current [Control] which is under the mouse.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventMouse.GlobalPosition
member.summary: Mouse position relative to the current [Viewport] when used in [method Control._gui_input], otherwise is at 0,0.

member.name: T:Godot.InputEventMouseButton
member.summary: Contains mouse click information. See [method Node._input].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventMouseButton.Factor
member.summary: Magnitude. Amount (or delta) of the event. Used for scroll events, indicates scroll amount (vertically or horizontally). Only supported on some platforms, sensitivity varies by platform. May be 0 if not supported.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventMouseButton.ButtonIndex
member.summary: Mouse button identifier, one of the BUTTON_* or BUTTON_WHEEL_* constants in [@GlobalScope].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventMouseButton.Pressed
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the mouse button's state is pressed. If [code]false[/code], the mouse button's state is released.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventMouseButton.Doubleclick
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the mouse button's state is a double-click.

member.name: T:Godot.InputEventMouseMotion
member.summary: Contains mouse motion information. Supports relative, absolute positions and speed. See [method Node._input].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventMouseMotion.Relative
member.summary: Mouse position relative to the previous position (position at the last frame).

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventMouseMotion.Speed
member.summary: Mouse speed.

member.name: T:Godot.InputEventScreenDrag
member.summary: Contains screen drag information. See [method Node._input].

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventScreenDrag.Position
member.summary: Drag position.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventScreenDrag.Relative
member.summary: Drag position relative to its start position.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventScreenDrag.Speed
member.summary: Drag speed.

member.name: T:Godot.InputEventScreenTouch
member.summary: Stores multi-touch press/release information. Supports touch press, touch release and [member index] for multi-touch count and order.

member.summary: Touch index in the case of a multi-touch event. One index = one finger.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventScreenTouch.Position
member.summary: Touch position.

member.name: P:Godot.InputEventScreenTouch.Pressed
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the touch's state is pressed. If [code]false[/code], the touch's state is released.

member.name: T:Godot.InputEventWithModifiers
member.summary: Contains keys events information with modifiers support like [code]SHIFT[/code] or [code]ALT[/code]. See [method Node._input].

member.summary: State of the Shift modifier.

member.summary: State of the Ctrl modifier.

member.name: T:Godot.InputMap
member.summary: Manages all [InputEventAction] which can be created/modified from the project settings menu [code]Project > Project Settings > Input Map[/code] or in code with [method add_action] and [method action_add_event]. See [method Node._input].

member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [code]InputMap[/code] has a registered action with the given name.

member.name: M:Godot.InputMap.GetActions
member.summary: Returns an array of all actions in the [code]InputMap[/code].

member.summary: Adds an empty action to the [code]InputMap[/code] with a configurable [code]deadzone[/code]. An [InputEvent] can then be added to this action with [method action_add_event].

member.name: M:Godot.InputMap.EraseAction(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an action from the [code]InputMap[/code].

member.summary: Adds an [InputEvent] to an action. This [InputEvent] will trigger the action.

member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the action has the given [InputEvent] associated with it.

member.name: M:Godot.InputMap.ActionEraseEvent(System.String,Godot.InputEvent)
member.summary: Removes an [InputEvent] from an action.

member.name: M:Godot.InputMap.ActionEraseEvents(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all events from an action.

member.name: M:Godot.InputMap.GetActionList(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an array of [InputEvent]s associated with a given action.

member.name: M:Godot.InputMap.EventIsAction(Godot.InputEvent,System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given event is part of an existing action. This method ignores keyboard modifiers if the given [InputEvent] is not pressed (for proper release detection). See [method action_has_event] if you don't want this behavior.

member.name: M:Godot.InputMap.LoadFromGlobals
member.summary: Clears all [InputEventAction] in the [code]InputMap[/code] and load it anew from [ProjectSettings].

member.name: T:Godot.InstancePlaceholder
member.summary: Turning on the option [b]Load As Placeholder[/b] for an instanced scene in the editor causes it to be replaced by an InstancePlaceholder when running the game. This makes it possible to delay actually loading the scene until calling [method replace_by_instance]. This is useful to avoid loading large scenes all at once by loading parts of it selectively. The InstancePlaceholder does not have a transform. This causes any child nodes to be positioned relatively to the Viewport from point (0,0), rather than their parent as displayed in the editor. Replacing the placeholder with a scene with a transform will transform children relatively to their parent again.

member.name: M:Godot.InstancePlaceholder.ReplaceByInstance(Godot.PackedScene)
member.summary: Replace this placeholder by the scene handed as an argument, or the original scene if no argument is given. As for all resources, the scene is loaded only if it's not loaded already. By manually loading the scene beforehand, delays caused by this function can be avoided.

member.name: M:Godot.InstancePlaceholder.GetInstancePath
member.summary: Retrieve the path to the [PackedScene] resource file that is loaded by default when calling [method replace_by_instance].

member.name: T:Godot.InterpolatedCamera
member.summary: InterpolatedCamera is a [Camera] which smoothly moves to match a target node's position and rotation. If it is not [member enabled] or does not have a valid target set, InterpolatedCamera acts like a normal Camera.

member.name: P:Godot.InterpolatedCamera.Target
member.summary: The target's [NodePath].

member.name: P:Godot.InterpolatedCamera.Speed
member.summary: How quickly the camera moves toward its target. Higher values will result in tighter camera motion.

member.name: P:Godot.InterpolatedCamera.Enabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], and a target is set, the camera will move automatically.

member.name: M:Godot.InterpolatedCamera.SetTarget(Godot.Object)
member.summary: Sets the node to move toward and orient with.

member.name: T:Godot.IP
member.summary: IP contains support functions for the Internet Protocol (IP). TCP/IP support is in different classes (see [StreamPeerTCP] and [TCP_Server]). IP provides DNS hostname resolution support, both blocking and threaded.

member.name: F:Godot.IP.ResolverInvalidId
member.summary: Invalid ID constant. Returned if [code]RESOLVER_MAX_QUERIES[/code] is exceeded.

member.summary: DNS hostname resolver status: No status.

member.name: F:Godot.IP.ResolverStatus.Waiting
member.summary: DNS hostname resolver status: Waiting.

member.name: F:Godot.IP.ResolverStatus.Done
member.summary: DNS hostname resolver status: Done.

member.name: F:Godot.IP.ResolverStatus.Error
member.summary: DNS hostname resolver status: Error.

member.name: F:Godot.IP.Type.None
member.summary: Address type: None.

member.name: F:Godot.IP.Type.Ipv4
member.summary: Address type: Internet protocol version 4 (IPv4).

member.name: F:Godot.IP.Type.Ipv6
member.summary: Address type: Internet protocol version 6 (IPv6).

member.name: F:Godot.IP.Type.Any
member.summary: Address type: Any.

member.name: M:Godot.IP.ResolveHostname(System.String,Godot.IP.Type)
member.summary: Returns a given hostname's IPv4 or IPv6 address when resolved (blocking-type method). The address type returned depends on the TYPE_* constant given as "ip_type".

member.name: M:Godot.IP.ResolveHostnameQueueItem(System.String,Godot.IP.Type)
member.summary: Creates a queue item to resolve a hostname to an IPv4 or IPv6 address depending on the TYPE_* constant given as "ip_type". Returns the queue ID if successful, or RESOLVER_INVALID_ID on error.

member.name: M:Godot.IP.GetResolveItemStatus(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a queued hostname's status as a RESOLVER_STATUS_* constant, given its queue "id".

member.name: M:Godot.IP.GetResolveItemAddress(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a queued hostname's IP address, given its queue "id". Returns an empty string on error or if resolution hasn't happened yet (see [method get_resolve_item_status]).

member.name: M:Godot.IP.EraseResolveItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a given item "id" from the queue. This should be used to free a queue after it has completed to enable more queries to happen.

member.name: M:Godot.IP.GetLocalAddresses
member.summary: Returns all of the user's current IPv4 and IPv6 addresses as an array.

member.name: M:Godot.IP.ClearCache(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all of a "hostname"'s cached references. If no "hostname" is given then all cached IP addresses are removed.

member.name: T:Godot.ItemList
member.summary: This control provides a selectable list of items that may be in a single (or multiple columns) with option of text, icons, or both text and icon. Tooltips are supported and may be different for every item in the list. Selectable items in the list may be selected or deselected and multiple selection may be enabled. Selection with right mouse button may also be enabled to allow use of popup context menus. Items may also be 'activated' with a double click (or Enter key).

member.name: P:Godot.ItemList.SelectMode
member.summary: Allow single or multiple selection. See the [code]SELECT_*[/code] constants.

member.name: P:Godot.ItemList.AllowReselect
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the currently selected item may be selected again.

member.name: P:Godot.ItemList.AllowRmbSelect
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], a right mouse button click can select items.

member.name: M:Godot.ItemList.AddItem(System.String,Godot.Texture,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds an item to the item list with specified text. Specify an icon of null for a list item with no icon. If selectable is true the list item will be selectable.

member.name: M:Godot.ItemList.AddIconItem(Godot.Texture,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds an item to the item list with no text, only an icon.

member.name: T:Godot.JavaScript
member.summary: The JavaScript singleton is implemented only in HTML5 export. It's used to access the browser's JavaScript context. This allows interaction with embedding pages or calling third-party JavaScript APIs.

member.name: M:Godot.JavaScript.Eval(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Execute the string [code]code[/code] as JavaScript code within the browser window. This is a call to the actual global JavaScript function [code]eval()[/code]. If [code]use_global_execution_context[/code] is [code]true[/code], the code will be evaluated in the global execution context. Otherwise, it is evaluated in the execution context of a function within the engine's runtime environment.

member.name: T:Godot.Joint
member.summary: Joints are used to bind together two physics bodies. They have a solver priority and can define if the bodies of the two attached nodes should be able to collide with each other.

member.name: P:Godot.Joint.Nodes__nodeA
member.summary: The node attached to the first side (A) of the joint.

member.name: P:Godot.Joint.Nodes__nodeB
member.summary: The node attached to the second side (B) of the joint.

member.name: P:Godot.Joint.Solver__priority
member.summary: The priority used to define which solver is executed first for multiple joints. The lower the value, the higher the priority.

member.name: P:Godot.Joint.Collision__excludeNodes
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the two bodies of the nodes are not able to collide with each other.

member.name: T:Godot.Joint2D
member.summary: Base node for all joint constraints in 2D physics. Joints take 2 bodies and apply a custom constraint.

member.name: P:Godot.Joint2D.NodeA
member.summary: The first body attached to the joint. Must derive from [PhysicsBody2D].

member.name: P:Godot.Joint2D.NodeB
member.summary: The second body attached to the joint. Must derive from [PhysicsBody2D].

member.name: P:Godot.Joint2D.Bias
member.summary: When [member node_a] and [member node_b] move in different directions the [code]bias[/code] controls how fast the joint pulls them back to their original position. The lower the [code]bias[/code] the more the two bodies can pull on the joint. Default value: [code]0[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.Joint2D.DisableCollision
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], [member node_a] and [member node_b] can collide. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.JSONParseResult

member.name: P:Godot.JSONParseResult.ErrorLine

member.name: P:Godot.JSONParseResult.Result
T:Godot.KinematicBody
member.summary: Kinematic bodies are special types of bodies that are meant to be user-controlled. They are not affected by physics at all (to other types of bodies, such a character or a rigid body, these are the same as a static body). They have however, two main uses: Simulated Motion: When these bodies are moved manually, either from code or from an AnimationPlayer (with process mode set to fixed), the physics will automatically compute an estimate of their linear and angular velocity. This makes them very useful for moving platforms or other AnimationPlayer-controlled objects (like a door, a bridge that opens, etc). Kinematic Characters: KinematicBody also has an API for moving objects (the [method move_and_collide] and [method move_and_slide] methods) while performing collision tests. This makes them really useful to implement characters that collide against a world, but that don't require advanced physics.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicBody.MoveLockX
member.summary: Lock the body's movement in the x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicBody.MoveLockY
member.summary: Lock the body's movement in the y-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicBody.MoveLockZ
member.summary: Lock the body's movement in the z-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicBody.Collision__safeMargin
member.summary: If the body is at least this close to another body, this body will consider them to be colliding.

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.MoveAndCollide(Godot.Vector3,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the body along the vector [code]rel_vec[/code]. The body will stop if it collides. Returns a [KinematicCollision], which contains information about the collision. If [code]test_only[/code] is [code]true[/code], the body does not move but the would-be collision information is given.

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.MoveAndSlide(Godot.Vector3,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector3},System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the body along a vector. If the body collides with another, it will slide along the other body rather than stop immediately. If the other body is a [code]KinematicBody[/code] or [RigidBody], it will also be affected by the motion of the other body. You can use this to make moving or rotating platforms, or to make nodes push other nodes. [code]linear_velocity[/code] is the velocity vector (typically meters per second). Unlike in [method move_and_collide], you should [i]not[/i] multiply it by [code]delta[/code] — the physics engine handles applying the velocity. [code]floor_normal[/code] is the up direction, used to determine what is a wall and what is a floor or a ceiling. If set to the default value of [code]Vector3(0, 0, 0)[/code], everything is considered a wall. This is useful for topdown games. If the body is standing on a slope and the horizontal speed (relative to the floor's speed) goes below [code]slope_stop_min_velocity[/code], the body will stop completely. This prevents the body from sliding down slopes when you include gravity in [code]linear_velocity[/code]. When set to lower values, the body will not be able to stand still on steep slopes. If the body collides, it will change direction a maximum of [code]max_slides[/code] times before it stops. [code]floor_max_angle[/code] is the maximum angle (in radians) where a slope is still considered a floor (or a ceiling), rather than a wall. The default value equals 45 degrees. Returns the movement that remained when the body stopped. To get more detailed information about collisions that occurred, use [method get_slide_collision]. <param name="floorNormal">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector3(0, 0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.MoveAndSlideWithSnap(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector3},System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the body while keeping it attached to slopes. Similar to [method move_and_slide]. As long as the [code]snap[/code] vector is in contact with the ground, the body will remain attached to the surface. This means you must disable snap in order to jump, for example. You can do this by setting[code]snap[/code] to[code](0, 0, 0)[/code] or by using [method move_and_slide] instead. <param name="floorNormal">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector3(0, 0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.TestMove(Godot.Transform,Godot.Vector3,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks for collisions without moving the body. Virtually sets the node's position, scale and rotation to that of the given [Transform], then tries to move the body along the vector [code]rel_vec[/code]. Returns [code]true[/code] if a collision would occur.

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.IsOnFloor
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the body is on the floor. Only updates when calling [method move_and_slide].

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.IsOnCeiling
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the body is on the ceiling. Only updates when calling [method move_and_slide].

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.IsOnWall
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the body is on a wall. Only updates when calling [method move_and_slide].

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.GetFloorVelocity
member.summary: Returns the velocity of the floor. Only updates when calling [method move_and_slide].

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.GetSlideCount
member.summary: Returns the number of times the body collided and changed direction during the last call to [method move_and_slide].

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.GetSlideCollision(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a [KinematicCollision], which contains information about a collision that occurred during the last [method move_and_slide] call. Since the body can collide several times in a single call to [method move_and_slide], you must specify the index of the collision in the range 0 to ([method get_slide_count] - 1).

member.name: T:Godot.KinematicBody2D
member.summary: Kinematic bodies are special types of bodies that are meant to be user-controlled. They are not affected by physics at all (to other types of bodies, such a character or a rigid body, these are the same as a static body). They have however, two main uses: Simulated Motion: When these bodies are moved manually, either from code or from an AnimationPlayer (with process mode set to fixed), the physics will automatically compute an estimate of their linear and angular velocity. This makes them very useful for moving platforms or other AnimationPlayer-controlled objects (like a door, a bridge that opens, etc). Kinematic Characters: KinematicBody2D also has an API for moving objects (the [method move_and_collide] and [method move_and_slide] methods) while performing collision tests. This makes them really useful to implement characters that collide against a world, but that don't require advanced physics.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicBody2D.Collision__safeMargin
member.summary: If the body is at least this close to another body, this body will consider them to be colliding.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicBody2D.Motion__syncToPhysics
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the body's movement will be synchronized to the physics frame. This is useful when animating movement via [AnimationPlayer], for example on moving platforms. Do [b]not[/b] use together with [method move_and_slide] or [method move_and_collide] functions.

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody2D.MoveAndCollide(Godot.Vector2,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the body along the vector [code]rel_vec[/code]. The body will stop if it collides. Returns a [KinematicCollision2D], which contains information about the collision.

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody2D.MoveAndSlide(Godot.Vector2,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2},System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the body along a vector. If the body collides with another, it will slide along the other body rather than stop immediately. If the other body is a [code]KinematicBody2D[/code] or [RigidBody2D], it will also be affected by the motion of the other body. You can use this to make moving or rotating platforms, or to make nodes push other nodes. [code]linear_velocity[/code] is the velocity vector in pixels per second. Unlike in [method move_and_collide], you should [i]not[/i] multiply it by [code]delta[/code] — the physics engine handles applying the velocity. [code]floor_normal[/code] is the up direction, used to determine what is a wall and what is a floor or a ceiling. If set to the default value of [code]Vector2(0, 0)[/code], everything is considered a wall. This is useful for topdown games. If the body is standing on a slope and the horizontal speed (relative to the floor's speed) goes below [code]slope_stop_min_velocity[/code], the body will stop completely. This prevents the body from sliding down slopes when you include gravity in [code]linear_velocity[/code]. When set to lower values, the body will not be able to stand still on steep slopes. If the body collides, it will change direction a maximum of [code]max_slides[/code] times before it stops. [code]floor_max_angle[/code] is the maximum angle (in radians) where a slope is still considered a floor (or a ceiling), rather than a wall. The default value equals 45 degrees. Returns the [code]linear_velocity[/code] vector, rotated and/or scaled if a slide collision occurred. To get more detailed information about collisions that occurred, use [method get_slide_collision]. <param name="floorNormal">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody2D.MoveAndSlideWithSnap(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2},System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the body while keeping it attached to slopes. Similar to [method move_and_slide]. As long as the [code]snap[/code] vector is in contact with the ground, the body will remain attached to the surface. This means you must disable snap in order to jump, for example. You can do this by setting [code]snap[/code] to [code](0, 0)[/code] or by using [method move_and_slide] instead. <param name="floorNormal">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: T:Godot.KinematicCollision
member.summary: Contains collision data for KinematicBody collisions. When a [KinematicBody] is moved using [method KinematicBody.move_and_collide], it stops if it detects a collision with another body. If a collision is detected, a KinematicCollision object is returned. This object contains information about the collision, including the colliding object, the remaining motion, and the collision position. This information can be used to calculate a collision response.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.Position
member.summary: The point of collision.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.Normal
member.summary: The colliding body's shape's normal at the point of collision.

member.summary: The distance the moving object traveled before collision.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.Remainder
member.summary: The moving object's remaining movement vector.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.LocalShape
member.summary: The moving object's colliding shape.

member.summary: The colliding body.

member.summary: The colliding body's unique [RID].

member.summary: The colliding body's shape.

member.name: T:Godot.Label
member.summary: Label displays plain text on the screen. It gives you control over the horizontal and vertical alignment, and can wrap the text inside the node's bounding rectangle. It doesn't support bold, italics or other formatting. For that, use [RichTextLabel] instead. Note that contrarily to most other [Control]s, Label's [member Control.mouse_filter] defaults to MOUSE_FILTER_IGNORE (i.e. it doesn't react to mouse input events). This implies that a label won't display any configured [member Control.hint_tooltip], unless you change its mouse filter.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.AlignEnum.Left
member.summary: Align rows to the left (default).

member.name: F:Godot.Label.AlignEnum.Center
member.summary: Align rows centered.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.AlignEnum.Right
member.summary: Align rows to the right (default).

member.name: F:Godot.Label.AlignEnum.Fill
member.summary: Expand row whitespaces to fit the width.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.VAlign.Top
member.summary: Align the whole text to the top.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.VAlign.Center
member.summary: Align the whole text to the center.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.VAlign.Bottom
member.summary: Align the whole text to the bottom.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.VAlign.Fill
member.summary: Align the whole text by spreading the rows.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.Text
member.summary: The text to display on screen.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.Align
member.summary: Controls the text's horizontal align. Supports left, center, right, and fill, or justify. Set it to one of the [code]ALIGN_*[/code] constants.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.Valign
member.summary: Controls the text's vertical align. Supports top, center, bottom, and fill. Set it to one of the [code]VALIGN_*[/code] constants.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.Autowrap
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], wraps the text inside the node's bounding rectangle. If you resize the node, it will change its height automatically to show all the text. Default: false.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.ClipText
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the Label only shows the text that fits inside its bounding rectangle. It also lets you scale the node down freely.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.Uppercase
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], all the text displays as UPPERCASE.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.VisibleCharacters
member.summary: Restricts the number of characters to display. Set to -1 to disable.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.PercentVisible
member.summary: Limits the count of visible characters. If you set [code]percent_visible[/code] to 50, only up to half of the text's characters will display on screen. Useful to animate the text in a dialog box.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.LinesSkipped
member.summary: The node ignores the first [code]lines_skipped[/code] lines before it starts to display text.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.MaxLinesVisible
member.summary: Limits the lines of text the node shows on screen.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetLineHeight
member.summary: Returns the font size in pixels.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetLineCount
member.summary: Returns the amount of lines of text the Label has.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetVisibleLineCount
member.summary: Returns the number of lines shown. Useful if the [code]Label[/code] 's height cannot currently display all lines.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetTotalCharacterCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of printable characters in the text (excluding spaces and newlines).

member.name: T:Godot.Light
member.summary: Light is the abstract base class for light nodes, so it shouldn't be used directly (It can't be instanced). Other types of light nodes inherit from it. Light contains the common variables and parameters used for lighting.

member.name: F:Godot.Light.BakeMode.Disabled
member.summary: Light is ignored when baking. Note: hiding a light does [i]not[/i] affect baking.

member.name: F:Godot.Light.BakeMode.Indirect
member.summary: Only indirect lighting will be baked. Default value.

member.name: F:Godot.Light.BakeMode.All
member.summary: Both direct and indirect light will be baked. Note: you should hide the light if you don't want it to appear twice (dynamic and baked).

member.name: P:Godot.Light.LightColor
member.summary: The light's color.

member.name: P:Godot.Light.LightEnergy
member.summary: The light's strength multiplier.

member.name: P:Godot.Light.LightIndirectEnergy
member.summary: Secondary multiplier used with indirect light (light bounces). This works in baked light or GIProbe.

member.name: P:Godot.Light.LightNegative
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the light's effect is reversed, darkening areas and casting bright shadows. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light.LightSpecular
member.summary: The intensity of the specular blob in objects affected by the light. At [code]0[/code] the light becomes a pure diffuse light.

member.name: P:Godot.Light.LightBakeMode
member.summary: The light's bake mode. See [enum BakeMode].

member.name: P:Godot.Light.LightCullMask
member.summary: The light will affect objects in the selected layers.

member.name: P:Godot.Light.ShadowEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the light will cast shadows. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light.ShadowColor
member.summary: The color of shadows cast by this light.

member.name: P:Godot.Light.ShadowBias
member.summary: Used to adjust shadow appearance. Too small a value results in self shadowing, while too large a value causes shadows to separate from casters. Adjust as needed.

member.name: P:Godot.Light.ShadowContact
member.summary: Attempts to reduce [member shadow_bias] gap.

member.name: P:Godot.Light.EditorOnly
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the light only appears in the editor and will not be visible at runtime. Default value:[code]false[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.Light2D
member.summary: Casts light in a 2D environment. Light is defined by a (usually grayscale) texture, a color, an energy value, a mode (see constants), and various other parameters (range and shadows-related). Note that Light2D can be used as a mask.

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.ShadowFilterEnum.None
member.summary: No filter applies to the shadow map. See [member shadow_filter].

member.summary: Percentage closer filtering (5 samples) applies to the shadow map. See [member shadow_filter].

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.ShadowFilterEnum.Pcf7

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.ShadowFilterEnum.Pcf9
member.summary: Percentage closer filtering (9 samples) applies to the shadow map. See [member shadow_filter].

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.ShadowFilterEnum.Pcf13
member.summary: Percentage closer filtering (13 samples) applies to the shadow map. See [member shadow_filter].

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.ModeEnum.Add
member.summary: Adds the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it. This is the common behaviour of a light.

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.ModeEnum.Sub
member.summary: Subtracts the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it, resulting in inversed light effect.

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.ModeEnum.Mix
member.summary: Mix the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it by linear interpolation.

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.ModeEnum.Mask
member.summary: The light texture of the Light2D is used as a mask, hiding or revealing parts of the screen underneath depending on the value of each pixel of the light (mask) texture.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Enabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], Light2D will emit light. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.EditorOnly
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], Light2D will only appear when editing the scene. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Texture
member.summary: [Texture] used for the Light2D's appearance.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Offset
member.summary: The offset of the Light2D's [code]texture[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.TextureScale
member.summary: The [code]texture[/code]'s scale factor.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Color
member.summary: The Light2D's [Color].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Energy
member.summary: The Light2D's energy value. The larger the value, the stronger the light.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Mode
member.summary: The Light2D's mode. See MODE_* constants for values.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeHeight
member.summary: The height of the Light2D. Used with 2D normal mapping.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeZMin
member.summary: Minimum [code]z[/code] value of objects that are affected by the Light2D. Default value: [code]-1024[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeZMax
member.summary: Maximum [code]Z[/code] value of objects that are affected by the Light2D. Default value: [code]1024[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeLayerMin
member.summary: Minimum layer value of objects that are affected by the Light2D. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeLayerMax
member.summary: Maximum layer value of objects that are affected by the Light2D. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeItemCullMask
member.summary: The layer mask. Only objects with a matching mask will be affected by the Light2D.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.ShadowEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the Light2D will cast shadows. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.ShadowColor
member.summary: [Color] of shadows cast by the Light2D.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.ShadowBufferSize
member.summary: Shadow buffer size. Default value: [code]2048[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.ShadowGradientLength
member.summary: Smooth shadow gradient length.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.ShadowFilter
member.summary: Shadow filter type. Use [enum Light2D.ShadowFilter] constants as values. Default value: [code]SHADOW_FILTER_NONE[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.ShadowFilterSmooth
member.summary: Smoothing value for shadows.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.ShadowItemCullMask
member.summary: The shadow mask. Used with [LightOccluder2D] to cast shadows. Only occluders with a matching shadow mask will cast shadows.

member.name: T:Godot.LightOccluder2D
member.summary: Occludes light cast by a Light2D, casting shadows. The LightOccluder2D must be provided with an [OccluderPolygon2D] in order for the shadow to be computed.

member.name: P:Godot.LightOccluder2D.Occluder
member.summary: The [OccluderPolygon2D] used to compute the shadow.

member.name: P:Godot.LightOccluder2D.LightMask
member.summary: The LightOccluder2D's light mask. The LightOccluder2D will cast shadows only from Light2D(s) that have the same light mask(s).

member.name: T:Godot.Line2D
member.summary: A line through several points in 2D space.

member.name: F:Godot.Line2D.LineTextureMode.None
member.summary: Takes the left pixels of the texture and renders it over the whole line.

member.name: F:Godot.Line2D.LineTextureMode.Tile
member.summary: Tiles the texture over the line. The texture need to be imported with Repeat Enabled for it to work properly.

member.name: F:Godot.Line2D.LineTextureMode.Stretch
member.summary: Stretches the texture across the line. Import the texture with Repeat Disabled for best results.

member.name: F:Godot.Line2D.LineCapMode.None
member.summary: Don't have a line cap.

member.name: F:Godot.Line2D.LineCapMode.Box
member.summary: Draws the line cap as a box.

member.name: F:Godot.Line2D.LineCapMode.Round
member.summary: Draws the line cap as a circle.

member.name: F:Godot.Line2D.LineJointMode.Sharp
member.summary: The line's joints will be pointy. If [code]sharp_limit[/code] is greater than the rotation of a joint, it becomes a bevel joint instead.

member.name: F:Godot.Line2D.LineJointMode.Bevel
member.summary: The line's joints will be bevelled/chamfered.

member.name: F:Godot.Line2D.LineJointMode.Round
member.summary: The line's joints will be rounded.

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.Points
member.summary: The points that form the lines. The line is drawn between every point set in this array.

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.Width
member.summary: The line's width.

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.DefaultColor
member.summary: The line's color. Will not be used if a gradient is set.

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.Gradient
member.summary: The gradient is drawn through the whole line from start to finish. The default color will not be used if a gradient is set.

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.Texture
member.summary: The texture used for the line's texture. Uses [code]texture_mode[/code] for drawing style.

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.TextureMode
member.summary: The style to render the [code]texture[/code] on the line. Use [code]LINE_TEXTURE_*[/code] constants. Default value: [code]LINE_TEXTURE_NONE[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.JointMode
member.summary: The style for the points between the start and the end.

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.BeginCapMode
member.summary: Controls the style of the line's first point. Use [code]LINE_CAP_*[/code] constants. Default value: [code]LINE_CAP_NONE[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.EndCapMode
member.summary: Controls the style of the line's last point. Use [code]LINE_CAP_*[/code] constants. Default value: [code]LINE_CAP_NONE[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.SharpLimit
member.summary: The direction difference in radians between vector points. This value is only used if [code]joint mode[/code] is set to [code]LINE_JOINT_SHARP[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Line2D.RoundPrecision
member.summary: The smoothness of the rounded joints and caps. This is only used if a cap or joint is set as round.

member.name: M:Godot.Line2D.SetPointPosition(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Overwrites the position in point [code]i[/code] with the supplied [code]position[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Line2D.GetPointPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns point [code]i[/code]'s position.

member.summary: Returns the Line2D's amount of points.

member.name: M:Godot.Line2D.AddPoint(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Add a point at the [code]position[/code]. Appends the point at the end of the line.

member.name: M:Godot.Line2D.RemovePoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove the point at index [code]i[/code] from the line.

member.summary: Text alignment as defined in the ALIGN_* enum.

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.MaxLength
member.summary: Maximum amount of characters that can be entered inside the [code]LineEdit[/code]. If [code]0[/code], there is no limit.

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.Editable
member.summary: If [code]false[/code], existing text cannot be modified and new text cannot be added.

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.Secret
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], every character is replaced with the secret character (see [member secret_character]).

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.SecretCharacter
member.summary: The character to use to mask secret input (defaults to "*"). Only a single character can be used as the secret character.

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.ExpandToTextLength
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the [code]LineEdit[/code] width will increase to stay longer than the [member text]. It will [b]not[/b] compress if the [member text] is shortened.

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.FocusMode
member.summary: Defines how the [code]LineEdit[/code] can grab focus (Keyboard and mouse, only keyboard, or none). See [code]enum FocusMode[/code] in [Control] for details.

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.ContextMenuEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the context menu will appear when right clicked.

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.ClearButtonEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the [code]LineEdit[/code] will show a clear button if [code]text[/code] is not empty.

member.summary: Text shown when the [code]LineEdit[/code] is empty. It is [b]not[/b] the [code]LineEdit[/code]'s default value (see [member text]).

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.PlaceholderAlpha
member.summary: Opacity of the [member placeholder_text]. From [code]0[/code] to [code]1[/code].

member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the caret (visual cursor) blinks.

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.CaretBlinkSpeed
member.summary: Duration (in seconds) of a caret's blinking cycle.

member.name: P:Godot.LineEdit.CaretPosition
member.summary: The cursor's position inside the [code]LineEdit[/code]. When set, the text may scroll to accommodate it.

member.summary: Erases the [code]LineEdit[/code] text.

member.name: M:Godot.LineEdit.Select(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects characters inside [code]LineEdit[/code] between [code]from[/code] and [code]to[/code]. By default [code]from[/code] is at the beginning and [code]to[/code] at the end. [codeblock] text = "Welcome" select() # Welcome select(4) # ome select(2, 5) # lco [/codeblock]

member.name: T:Godot.LineShape2D
member.summary: Line shape for 2D collisions. It works like a 2D plane and will not allow any body to go to the negative side. Not recommended for rigid bodies, and usually not recommended for static bodies either because it forces checks against it on every frame.

member.name: P:Godot.LineShape2D.Normal

member.name: P:Godot.LineShape2D.D
member.summary: The line's distance from the origin.

member.name: T:Godot.MainLoop
member.summary: Main loop is the abstract main loop base class. All other main loop classes are derived from it. Upon application start, a [code]MainLoop[/code] has to be provided to OS, else the application will exit. This happens automatically (and a [SceneTree] is created), unless a main [Script] is supplied, which may or not create and return a [code]MainLoop[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.MainLoop._Finalize
member.summary: Called before the program exits.

member.name: M:Godot.MainLoop._Idle(System.Single)
member.summary: Called each idle frame with time since last call as an only argument.

member.name: M:Godot.MainLoop._Initialize
member.summary: Called once during initialization.

member.name: T:Godot.Material
member.summary: Material is a base [Resource] used for coloring and shading geometry. All materials inherit from it and almost all [VisualInstance] derived nodes carry a Material. A few flags and parameters are shared between all material types and are configured here.

member.name: T:Godot.MenuButton
member.summary: Special button that brings up a [PopupMenu] when clicked. That's pretty much all it does, as it's just a helper class when building GUIs.

member.name: P:Godot.MenuButton.SwitchOnHover
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], when the cursor hovers above another MenuButton within the same parent which also has [code]switch_on_hover[/code] enabled, it will close the current MenuButton and open the other one.

member.name: M:Godot.MenuButton.GetPopup
member.summary: Return the [PopupMenu] contained in this button.

member.name: T:Godot.Mesh
member.summary: Mesh is a type of [Resource] that contains vertex-array based geometry, divided in [i]surfaces[/i]. Each surface contains a completely separate array and a material used to draw it. Design wise, a mesh with multiple surfaces is preferred to a single surface, because objects created in 3D editing software commonly contain multiple materials.

member.name: F:Godot.Mesh.PrimitiveType.Points
member.summary: Render array as points (one vertex equals one point).

member.name: F:Godot.Mesh.PrimitiveType.Lines
member.summary: Render array as lines (every two vertices a line is created).

member.summary: Render array as line strip.

member.name: F:Godot.Mesh.PrimitiveType.LineLoop
member.summary: Render array as line loop (like line strip, but closed).

member.name: F:Godot.Mesh.PrimitiveType.Triangles
member.summary: Render array as triangles (every three vertices a triangle is created).

member.name: T:Godot.MeshDataTool
member.summary: The MeshDataTool provides access to individual vertices in a [Mesh]. It allows users to read and edit vertex data of meshes. It also creates an array of faces and edges. To use the MeshDataTool, load a mesh with [method create_from_surface]. When you are finished editing the data commit the data to a mesh with [method commit_to_surface]. Below is an example of how the MeshDataTool may be used. [codeblock] var mdt = MeshDataTool.new() mdt.create_from_surface(mesh, 0) for i in range(mdt.get_vertex_count()): var vertex = mdt.get_vertex(i) ... mdt.set_vertex(i, vertex) mesh.surface_remove(0) mdt.commit_to_surface(mesh) [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.MeshDataTool.Clear
member.summary: Clears all data currently in MeshDataTool.

member.name: M:Godot.MeshDataTool.CreateFromSurface(Godot.ArrayMesh,System.Int32)
member.summary: Uses specified surface of given [Mesh] to populate data for MeshDataTool. Requires [Mesh] with primitive type [code]PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.MeshDataTool.CommitToSurface(Godot.ArrayMesh)
member.summary: Adds a new surface to specified [Mesh] with edited data.

member.name: M:Godot.MeshDataTool.GetFormat
member.summary: Returns format of [Mesh]. Format is an integer made up of [Mesh] format flags combined together. For example, a mesh containing both vertices and normals would return a format of [code]3[/code] because [code]ARRAY_FORMAT_VERTEX[/code] is [code]1[/code] and [code]ARRAY_FORMAT_NORMAL[/code] is [code]2[/code]. For list of format flags see [ArrayMesh].

member.summary: Returns the total number of vertices in [Mesh].

member.name: M:Godot.MeshDataTool.GetEdgeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of edges in this [Mesh].

member.name: M:Godot.MeshDataTool.GetFaceCount

member.name: T:Godot.MeshInstance
member.summary: MeshInstance is a node that takes a [Mesh] resource and adds it to the current scenario by creating an instance of it. This is the class most often used to get 3D geometry rendered and can be used to instance a single [Mesh] in many places. This allows to reuse geometry and save on resources. When a [Mesh] has to be instanced more than thousands of times at close proximity, consider using a [MultiMesh] in a [MultiMeshInstance] instead.

member.summary: The [Mesh] resource for the instance.

member.summary: This helper creates a [StaticBody] child node with a [ConvexPolygonShape] collision shape calculated from the mesh geometry. It's mainly used for testing.

member.name: T:Godot.MobileVRInterface
member.summary: This is a generic mobile VR implementation where you need to provide details about the phone and HMD used. It does not rely on any existing framework. This is the most basic interface we have. For the best effect you do need a mobile phone with a gyroscope and accelerometer. Note that even though there is no positional tracking the camera will assume the headset is at a height of 1.85 meters.

member.name: P:Godot.MobileVRInterface.Iod
member.summary: The interocular distance, also known as the interpupillary distance. The distance between the pupils of the left and right eye.

member.name: P:Godot.MobileVRInterface.DisplayWidth
member.summary: The width of the display in centimeters.

member.name: P:Godot.MobileVRInterface.DisplayToLens
member.summary: The distance between the display and the lenses inside of the device in centimeters.

member.name: P:Godot.MobileVRInterface.Oversample
member.summary: The oversample setting. Because of the lens distortion we have to render our buffers at a higher resolution then the screen can natively handle. A value between 1.5 and 2.0 often provides good results but at the cost of performance.

member.name: P:Godot.MobileVRInterface.K1
member.summary: The k1 lens factor is one of the two constants that define the strength of the lens used and directly influences the lens distortion effect.

member.name: P:Godot.MobileVRInterface.K2
member.summary: The k2 lens factor, see k1.

member.name: T:Godot.MultiMesh
member.summary: MultiMesh provides low level mesh instancing. Drawing thousands of [MeshInstance] nodes can be slow because each object is submitted to the GPU to be drawn individually. MultiMesh is much faster because it can draw thousands of instances with a single draw call, resulting in less API overhead. As a drawback, if the instances are too far away of each other, performance may be reduced as every single instance will always rendered (they are spatially indexed as one, for the whole object). Since instances may have any behavior, the AABB used for visibility must be provided by the user.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiMesh.TransformFormatEnum.Transform2d
member.summary: Use this when using 2D transforms.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiMesh.TransformFormatEnum.Transform3d
member.summary: Use this when using 3D transforms.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiMesh.CustomDataFormatEnum.None
member.summary: Use when you are not using per-instance custom data.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiMesh.CustomDataFormatEnum.Data8bit
member.summary: Compress custom_data into 8 bits when passing to shader. This uses less memory and can be faster, but loses precision.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiMesh.CustomDataFormatEnum.Float
member.summary: The [Color] passed into [method set_instance_custom_data] will use 4 floats. Use this for highest precision.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiMesh.ColorFormatEnum.None
member.summary: Use when you are not using per-instance [Color]s.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiMesh.ColorFormatEnum.Color8bit
member.summary: Compress [Color] data into 8 bits when passing to shader. This uses less memory and can be faster, but the [Color] loses precision.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiMesh.ColorFormatEnum.Float
member.summary: The [Color] passed into [method set_instance_color] will use 4 floats. Use this for highest precision [Color].

member.name: T:Godot.MultiMeshInstance
member.summary: [code]MultiMeshInstance[/code] is a specialized node to instance [GeometryInstance]s based on a [MultiMesh] resource. This is useful to optimize the rendering of a high amount of instances of a given mesh (for example tree in a forest or grass strands).

member.name: P:Godot.MultiMeshInstance.Multimesh
member.summary: The [MultiMesh] resource that will be used and shared among all instances of the [code]MultiMeshInstance[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.MultiplayerAPI
member.summary: This class implements most of the logic behind the high level multiplayer API. By default, [SceneTree] has a reference to this class that is used to provide multiplayer capabilities (i.e. RPC/RSET) across the whole scene. It is possible to override the MultiplayerAPI instance used by specific Nodes by setting the [member Node.custom_multiplayer] property, effectively allowing to run both client and server in the same scene.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode.Disabled
member.summary: Used with [method Node.rpc_config] or [method Node.rset_config] to disable a method or property for all RPC calls, making it unavailable. Default for all methods.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode.Remote
member.summary: Used with [method Node.rpc_config] or [method Node.rset_config] to set a method to be called or a property to be changed only on the remote end, not locally. Analogous to the [code]remote[/code] keyword. Calls and property changes are accepted from all remote peers, no matter if they are node's master or puppets.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode.Master
member.summary: Used with [method Node.rpc_config] or [method Node.rset_config] to set a method to be called or a property to be changed only on the network master for this node. Analogous to the [code]master[/code] keyword. Only accepts calls or property changes from the node's network puppets, see [method Node.set_network_master].

member.name: F:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode.Puppet
member.summary: Used with [method Node.rpc_config] or [method Node.rset_config] to set a method to be called or a property to be changed only on puppets for this node. Analogous to the [code]puppet[/code] keyword. Only accepts calls or property changes from the node's network master, see [method Node.set_network_master].

member.name: F:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode.Slave
member.summary: Deprecated. Use [code]RPC_MODE_PUPPET[/code] instead. Analogous to the [code]slave[/code] keyword.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode.Remotesync
member.summary: Behave like [code]RPC_MODE_REMOTE[/code] but also make the call or property change locally. Analogous to the [code]remotesync[/code] keyword.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode.Sync
member.summary: Deprecated. Use [code]RPC_MODE_REMOTESYNC[/code] instead. Analogous to the [code]sync[/code] keyword.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode.Mastersync
member.summary: Behave like [code]RPC_MODE_MASTER[/code] but also make the call or property change locally. Analogous to the [code]mastersync[/code] keyword.

member.name: F:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RPCMode.Puppetsync
member.summary: Behave like [code]RPC_MODE_PUPPET[/code] but also make the call or property change locally. Analogous to the [code]puppetsync[/code] keyword.

member.name: P:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.RefuseNewNetworkConnections
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the MultiplayerAPI's [member network_peer] refuses new incoming connections.

member.name: P:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.NetworkPeer
member.summary: The peer object to handle the RPC system (effectively enabling networking when set). Depending on the peer itself, the MultiplayerAPI will become a network server (check with [method is_network_server]) and will set root node's network mode to master (see NETWORK_MODE_* constants in [Node]), or it will become a regular peer with root node set to puppet. All child nodes are set to inherit the network mode by default. Handling of networking-related events (connection, disconnection, new clients) is done by connecting to MultiplayerAPI's signals.

member.name: M:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.SetRootNode(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Sets the base root node to use for RPCs. Instead of an absolute path, a relative path will be used to find the node upon which the RPC should be executed. This effectively allows to have different branches of the scene tree to be managed by different MultiplayerAPI, allowing for example to run both client and server in the same scene.

member.name: M:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.SendBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.TransferModeEnum)
member.summary: Sends the given raw [code]bytes[/code] to a specific peer identified by [code]id[/code] (see [method NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.set_target_peer]). Default ID is [code]0[/code], i.e. broadcast to all peers.

member.name: M:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.HasNetworkPeer
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if there is a [member network_peer] set.

member.name: M:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.GetNetworkUniqueId
member.summary: Returns the unique peer ID of this MultiplayerAPI's [member network_peer].

member.name: M:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.IsNetworkServer
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if this MultiplayerAPI's [member network_peer] is in server mode (listening for connections).

member.name: M:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.GetRpcSenderId
member.summary: Returns the sender's peer ID for the RPC currently being executed. NOTE: If not inside an RPC this method will return 0.

member.name: M:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.Poll
member.summary: Method used for polling the MultiplayerAPI. You only need to worry about this if you are using [member Node.custom_multiplayer] override or you set [member SceneTree.multiplayer_poll] to [code]false[/code]. By default [SceneTree] will poll its MultiplayerAPI for you. NOTE: This method results in RPCs and RSETs being called, so they will be executed in the same context of this function (e.g. [code]_process[/code], [code]physics[/code], [Thread]).

member.name: M:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.Clear
member.summary: Clears the current MultiplayerAPI network state (you shouldn't call this unless you know what you are doing).

member.name: M:Godot.MultiplayerAPI.GetNetworkConnectedPeers
member.summary: Returns the peer IDs of all connected peers of this MultiplayerAPI's [member network_peer].

member.name: T:Godot.Mutex
member.summary: A synchronization Mutex. Element used to synchronize multiple [Thread]s. Basically a binary [Semaphore]. Guarantees that only one thread can ever acquire this lock at a time. Can be used to protect a critical section. Be careful to avoid deadlocks.

member.name: M:Godot.Mutex.Lock
member.summary: Lock this [code]Mutex[/code], blocks until it is unlocked by the current owner.

member.name: M:Godot.Mutex.TryLock
member.summary: Try locking this [code]Mutex[/code], does not block. Returns [code]OK[/code] on success, [code]ERR_BUSY[/code] otherwise.

member.name: M:Godot.Mutex.Unlock
member.summary: Unlock this [code]Mutex[/code], leaving it to other threads.

member.summary: Returns the documentation string that was previously set with [code]godot_nativescript_set_method_documentation[/code].

member.summary: Returns the documentation string that was previously set with [code]godot_nativescript_set_signal_documentation[/code].
