member.name: T:Godot.Navigation
member.summary: Provides navigation and pathfinding within a collection of [NavigationMesh]es. By default these will be automatically collected from child [NavigationMeshInstance] nodes, but they can also be added on the fly with [method navmesh_add]. In addition to basic pathfinding, this class also assists with aligning navigation agents with the meshes they are navigating on.

member.name: P:Godot.Navigation.UpVector
member.summary: Defines which direction is up. By default this is [code](0, 1, 0)[/code], which is the world up direction.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation.NavmeshAdd(Godot.NavigationMesh,Godot.Transform,Godot.Object)
member.summary: Adds a [NavigationMesh]. Returns an ID for use with [method navmesh_remove] or [method navmesh_set_transform]. If given, a [Transform2D] is applied to the polygon. The optional [code]owner[/code] is used as return value for [method get_closest_point_owner].

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation.NavmeshSetTransform(System.Int32,Godot.Transform)
member.summary: Sets the transform applied to the [NavigationMesh] with the given ID.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation.NavmeshRemove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the [NavigationMesh] with the given ID.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation.GetSimplePath(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the path between two given points. Points are in local coordinate space. If [code]optimize[/code] is [code]true[/code] (the default), the agent properties associated with each [NavigationMesh] (raidus, height, etc.) are considered in the path calculation, otherwise they are ignored.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation.GetClosestPointToSegment(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the navigation point closest to the given line segment. When enabling [code]use_collision[/code], only considers intersection points between segment and navigation meshes. If multiple intersection points are found, the one closest to the segment start point is returned.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation.GetClosestPoint(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the navigation point closest to the point given. Points are in local coordinate space.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation.GetClosestPointNormal(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the surface normal at the navigation point closest to the point given. Useful for rotating a navigation agent according to the navigation mesh it moves on.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation.GetClosestPointOwner(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the owner of the [NavigationMesh] which contains the navigation point closest to the point given. This is usually a [NavigationMeshInstance]. For meshes added via [method navmesh_add], returns the owner that was given (or [code]null[/code] if the [code]owner[/code] parameter was omitted).

member.name: T:Godot.Navigation2D
member.summary: Navigation2D provides navigation and pathfinding within a 2D area, specified as a collection of [NavigationPolygon] resources. By default these are automatically collected from child [NavigationPolygonInstance] nodes, but they can also be added on the fly with [method navpoly_add].

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation2D.NavpolyAdd(Godot.NavigationPolygon,Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Object)
member.summary: Adds a [NavigationPolygon]. Returns an ID for use with [method navpoly_remove] or [method navpoly_set_transform]. If given, a [Transform2D] is applied to the polygon. The optional [code]owner[/code] is used as return value for [method get_closest_point_owner].

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation2D.NavpolySetTransform(System.Int32,Godot.Transform2D)
member.summary: Sets the transform applied to the [NavigationPolygon] with the given ID.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation2D.NavpolyRemove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the [NavigationPolygon] with the given ID.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation2D.GetSimplePath(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the path between two given points. Points are in local coordinate space. If [code]optimize[/code] is [code]true[/code] (the default), the path is smoothed by merging path segments where possible.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation2D.GetClosestPoint(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the navigation point closest to the point given. Points are in local coordinate space.

member.name: M:Godot.Navigation2D.GetClosestPointOwner(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the owner of the [NavigationPolygon] which contains the navigation point closest to the point given. This is usually a [NavigationPolygonInstance]. For polygons added via [method navpoly_add], returns the owner that was given (or [code]null[/code] if the [code]owner[/code] parameter was omitted).

member.name: T:Godot.NavigationPolygon
member.summary: There are two ways to create polygons. Either by using the [method add_outline] method or using the [method add_polygon] method. Using [method add_outline]: [codeblock] var polygon = NavigationPolygon.new() var outline = PoolVector2Array([Vector2(0, 0), Vector2(0, 50), Vector2(50, 50), Vector2(50, 0)]) polygon.add_outline(outline) polygon.make_polygons_from_outlines() $NavigationPolygonInstance.navpoly = polygon [/codeblock] Using [method add_polygon] and indices of the vertices array. [codeblock] var polygon = NavigationPolygon.new() var vertices = PoolVector2Array([Vector2(0, 0), Vector2(0, 50), Vector2(50, 50), Vector2(50, 0)]) polygon.set_vertices(vertices) var indices = PoolIntArray(0, 3, 1) polygon.add_polygon(indices) $NavigationPolygonInstance.navpoly = polygon [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.SetVertices(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Sets the vertices that can be then indexed to create polygons with the [method add_polygon] method.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.GetVertices
member.summary: Returns a [PoolVector2Array] containing all the vertices being used to create the polygons.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.AddPolygon(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Adds a polygon using the indices of the vertices you get when calling [method get_vertices].

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.GetPolygonCount
member.summary: Returns the count of all polygons.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.GetPolygon(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a [PoolIntArray] containing the indices of the vertices of a created polygon.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.ClearPolygons
member.summary: Clears the array of polygons, but it doesn't clear the array of outlines and vertices.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.AddOutline(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Appends a [PoolVector2Array] that contains the vertices of an outline to the internal array that contains all the outlines. You have to call [method make_polygons_from_outlines] in order for this array to be converted to polygons that the engine will use.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.AddOutlineAtIndex(Godot.Vector2[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a [PoolVector2Array] that contains the vertices of an outline to the internal array that contains all the outlines at a fixed position. You have to call [method make_polygons_from_outlines] in order for this array to be converted to polygons that the engine will use.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.GetOutlineCount
member.summary: Returns the number of outlines that were created in the editor or by script.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.SetOutline(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Changes an outline created in the editor or by script. You have to call [method make_polygons_from_outlines] for the polygons to update.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.GetOutline(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a [PoolVector2Array] containing the vertices of an outline that was created in the editor or by script.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.RemoveOutline(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes an outline created in the editor or by script. You have to call [method make_polygons_from_outlines] for the polygons to update.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.ClearOutlines
member.summary: Clears the array of the outlines, but it doesn't clear the vertices and the polygons that were created by them.

member.name: M:Godot.NavigationPolygon.MakePolygonsFromOutlines
member.summary: Creates polygons from the outlines added in the editor or by script.

member.name: T:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet
member.summary: A PacketPeer implementation that should be passed to [member SceneTree.network_peer] after being initialized as either a client or server. Events can then be handled by connecting to [SceneTree] signals.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.CompressionModeEnum.None
member.summary: No compression.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.CompressionModeEnum.RangeCoder
member.summary: ENet's buildin range encoding.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.CompressionModeEnum.Fastlz
member.summary: FastLZ compression.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.CompressionModeEnum.Zlib
member.summary: zlib compression.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.CompressionModeEnum.Zstd
member.summary: ZStandard compression.

member.name: P:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.CompressionMode
member.summary: The compression method used for network packets. Default is no compression. These have different tradeoffs of compression speed versus bandwidth, you may need to test which one works best for your use case if you use compression at all.

member.name: P:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.TransferChannel
member.summary: Set the default channel to be used to transfer data. By default this value is [code]-1[/code] which means that ENet will only use 2 channels, one for reliable and one for unreliable packets. Channel [code]0[/code] is reserved, and cannot be used. Setting this member to any value between [code]0[/code] and [member channel_count] (excluded) will force ENet to use that channel for sending data.

member.name: P:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.ChannelCount
member.summary: The number of channels to be used by ENet. Default: [code]3[/code]. Channels are used to separate different kinds of data. In realiable or ordered mode, for example, the packet delivery order is ensured on a per channel basis.

member.name: P:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.AlwaysOrdered
member.summary: Always use [code]TRANSFER_MODE_ORDERED[/code] in place of [code]TRANSFER_MODE_UNRELIABLE[/code]. This is the only way to use ordering with the RPC system.

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.CreateServer(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create server that listens to connections via [code]port[/code]. The port needs to be an available, unused port between 0 and 65535. Note that ports below 1024 are privileged and may require elevated permissions depending on the platform. To change the interface the server listens on, use [method set_bind_ip]. The default IP is the wildcard [code]*[/code], which listens on all available interfaces. [code]max_clients[/code] is the maximum number of clients that are allowed at once, any number up to 4096 may be used, although the achievable number of simultaneous clients may be far lower and depends on the application. For additional details on the bandwidth parameters, see [method create_client]. Returns [code]OK[/code] if a server was created, [code]ERR_ALREADY_IN_USE[/code] if this NetworkedMultiplayerEnet instance already has an open connection (in which case you need to call [method close_connection] first) or [code]ERR_CANT_CREATE[/code] if the server could not be created.

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.CreateClient(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create client that connects to a server at [code]address[/code] using specified [code]port[/code]. The given address needs to be either a fully qualified domain name (e.g. [code]www.example.com[/code]) or an IP address in IPv4 or IPv6 format (e.g. [code]192.168.1.1[/code]). The [code]port[/code] is the port the server is listening on. The [code]in_bandwidth[/code] and [code]out_bandwidth[/code] parameters can be used to limit the incoming and outgoing bandwidth to the given number of bytes per second. The default of 0 means unlimited bandwidth. Note that ENet will strategically drop packets on specific sides of a connection between peers to ensure the peer's bandwidth is not overwhelmed. The bandwidth parameters also determine the window size of a connection which limits the amount of reliable packets that may be in transit at any given time. Returns [code]OK[/code] if a client was created, [code]ERR_ALREADY_IN_USE[/code] if this NetworkedMultiplayerEnet instance already has an open connection (in which case you need to call [method close_connection] first) or [code]ERR_CANT_CREATE[/code] if the client could not be created. If [code]client_port[/code] is specified, the client will also listen to the given port, this is useful in some NAT traversal technique.

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.CloseConnection(System.Int32)
member.summary: Closes the connection. Ignored if no connection is currently established. If this is a server it tries to notify all clients before forcibly disconnecting them. If this is a client it simply closes the connection to the server.

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.DisconnectPeer(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disconnect the given peer. If "now" is set to true, the connection will be closed immediately without flushing queued messages.

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.SetBindIp(System.String)
member.summary: The IP used when creating a server. This is set to the wildcard [code]*[/code] by default, which binds to all available interfaces. The given IP needs to be in IPv4 or IPv6 address format, for example: [code]192.168.1.1[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.GetPeerAddress(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the IP address of the given peer.

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.GetPeerPort(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the remote port of the given peer.

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.GetPacketChannel
member.summary: Returns the channel of the next packet that will be retrieved via [method PacketPeer.get_packet]

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerENet.GetLastPacketChannel
member.summary: Returns the channel of the last packet fetched via [method PacketPeer.get_packet]

member.name: T:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer
member.summary: Manages the connection to network peers. Assigns unique IDs to each client connected to the server.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.TargetPeerBroadcast
member.summary: Packets are sent to the server and then redistributed to other peers.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.TargetPeerServer
member.summary: Packets are sent to the server alone.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.ConnectionStatus.Disconnected
member.summary: The ongoing connection disconnected.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.ConnectionStatus.Connecting
member.summary: A connection attempt is ongoing.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.ConnectionStatus.Connected
member.summary: The connection attempt succeeded.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.TransferModeEnum.Unreliable
member.summary: Packets are not acknowledged, no resend attempts are made for lost packets. Packets may arrive in any order. Potentially faster than [code]TRANSFER_MODE_UNRELIABLE_ORDERED[/code]. Use for non-critical data, and always consider whether the order matters.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.TransferModeEnum.UnreliableOrdered
member.summary: Packets are not acknowledged, no resend attempts are made for lost packets. Packets are received in the order they were sent in. Potentially faster than [code]TRANSFER_MODE_RELIABLE[/code]. Use for non-critical data or data that would be outdated if received late due to resend attempt(s) anyway, for example movement and positional data.

member.name: F:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.TransferModeEnum.Reliable
member.summary: Packets must be received and resend attempts should be made until the packets are acknowledged. Packets must be received in the order they were sent in. Most reliable transfer mode, but potentially slowest due to the overhead. Use for critical data that must be transmitted and arrive in order, for example an ability being triggered or a chat message. Consider carefully if the information really is critical, and use sparingly.

member.name: P:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.RefuseNewConnections
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], this [code]NetworkedMultiplayerPeer[/code] refuses new connections. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.TransferMode
member.summary: The manner in which to send packets to the [code]target_peer[/code]. See [enum TransferMode].

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.SetTargetPeer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the peer to which packets will be sent. The [code]id[/code] can be one of: [code]TARGET_PEER_BROADCAST[/code] to send to all connected peers, [code]TARGET_PEER_SERVER[/code] to send to the peer acting as server, a valid peer ID to send to that specific peer, a negative peer ID to send to all peers except that one. Default: [code]TARGET_PEER_BROADCAST[/code]

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.GetPacketPeer
member.summary: Returns the ID of the [code]NetworkedMultiplayerPeer[/code] who sent the most recent packet.

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.Poll
member.summary: Waits up to 1 second to receive a new network event.

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.GetConnectionStatus
member.summary: Returns the current state of the connection. See [enum ConnectionStatus].

member.name: M:Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer.GetUniqueId
member.summary: Returns the ID of this [code]NetworkedMultiplayerPeer[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.NinePatchRect
member.summary: Better known as 9-slice panels, NinePatchRect produces clean panels of any size, based on a small texture. To do so, it splits the texture in a 3 by 3 grid. When you scale the node, it tiles the texture's sides horizontally or vertically, the center on both axes but it doesn't scale or tile the corners.

member.name: F:Godot.NinePatchRect.AxisStretchMode.Stretch
member.summary: Doesn't do anything at the time of writing. Default value for [code]axis_stretch_horizontal[/code] and [code]axis_stretch_vertical[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.NinePatchRect.AxisStretchMode.Tile
member.summary: Doesn't do anything at the time of writing.

member.name: F:Godot.NinePatchRect.AxisStretchMode.TileFit
member.summary: Doesn't do anything at the time of writing.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.Texture
member.summary: The node's texture resource.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.DrawCenter
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], draw the panel's center. Else, only draw the 9-slice's borders. Default value: [code]true[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.RegionRect
member.summary: Rectangular region of the texture to sample from. If you're working with an atlas, use this property to define the area the 9-slice should use. All other properties are relative to this one.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.PatchMarginLeft
member.summary: The height of the 9-slice's left column.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.PatchMarginTop
member.summary: The height of the 9-slice's top row.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.PatchMarginRight
member.summary: The height of the 9-slice's right column.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.PatchMarginBottom
member.summary: The height of the 9-slice's bottom row. A margin of 16 means the 9-slice's bottom corners and side will have a height of 16 pixels. You can set all 4 margin values individually to create panels with non-uniform borders.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.AxisStretchHorizontal
member.summary: Doesn't do anything at the time of writing.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.AxisStretchVertical
member.summary: Doesn't do anything at the time of writing.

member.name: T:Godot.Node2D
member.summary: A 2D game object, with a position, rotation and scale. All 2D physics nodes and sprites inherit from Node2D. Use Node2D as a parent node to move, scale and rotate children in a 2D project. Also gives control on the node's render order.

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.Position
member.summary: Position, relative to the node's parent.

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.Rotation
member.summary: Rotation in radians, relative to the node's parent.

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.RotationDegrees
member.summary: Rotation in degrees, relative to the node's parent.

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.Scale
member.summary: The node's scale. Unscaled value: [code](1, 1)[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.Transform
member.summary: Local [Transform2D].

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.GlobalPosition
member.summary: Global position.

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.GlobalRotation
member.summary: Global rotation in radians.

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.GlobalRotationDegrees
member.summary: Global rotation in degrees.

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.GlobalScale
member.summary: Global scale.

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.GlobalTransform
member.summary: Global [Transform2D].

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.ZIndex
member.summary: Z-index. Controls the order in which the nodes render. A node with a higher Z-index will display in front of others.

member.name: P:Godot.Node2D.ZAsRelative
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the node's Z-index is relative to its parent's Z-index. If this node's Z-index is 2 and its parent's effective Z-index is 3, then this node's effective Z-index will be 2 + 3 = 5.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.Rotate(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies a rotation to the node, in radians, starting from its current rotation.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.MoveLocalX(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies a local translation on the node's X axis based on the [method Node._process]'s [code]delta[/code]. If [code]scaled[/code] is false, normalizes the movement.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.MoveLocalY(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies a local translation on the node's Y axis based on the [method Node._process]'s [code]delta[/code]. If [code]scaled[/code] is false, normalizes the movement.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.Translate(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Translates the node by the given [code]offset[/code] in local coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.GlobalTranslate(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Adds the 'offset' vector to the node's global position.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.ApplyScale(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Multiplies the current scale by the 'ratio' vector.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.LookAt(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Rotates the node so it points towards the 'point'.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.GetAngleTo(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the angle between the node and the 'point' in radians.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.ToLocal(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Converts a global point's coordinates to local coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.ToGlobal(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Converts a local point's coordinates to global coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.Node2D.GetRelativeTransformToParent(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Returns the [Transform2D] relative to this node's parent.

member.name: T:Godot.NoiseTexture
member.summary: Uses an [OpenSimplexNoise] to fill the texture data. You can specify the texture size but keep in mind that larger textures will take longer to generate and seamless noise only works with square sized textures. NoiseTexture can also generate normalmap textures.

member.name: P:Godot.NoiseTexture.Width
member.summary: Width of the generated texture.

member.name: P:Godot.NoiseTexture.Height
member.summary: Height of the generated texture.

member.name: P:Godot.NoiseTexture.Seamless
member.summary: Whether the texture can be tiled without visible seams or not. Seamless textures take longer to generate.

member.name: P:Godot.NoiseTexture.AsNormalmap
member.summary: If true, the resulting texture contains a normal map created from the original noise interpreted as a bump map.

member.name: P:Godot.NoiseTexture.Noise
member.summary: The [OpenSimplexNoise] instance used to generate the noise.

member.name: T:Godot.OccluderPolygon2D
member.summary: Editor facility that helps you draw a 2D polygon used as resource for [LightOccluder2D].

member.name: F:Godot.OccluderPolygon2D.CullModeEnum.Disabled
member.summary: Culling mode for the occlusion. Disabled means no culling. See [member cull_mode].

member.name: F:Godot.OccluderPolygon2D.CullModeEnum.Clockwise
member.summary: Culling mode for the occlusion. Sets the culling to be in clockwise direction. See [member cull_mode].

member.name: F:Godot.OccluderPolygon2D.CullModeEnum.CounterClockwise
member.summary: Culling mode for the occlusion. Sets the culling to be in counter clockwise direction. See [member cull_mode].

member.name: P:Godot.OccluderPolygon2D.Closed
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], closes the polygon. A closed OccluderPolygon2D occludes the light coming from any direction. An opened OccluderPolygon2D occludes the light only at its outline's direction. Default value [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.OccluderPolygon2D.CullMode
member.summary: Set the direction of the occlusion culling when not [code]CULL_DISABLED[/code]. Default value [code]DISABLED[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.OccluderPolygon2D.Polygon
member.summary: A [Vector2] array with the index for polygon's vertices positions. Note that the returned value is a copy of the underlying array, rather than a reference.

member.name: T:Godot.OmniLight
member.summary: An Omnidirectional light is a type of [Light] that emits light in all directions. The light is attenuated by distance and this attenuation can be configured by changing its energy, radius, and attenuation parameters.

member.name: P:Godot.OmniLight.OmniRange
member.summary: Maximum distance the light affects.

member.name: P:Godot.OmniLight.OmniAttenuation
member.summary: The light's attenuation (drop-off) curve. A number of presets are available in the Inspector.

member.name: P:Godot.OmniLight.OmniShadowMode
member.summary: See [enum ShadowMode].

member.name: P:Godot.OmniLight.OmniShadowDetail
member.summary: See [enum ShadowDetail].

member.name: T:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise
member.summary: This resource allows you to configure and sample a fractal noise space. Here is a brief usage example that configures an OpenSimplexNoise and gets samples at various positions and dimensions: [codeblock] var noise = OpenSimplexNoise.new() # Configure noise.seed = randi() noise.octaves = 4 noise.period = 20.0 noise.persistence = 0.8 # Sample print("Values:") print(noise.get_noise_2d(1.0, 1.0)) print(noise.get_noise_3d(0.5, 3.0, 15.0)) print(noise.get_noise_4d(0.5, 1.9, 4.7, 0.0)) [/codeblock]

member.name: P:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.Seed
member.summary: Seed used to generate random values, different seeds will generate different noise maps.

member.name: P:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.Octaves
member.summary: Number of OpenSimplex noise layers that are sampled to get the fractal noise.

member.name: P:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.Period
member.summary: Period of the base octave. A lower period results in a higher-frequency noise (more value changes across the same distance).

member.name: P:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.Persistence
member.summary: Contribution factor of the different octaves. A [code]persistence[/code] value of 1 means all the octaves have the same contribution, a value of 0.5 means each octave contributes half as much as the previous one.

member.name: P:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.Lacunarity
member.summary: Difference in period between [member octaves].

member.name: M:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.GetImage(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generate a noise image with the requested [code]width[/code] and [code]height[/code], based on the current noise parameters.

member.name: M:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.GetSeamlessImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generate a tileable noise image, based on the current noise parameters. Generated seamless images are always square ([code]size[/code] x [code]size[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.GetNoise2d(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the 2D noise value [code][-1,1][/code] at the given position.

member.name: M:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.GetNoise3d(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the 3D noise value [code][-1,1][/code] at the given position.

member.name: M:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.GetNoise4d(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the 4D noise value [code][-1,1][/code] at the given position.

member.name: M:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.GetNoise2dv(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the 2D noise value [code][-1,1][/code] at the given position.

member.name: M:Godot.OpenSimplexNoise.GetNoise3dv(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the 3D noise value [code][-1,1][/code] at the given position.

member.summary: Return the ID of the item at index [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.OS.Execute(System.String,System.String[],System.Boolean,Godot.Collections.Array)
member.summary: Execute the file at the given path with the arguments passed as an array of strings. Platform path resolution will take place. The resolved file must exist and be executable. The arguments are used in the given order and separated by a space, so [code]OS.execute('ping', ['-w', '3', 'godotengine.org'], false)[/code] will resolve to [code]ping -w 3 godotengine.org[/code] in the system's shell. This method has slightly different behaviour based on whether the [code]blocking[/code] mode is enabled. When [code]blocking[/code] is enabled, the Godot thread will pause its execution while waiting for the process to terminate. The shell output of the process will be written to the [code]output[/code] array as a single string. When the process terminates, the Godot thread will resume execution. When [code]blocking[/code] is disabled, the Godot thread will continue while the new process runs. It is not possible to retrieve the shell output in non-blocking mode, so [code]output[/code] will be empty. The return value also depends on the blocking mode. When blocking, the method will return -2 (no process ID information is available in blocking mode). When non-blocking, the method returns a process ID, which you can use to monitor the process (and potentially terminate it with [method kill]). If the process forking (non-blocking) or opening (blocking) fails, the method will return -1. Example of blocking mode and retrieving the shell output: [codeblock] var output = [] OS.execute('ls', ['-l', '/tmp'], true, output) [/codeblock] Example of non-blocking mode, running another instance of the project and storing its process ID: [codeblock] var pid = OS.execute(OS.get_executable_path(), [], false) [/codeblock] If you wish to access a shell built-in or perform a composite command, a platform-specific shell can be invoked. For example: [codeblock] OS.execute('CMD.exe', ['/C', 'cd %TEMP% && dir'], true, output) [/codeblock] <param name="output">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.OS.Kill(System.Int32)
member.summary: Kill (terminate) the process identified by the given process ID ([code]pid[/code]), e.g. the one returned by [method execute] in non-blocking mode. Note that this method can also be used to kill processes that were not spawned by the game.

member.name: M:Godot.OS.ShellOpen(System.String)
member.summary: Requests the OS to open a resource with the most appropriate program. For example. [code]OS.shell_open("C:\\Users\name\Downloads")[/code] on Windows opens the file explorer at the downloads folders of the user. [code]OS.shell_open("https://godotengine.org")[/code] opens the default web browser on the official Godot website.

member.name: M:Godot.OS.GetUserDataDir
member.summary: Returns the absolute directory path where user data is written ([code]user://[/code]). On Linux, this is [code]~/.local/share/godot/app_userdata/[project_name][/code], or [code]~/.local/share/[custom_name][/code] if [code]use_custom_user_dir[/code] is set. On macOS, this is [code]~/Library/Application Support/Godot/app_userdata/[project_name][/code], or [code]~/Library/Application Support/[custom_name][/code] if [code]use_custom_user_dir[/code] is set. On Windows, this is [code]%APPDATA%/Godot/app_userdata/[project_name][/code], or [code]%APPDATA%/[custom_name][/code] if [code]use_custom_user_dir[/code] is set. If the project name is empty, [code]user://[/code] falls back to [code]res://[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.PacketPeer
member.summary: PacketPeer is an abstraction and base class for packet-based protocols (such as UDP). It provides an API for sending and receiving packets both as raw data or variables. This makes it easy to transfer data over a protocol, without having to encode data as low level bytes or having to worry about network ordering.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.GetVar
member.summary: Get a Variant.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.PutVar(System.Object)
member.summary: Send a Variant as a packet.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.GetPacket
member.summary: Get a raw packet.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.PutPacket(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send a raw packet.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.GetPacketError
member.summary: Return the error state of the last packet received (via [method get_packet] and [method get_var]).

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.GetAvailablePacketCount
member.summary: Return the number of packets currently available in the ring-buffer.

member.name: T:Godot.PacketPeerStream
member.summary: PacketStreamPeer provides a wrapper for working using packets over a stream. This allows for using packet based code with StreamPeers. PacketPeerStream implements a custom protocol over the StreamPeer, so the user should not read or write to the wrapped StreamPeer directly.

member.name: P:Godot.PacketPeerStream.StreamPeer
member.summary: The wrapped [StreamPeer] object.

member.name: T:Godot.PacketPeerUDP
member.summary: UDP packet peer. Can be used to send raw UDP packets as well as [Variant]s.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.Listen(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Make this [code]PacketPeerUDP[/code] listen on the "port" binding to "bind_address" with a buffer size "recv_buf_size". If "bind_address" is set as "*" (default), the peer will listen on all available addresses (both IPv4 and IPv6). If "bind_address" is set as "0.0.0.0" (for IPv4) or "::" (for IPv6), the peer will listen on all available addresses matching that IP type. If "bind_address" is set to any valid address (e.g. "192.168.1.101", "::1", etc), the peer will only listen on the interface with that addresses (or fail if no interface with the given address exists).

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.Close
member.summary: Close the UDP socket the [code]PacketPeerUDP[/code] is currently listening on.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.Wait
member.summary: Wait for a packet to arrive on the listening port, see [method listen].

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.IsListening
member.summary: Return whether this [code]PacketPeerUDP[/code] is listening.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.GetPacketIp
member.summary: Return the IP of the remote peer that sent the last packet(that was received with [method PacketPeer.get_packet] or [method PacketPeer.get_var]).

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.GetPacketPort
member.summary: Return the port of the remote peer that sent the last packet(that was received with [method PacketPeer.get_packet] or [method PacketPeer.get_var]).

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.SetDestAddress(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the destination address and port for sending packets and variables, a hostname will be resolved using if valid.

member.name: T:Godot.Panel
member.summary: Panel is a [Control] that displays an opaque background. It's commonly used as a parent and container for other types of [Control] nodes.

member.name: T:Godot.PanelContainer
member.summary: Panel container type. This container fits controls inside of the delimited area of a stylebox. It's useful for giving controls an outline.

member.name: T:Godot.PanoramaSky
member.summary: A resource referenced in an [Environment] that is used to draw a background. The Panorama sky functions similar to skyboxes in other engines except it uses a equirectangular sky map instead of a cube map.

member.name: P:Godot.PanoramaSky.Panorama
member.summary: [Texture] to be applied to the PanoramaSky.

member.name: T:Godot.ParallaxBackground
member.summary: A ParallaxBackground uses one or more [ParallaxLayer] child nodes to create a parallax effect. Each [ParallaxLayer] can move at a different speed using [member ParallaxLayer.motion_offset]. This creates an illusion of depth in a 2D game. If not used with a [Camera2D], you must manually calculate the [member scroll_offset].

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollOffset
member.summary: The ParallaxBackground's scroll value. Calculated automatically when using a [Camera2D], but can be used to manually manage scrolling when no camera is present.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollBaseOffset
member.summary: Base position offset of all [ParallaxLayer] children.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollBaseScale
member.summary: Base motion scale of all [ParallaxLayer] children.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollLimitBegin
member.summary: Top left limits for scrolling to begin. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will stop scrolling. Must be lower than [member scroll_limit_end] to work.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollLimitEnd
member.summary: Right bottom limits for scrolling to end. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will stop scrolling. Must be higher than [member scroll_limit_begin] to work.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollIgnoreCameraZoom
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], elements in [ParallaxLayer] child aren't affected by the zoom level of the camera.

member.name: T:Godot.ParallaxLayer
member.summary: A ParallaxLayer must be the child of a [ParallaxBackground] node. Each ParallaxLayer can be set to move at different speeds relative to the camera movement or the [member ParallaxBackground.scroll_offset] value. This node's children will be affected by its scroll offset. Note that any changes to this node's position and scale made after it enters the scene will be ignored.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxLayer.MotionScale
member.summary: Multiplies the ParallaxLayer's motion. If an axis is set to [code]0[/code] it will not scroll.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxLayer.MotionOffset
member.summary: The ParallaxLayer's offset relative to the parent ParallaxBackground's [member ParallaxBackground.scroll_offset].

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxLayer.MotionMirroring
member.summary: The ParallaxLayer's [Texture] mirroring. Useful for creating an infinite scrolling background. If an axis is set to [code]0[/code] the [Texture] will not be mirrored. Default value: [code](0, 0)[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.Particles
member.summary: 3D particle node used to create a variety of particle systems and effects. [code]Particles[/code] features an emitter that generates some number of particles at a given rate. Use the [code]process_material[/code] property to add a [ParticlesMaterial] to configure particle appearance and behavior. Alternatively, you can add a [ShaderMaterial] which will be applied to all particles.

member.name: F:Godot.Particles.MaxDrawPasses
member.summary: Maximum number of draw passes supported.

member.name: F:Godot.Particles.DrawOrderEnum.Index
member.summary: Particles are drawn in the order emitted.

member.name: F:Godot.Particles.DrawOrderEnum.Lifetime
member.summary: Particles are drawn in order of remaining lifetime.

member.name: F:Godot.Particles.DrawOrderEnum.ViewDepth
member.summary: Particles are drawn in order of depth.

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Emitting
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], particles are being emitted. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Amount
member.summary: Number of particles to emit.

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Lifetime
member.summary: Amount of time each particle will exist. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.OneShot
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], only [code]amount[/code] particles will be emitted. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Preprocess
member.summary: Amount of time to preprocess the particles before animation starts. Lets you start the animation some time after particles have started emitting.

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.SpeedScale
member.summary: Speed scaling ratio. Default value: [code]1[/code]. A value of [code]0[/code] can be used to pause the particles.

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Explosiveness
member.summary: Time ratio between each emission. If [code]0[/code] particles are emitted continuously. If [code]1[/code] all particles are emitted simultaneously. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Randomness
member.summary: Emission randomness ratio. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.VisibilityAabb
member.summary: The [AABB] that determines the area of the world part of which needs to be visible on screen for the particle system to be active.

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.LocalCoords
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], particles use the parent node's coordinate space. If [code]false[/code], they use global coordinates. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.DrawOrder
member.summary: Particle draw order. Uses [code]DRAW_ORDER_*[/code] values. Default value: [code]DRAW_ORDER_INDEX[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.ProcessMaterial

member.name: T:Godot.Particles2D
member.summary: 2D particle node used to create a variety of particle systems and effects. [code]Particles2D[/code] features an emitter that generates some number of particles at a given rate. Use the [code]process_material[/code] property to add a [ParticlesMaterial] to configure particle appearance and behavior. Alternatively, you can add a [ShaderMaterial] which will be applied to all particles.

member.name: F:Godot.Particles2D.DrawOrderEnum.Index
member.summary: Particles are drawn in the order emitted.

member.summary: Particles are drawn in order of remaining lifetime.

member.summary: If [code]true[/code], particles are being emitted. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.Amount
member.summary: Number of particles emitted in one emission cycle.

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.Lifetime
member.summary: Amount of time each particle will exist. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.OneShot
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], only one emission cycle occurs. If set [code]true[/code] during a cycle, emission will stop at the cycle's end. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.Preprocess

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.SpeedScale
member.summary: Particle system's running speed scaling ratio. Default value: [code]1[/code]. A value of [code]0[/code] can be used to pause the particles.

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.Explosiveness
member.summary: How rapidly particles in an emission cycle are emitted. If greater than [code]0[/code], there will be a gap in emissions before the next cycle begins. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.Randomness
member.summary: Emission lifetime randomness ratio. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.FixedFps
member.summary: The particle system's frame rate is fixed to a value. For instance, changing the value to 2 will make the particles render at 2 frames per second. Note this does not slow down the particle system itself.

member.name: T:Godot.ParticlesMaterial
member.summary: ParticlesMaterial defines particle properties and behavior. It is used in the [code]process_material[/code] of [Particles] and [Particles2D] emitter nodes. Some of this material's properties are applied to each particle when emitted, while others can have a [CurveTexture] applied to vary values over the lifetime of the particle. When a randomness ratio is applied to a property it is used to scale that property by a random amount. The random ratio is used to interpolate between [code]1.0[/code] and a random number less than one, the result is multiplied by the property to obtain the randomized property. For example a random ratio of [code]0.4[/code] would scale the original property between [code]0.4-1.0[/code] of its original value.

member.name: F:Godot.ParticlesMaterial.Flags.AlignYToVelocity
member.summary: Use with [method set_flag] to set [member flag_align_y].

member.name: F:Godot.ParticlesMaterial.Flags.RotateY
member.summary: Use with [method set_flag] to set [member flag_rotate_y]

member.summary: Particles will be emitted at positions determined by sampling this texture at a random position. Used with [code]EMISSION_SHAPE_POINTS[/code] and [code]EMISSION_SHAPE_DIRECTED_POINTS[/code]. Can be created automatically from mesh or node by selecting "Create Emission Points from Mesh/Node" under the "Particles" tool in the toolbar.

member.summary: Particle velocity and rotation will be set by sampling this texture at the same point as the [member emission_point_texture]. Used only in [code]EMISSION_SHAPE_DIRECTED[/code]. Can be created automatically from mesh or node by selecting "Create Emission Points from Mesh/Node" under the "Particles" tool in the toolbar.

member.summary: Particle color will be modulated by color determined by sampling this texture at the same point as the [member emission_point_texture].

member.summary: Align y-axis of particle with the direction of its velocity.

member.summary: If [code]true[/code], particles rotate around y-axis by [member angle].

member.summary: If [code]true[/code], particles will not move on the z axis. Default value: [code]true[/code] for [Particles2D], [code]false[/code] for [Particles].

member.summary: Each particle's initial direction range from [code]+spread[/code] to [code]-spread[/code] degrees. Default value: [code]45[/code]. Applied to X/Z plane and Y/Z planes.

member.name: T:Godot.Path
member.summary: This class is a container/Node-ification of a [Curve3D], so it can have [Spatial] properties and [Node] info.

member.name: T:Godot.Path2D
member.summary: Can have [PathFollow2D] child-nodes moving along the [Curve2D]. See [PathFollow2D] for more information on this usage.

member.name: P:Godot.Path2D.Curve
member.summary: A [Curve2D] describing the path.

member.name: T:Godot.PathFollow
member.summary: This node takes its parent [Path], and returns the coordinates of a point within it, given a distance from the first vertex. It is useful for making other nodes follow a path, without coding the movement pattern. For that, the nodes must be descendants of this node. Then, when setting an offset in this node, the descendant nodes will move accordingly.

member.name: F:Godot.PathFollow.RotationModeEnum.None
member.summary: Forbids the PathFollow to rotate.

member.name: F:Godot.PathFollow.RotationModeEnum.Y
member.summary: Allows the PathFollow to rotate in the Y axis only.

member.name: F:Godot.PathFollow.RotationModeEnum.Xy
member.summary: Allows the PathFollow to rotate in both the X, and Y axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PathFollow.RotationModeEnum.Xyz
member.summary: Allows the PathFollow to rotate in any axis.

member.name: F:Godot.PathFollow.RotationModeEnum.Oriented
member.summary: Uses the up vector information in a [Curve3D] to enforce orientation. This rotation mode requires the [Path]'s [member Curve3D.up_vector_enabled] property to be set to [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow.Offset
member.summary: The distance from the first vertex, measured in 3D units along the path. This sets this node's position to a point within the path.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow.UnitOffset
member.summary: The distance from the first vertex, considering 0.0 as the first vertex and 1.0 as the last. This is just another way of expressing the offset within the path, as the offset supplied is multiplied internally by the path's length.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow.HOffset
member.summary: The node's offset along the curve.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow.VOffset
member.summary: The node's offset perpendicular to the curve.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow.RotationMode
member.summary: Allows or forbids rotation on one or more axes, depending on the constants being used.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow.CubicInterp
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the position between two cached points is interpolated cubically, and linearly otherwise. The points along the [Curve3D] of the [Path] are precomputed before use, for faster calculations. The point at the requested offset is then calculated interpolating between two adjacent cached points. This may present a problem if the curve makes sharp turns, as the cached points may not follow the curve closely enough. There are two answers to this problem: Either increase the number of cached points and increase memory consumption, or make a cubic interpolation between two points at the cost of (slightly) slower calculations.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow.Loop
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], any offset outside the path's length will wrap around, instead of stopping at the ends. Use it for cyclic paths.

member.name: T:Godot.PathFollow2D
member.summary: This node takes its parent [Path2D], and returns the coordinates of a point within it, given a distance from the first vertex. It is useful for making other nodes follow a path, without coding the movement pattern. For that, the nodes must be descendants of this node. Then, when setting an offset in this node, the descendant nodes will move accordingly.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow2D.Offset
member.summary: The distance along the path in pixels.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow2D.UnitOffset
member.summary: The distance along the path as a number in the range 0.0 (for the first vertex) to 1.0 (for the last). This is just another way of expressing the offset within the path, as the offset supplied is multiplied internally by the path's length.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow2D.HOffset
member.summary: The node's offset along the curve.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow2D.VOffset
member.summary: The node's offset perpendicular to the curve.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow2D.Rotate
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], this node rotates to follow the path, making its descendants rotate.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow2D.CubicInterp
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the position between two cached points is interpolated cubically, and linearly otherwise. The points along the [Curve2D] of the [Path2D] are precomputed before use, for faster calculations. The point at the requested offset is then calculated interpolating between two adjacent cached points. This may present a problem if the curve makes sharp turns, as the cached points may not follow the curve closely enough. There are two answers to this problem: Either increase the number of cached points and increase memory consumption, or make a cubic interpolation between two points at the cost of (slightly) slower calculations.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow2D.Loop
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], any offset outside the path's length will wrap around, instead of stopping at the ends. Use it for cyclic paths.

member.name: P:Godot.PathFollow2D.Lookahead
member.summary: How far to look ahead of the curve to calculate the tangent if the node is rotating. E.g. shorter lookaheads will lead to faster rotations. Default value: [code]4[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.Performance
member.summary: This class provides access to a number of different monitors related to performance, such as memory usage, draw calls, and FPS. These are the same as the values displayed in the [i]Monitor[/i] tab in the editor's [i]Debugger[/i] panel. By using the [method get_monitor] method of this class, you can access this data from your code. Note that a few of these monitors are only available in debug mode and will always return 0 when used in a release build. Many of these monitors are not updated in real-time, so there may be a short delay between changes.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.Monitor.TimeFps
member.summary: Frames per second.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.Monitor.TimeProcess
member.summary: Time it took to complete one frame.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.Monitor.TimePhysicsProcess
member.summary: Time it took to complete one physics frame.

member.summary: Static memory currently used, in bytes. Not available in release builds.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.Monitor.MemoryDynamic
member.summary: Dynamic memory currently used, in bytes. Not available in release builds.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.Monitor.MemoryStaticMax
member.summary: Available static memory. Not available in release builds.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.Monitor.MemoryDynamicMax
member.summary: Available dynamic memory. Not available in release builds.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.Monitor.MemoryMessageBufferMax
member.summary: Largest amount of memory the message queue buffer has used, in bytes. The message queue is used for deferred functions calls and notifications.

member.summary: Returns the value of one of the available monitors. You should provide one of this class's constants as the argument, like this: [codeblock] print(Performance.get_monitor(Performance.TIME_FPS)) # Prints the FPS to the console [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.IntegrateForces
member.summary: Call the built-in force integration code.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.GetSpaceState
member.summary: Return the current state of space, useful for queries.

member.name: T:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState
member.summary: Direct access object to a space in the [Physics2DServer]. It's used mainly to do queries against objects and areas residing in a given space.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.IntersectPoint(Godot.Vector2,System.Int32,Godot.Collections.Array,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks whether a point is inside any shape. The shapes the point is inside of are returned in an array containing dictionaries with the following fields: [code]collider[/code]: The colliding object. [code]collider_id[/code]: The colliding object's ID. [code]metadata[/code]: The intersecting shape's metadata. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. [code]rid[/code]: The intersecting object's [RID]. [code]shape[/code]: The shape index of the colliding shape. Additionally, the method can take an [code]exclude[/code] array of objects or [RID]s that are to be excluded from collisions, a [code]collision_mask[/code] bitmask representing the physics layers to check in, or booleans to determine if the ray should collide with [PhysicsBody]s or [Area]s, respectively. <param name="exclude">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.IntersectPointOnCanvas(Godot.Vector2,System.Int32,System.Int32,Godot.Collections.Array,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: <param name="exclude">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.IntersectRay(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Collections.Array,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Intersects a ray in a given space. The returned object is a dictionary with the following fields: [code]collider[/code]: The colliding object. [code]collider_id[/code]: The colliding object's ID. [code]metadata[/code]: The intersecting shape's metadata. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. [code]normal[/code]: The object's surface normal at the intersection point. [code]position[/code]: The intersection point. [code]rid[/code]: The intersecting object's [RID]. [code]shape[/code]: The shape index of the colliding shape. If the ray did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary is returned instead. Additionally, the method can take an [code]exclude[/code] array of objects or [RID]s that are to be excluded from collisions, a [code]collision_mask[/code] bitmask representing the physics layers to check in, or booleans to determine if the ray should collide with [PhysicsBody]s or [Area]s, respectively. <param name="exclude">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.IntersectShape(Godot.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. Note that this method does not take into account the [code]motion[/code] property of the object. The intersected shapes are returned in an array containing dictionaries with the following fields: [code]collider[/code]: The colliding object. [code]collider_id[/code]: The colliding object's ID. [code]metadata[/code]: The intersecting shape's metadata. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. [code]rid[/code]: The intersecting object's [RID]. [code]shape[/code]: The shape index of the colliding shape. The number of intersections can be limited with the [code]max_results[/code] parameter, to reduce the processing time.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.CastMotion(Godot.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters)
member.summary: Checks how far the shape can travel toward a point. Note that both the shape and the motion are supplied through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object. The method will return an array with two floats between 0 and 1, both representing a fraction of [code]motion[/code]. The first is how far the shape can move without triggering a collision, and the second is the point at which a collision will occur. If no collision is detected, the returned array will be [code][1, 1][/code]. If the shape can not move, the array will be empty.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.CollideShape(Godot.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. The resulting array contains a list of points where the shape intersects another. Like with [method intersect_shape], the number of returned results can be limited to save processing time.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.GetRestInfo(Godot.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters)
member.summary: Checks the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. If it collides with more than one shape, the nearest one is selected. Note that this method does not take into account the [code]motion[/code] property of the object. The returned object is a dictionary containing the following fields: [code]collider_id[/code]: The colliding object's ID. [code]linear_velocity[/code]: The colliding object's velocity [Vector2]. If the object is an [Area2D], the result is [code](0, 0)[/code]. [code]metadata[/code]: The intersecting shape's metadata. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. [code]normal[/code]: The object's surface normal at the intersection point. [code]point[/code]: The intersection point. [code]rid[/code]: The intersecting object's [RID]. [code]shape[/code]: The shape index of the colliding shape. If the shape did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary is returned instead.

member.name: T:Godot.Physics2DServer
member.summary: Physics 2D Server is the server responsible for all 2D physics. It can create many kinds of physics objects, but does not insert them on the node tree.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ProcessInfo.ActiveObjects
member.summary: Constant to get the number of objects that are not sleeping.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ProcessInfo.CollisionPairs
member.summary: Constant to get the number of possible collisions.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ProcessInfo.IslandCount
member.summary: Constant to get the number of space regions where a collision could occur.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaBodyStatus.Added
member.summary: The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object enters one of its shapes.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaBodyStatus.Removed
member.summary: The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object exits one of its shapes.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.DampedStringParam.RestLength
member.summary: Set the resting length of the spring joint. The joint will always try to go to back this length when pulled apart.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.DampedStringParam.Stiffness
member.summary: Set the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.DampedStringParam.Damping
member.summary: Set the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyMode.Static
member.summary: Constant for static bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyMode.Kinematic
member.summary: Constant for kinematic bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyMode.Rigid
member.summary: Constant for rigid bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyMode.Character
member.summary: Constant for rigid bodies in character mode. In this mode, a body can not rotate, and only its linear velocity is affected by physics.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeType.Line
member.summary: This is the constant for creating line shapes. A line shape is an infinite line with an origin point, and a normal. Thus, it can be used for front/behind checks.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeType.Segment
member.summary: This is the constant for creating segment shapes. A segment shape is a line from a point A to a point B. It can be checked for intersections.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeType.Circle
member.summary: This is the constant for creating circle shapes. A circle shape only has a radius. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeType.Rectangle
member.summary: This is the constant for creating rectangle shapes. A rectangle shape is defined by a width and a height. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeType.Capsule
member.summary: This is the constant for creating capsule shapes. A capsule shape is defined by a radius and a length. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeType.ConvexPolygon
member.summary: This is the constant for creating convex polygon shapes. A polygon is defined by a list of points. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks. Unlike the [member CollisionPolygon2D.polygon] property, polygons modified with [method shape_set_data] do not verify that the points supplied form is a convex polygon.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeType.ConcavePolygon
member.summary: This is the constant for creating concave polygon shapes. A polygon is defined by a list of points. It can be used for intersections checks, but not for inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeType.Custom
member.summary: This constant is used internally by the engine. Any attempt to create this kind of shape results in an error.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceParameter.ContactRecycleRadius
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a pair of bodies has to move before their collision status has to be recalculated.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceParameter.ContactMaxSeparation
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can be from another before they are considered separated.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceParameter.BodyMaxAllowedPenetration
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can penetrate another shape before it is considered a collision.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceParameter.BodyLinearVelocitySleepThreshold
member.summary: Constant to set/get the threshold linear velocity of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after the time given.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceParameter.BodyAngularVelocitySleepThreshold
member.summary: Constant to set/get the threshold angular velocity of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after the time given.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceParameter.BodyTimeToSleep
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum time of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after this time.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceParameter.ConstraintDefaultBias
member.summary: Constant to set/get the default solver bias for all physics constraints. A solver bias is a factor controlling how much two objects "rebound", after violating a constraint, to avoid leaving them in that state because of numerical imprecision.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.JointType.Pin
member.summary: Constant to create pin joints.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.JointType.Groove
member.summary: Constant to create groove joints.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.JointType.DampedSpring
member.summary: Constant to create damped spring joints.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.CCDMode.Disabled
member.summary: Disables continuous collision detection. This is the fastest way to detect body collisions, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.CCDMode.CastRay
member.summary: Enables continuous collision detection by raycasting. It is faster than shapecasting, but less precise.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.CCDMode.CastShape
member.summary: Enables continuous collision detection by shapecasting. It is the slowest CCD method, and the most precise.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyState.Transform
member.summary: Constant to set/get the current transform matrix of the body.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyState.LinearVelocity
member.summary: Constant to set/get the current linear velocity of the body.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyState.AngularVelocity
member.summary: Constant to set/get the current angular velocity of the body.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyState.Sleeping
member.summary: Constant to sleep/wake up a body, or to get whether it is sleeping.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyState.CanSleep
member.summary: Constant to set/get whether the body can sleep.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyParameter.Bounce
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's bounce factor.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyParameter.Friction
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's friction.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyParameter.Mass
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's mass.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyParameter.Inertia
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's inertia.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyParameter.GravityScale
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's gravity multiplier.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyParameter.LinearDamp
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's linear dampening factor.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyParameter.AngularDamp
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's angular dampening factor.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyParameter.Max
member.summary: This is the last ID for body parameters. Any attempt to set this property is ignored. Any attempt to get it returns 0.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSpaceOverrideMode.Disabled
member.summary: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSpaceOverrideMode.Combine
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSpaceOverrideMode.CombineReplace
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSpaceOverrideMode.Replace
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSpaceOverrideMode.ReplaceCombine
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaParameter.Gravity
member.summary: Constant to set/get gravity strength in an area.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaParameter.GravityVector
member.summary: Constant to set/get gravity vector/center in an area.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaParameter.GravityIsPoint
member.summary: Constant to set/get whether the gravity vector of an area is a direction, or a center point.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaParameter.GravityDistanceScale
member.summary: Constant to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity of an area. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaParameter.GravityPointAttenuation
member.summary: This constant was used to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity. It has been superseded by AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaParameter.LinearDamp
member.summary: Constant to set/get the linear dampening factor of an area.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaParameter.AngularDamp
member.summary: Constant to set/get the angular dampening factor of an area.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaParameter.Priority
member.summary: Constant to set/get the priority (order of processing) of an area.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSetMonitorCallback(Godot.RID,Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the function to call when any body/area enters or exits the area. This callback will be called for any object interacting with the area, and takes five parameters: 1: AREA_BODY_ADDED or AREA_BODY_REMOVED, depending on whether the object entered or exited the area. 2: [RID] of the object that entered/exited the area. 3: Instance ID of the object that entered/exited the area. 4: The shape index of the object that entered/exited the area. 5: The shape index of the area where the object entered/exited.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyApplyImpulse(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Adds a positioned impulse to the applied force and torque. Both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyAddForce(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Adds a positioned force to the applied force and torque. As with [method body_apply_impulse], both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates. A force differs from an impulse in that, while the two are forces, the impulse clears itself after being applied.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodySetAxisVelocity(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyRemoveCollisionException(Godot.RID,Godot.RID)

member.name: T:Godot.PhysicsBody
member.summary: PhysicsBody is an abstract base class for implementing a physics body. All *Body types inherit from it.

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsBody.CollisionLayer
member.summary: The physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers work like a tagging system, and are not visual. A collidable can use these layers to select with which objects it can collide, using the collision_mask property. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsBody.CollisionMask
member.summary: The physics layers this area scans for collisions.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody.GetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask.

member.summary: Sets individual bits on the layer mask. Use this if you only need to change one layer's value.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody.GetCollisionLayerBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask.

A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

member.summary: The timestep (delta) used for the simulation.

member.summary: The inverse of the mass of the body.

member.summary: The rate at which the body stops rotating, if there are not any other forces moving it.

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.TotalLinearDamp
member.summary: The rate at which the body stops moving, if there are not any other forces moving it.

member.summary: The inverse of the inertia of the body.

member.summary: The total gravity vector being currently applied to this body.
