member.summary: The angular velocity of the body.

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.LinearVelocity
member.summary: The linear velocity of the body.

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.Sleeping
member.summary: [code]true[/code] if this body is currently sleeping (not active).

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.Transform
member.summary: The transformation matrix of the body.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.AddCentralForce(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Adds a constant directional force without affecting rotation. This is equivalent to [code]add_force(force, Vector3(0,0,0))[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.AddForce(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Adds a constant force (i.e. acceleration).

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.AddTorque(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Adds a constant rotational force (i.e. a motor) without affecting position.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.ApplyCentralImpulse(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Applies a single directional impulse without affecting rotation. This is equivalent to [code]apply_impulse(Vector3(0, 0, 0), impulse)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.ApplyImpulse(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Applies a positioned impulse to the body. An impulse is time independent! Applying an impulse every frame would result in a framerate dependent force. For this reason it should only be used when simulating one-time impacts. The position uses the rotation of the global coordinate system, but is centered at the object's origin.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.ApplyTorqueImpulse(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Apply a torque impulse (which will be affected by the body mass and shape). This will rotate the body around the passed in vector.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState.GetContactImpulse(System.Int32)
member.summary: Impulse created by the contact. Only implemented for Bullet physics.

member.name: T:Godot.PhysicsDirectSpaceState
member.summary: Direct access object to a space in the [PhysicsServer]. It's used mainly to do queries against objects and areas residing in a given space.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectSpaceState.IntersectRay(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Collections.Array,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Intersects a ray in a given space. The returned object is a dictionary with the following fields: [code]collider[/code]: The colliding object. [code]collider_id[/code]: The colliding object's ID. [code]normal[/code]: The object's surface normal at the intersection point. [code]position[/code]: The intersection point. [code]rid[/code]: The intersecting object's [RID]. [code]shape[/code]: The shape index of the colliding shape. If the ray did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary is returned instead. Additionally, the method can take an [code]exclude[/code] array of objects or [RID]s that are to be excluded from collisions, a [code]collision_mask[/code] bitmask representing the physics layers to check in, or booleans to determine if the ray should collide with [PhysicsBody]s or [Area]s, respectively. <param name="exclude">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectSpaceState.IntersectShape(Godot.PhysicsShapeQueryParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the intersections of a shape, given through a [PhysicsShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. The intersected shapes are returned in an array containing dictionaries with the following fields: [code]collider[/code]: The colliding object. [code]collider_id[/code]: The colliding object's ID. [code]rid[/code]: The intersecting object's [RID]. [code]shape[/code]: The shape index of the colliding shape. The number of intersections can be limited with the [code]max_results[/code] parameter, to reduce the processing time.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectSpaceState.CastMotion(Godot.PhysicsShapeQueryParameters,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Checks whether the shape can travel to a point. The method will return an array with two floats between 0 and 1, both representing a fraction of [code]motion[/code]. The first is how far the shape can move without triggering a collision, and the second is the point at which a collision will occur. If no collision is detected, the returned array will be [code][1, 1][/code]. If the shape can not move, the returned array will be [code][0, 0][/code] under Bullet, and empty under GodotPhysics.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectSpaceState.CollideShape(Godot.PhysicsShapeQueryParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the intersections of a shape, given through a [PhysicsShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. The resulting array contains a list of points where the shape intersects another. Like with [method intersect_shape], the number of returned results can be limited to save processing time.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsDirectSpaceState.GetRestInfo(Godot.PhysicsShapeQueryParameters)
member.summary: Checks the intersections of a shape, given through a [PhysicsShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. If it collides with more than one shape, the nearest one is selected. The returned object is a dictionary containing the following fields: [code]collider_id[/code]: The colliding object's ID. [code]linear_velocity[/code]: The colliding object's velocity [Vector3]. If the object is an [Area], the result is [code](0, 0, 0)[/code]. [code]normal[/code]: The object's surface normal at the intersection point. [code]point[/code]: The intersection point. [code]rid[/code]: The intersecting object's [RID]. [code]shape[/code]: The shape index of the colliding shape. If the shape did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary is returned instead.

member.name: T:Godot.PhysicsMaterial

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsMaterial.Friction
member.summary: The body's friction. Values range from [code]0[/code] (frictionless) to [code]1[/code] (maximum friction). Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsMaterial.Bounce
member.summary: The body's bounciness. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.summary: The strength with which the pinned objects try to stay in positional relation to each other. The higher, the stronger.

member.summary: The strength with which the pinned objects try to stay in velocity relation to each other. The higher, the stronger.

member.summary: If above 0, this value is the maximum value for an impulse that this Joint puts on its ends.

member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a pair of bodies has to move before their collision status has to be recalculated.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceParameter.ContactMaxSeparation
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can be from another before they are considered separated.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceParameter.BodyMaxAllowedPenetration
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can penetrate another shape before it is considered a collision.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceParameter.BodyLinearVelocitySleepThreshold
member.summary: Constant to set/get the threshold linear velocity of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after the time given.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceParameter.BodyAngularVelocitySleepThreshold
member.summary: Constant to set/get the threshold angular velocity of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after the time given.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceParameter.BodyTimeToSleep
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum time of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after this time.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceParameter.ConstraintDefaultBias
member.summary: Constant to set/get the default solver bias for all physics constraints. A solver bias is a factor controlling how much two objects "rebound", after violating a constraint, to avoid leaving them in that state because of numerical imprecision.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.ConeTwistJointParam.SwingSpan
member.summary: Swing is rotation from side to side, around the axis perpendicular to the twist axis. The swing span defines, how much rotation will not get corrected allong the swing axis. Could be defined as looseness in the [ConeTwistJoint]. If below 0.05, this behaviour is locked. Default value: [code]PI/4[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.ConeTwistJointParam.TwistSpan
member.summary: Twist is the rotation around the twist axis, this value defined how far the joint can twist. Twist is locked if below 0.05.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.ConeTwistJointParam.Bias
member.summary: The speed with which the swing or twist will take place. The higher, the faster.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.ConeTwistJointParam.Softness
member.summary: The ease with which the Joint twists, if it's too low, it takes more force to twist the joint.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.ConeTwistJointParam.Relaxation
member.summary: Defines, how fast the swing- and twist-speed-difference on both sides gets synced.

member.summary: The maximum force that the linear motor can apply while trying to reach the target velocity.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOFJointAxisParam.AngularLowerLimit
member.summary: The minimum rotation in negative direction to break loose and rotate around the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOFJointAxisParam.AngularUpperLimit
member.summary: The minimum rotation in positive direction to break loose and rotate around the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOFJointAxisParam.AngularLimitSoftness
member.summary: A factor that gets multiplied onto all rotations across the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOFJointAxisParam.AngularDamping
member.summary: The amount of rotational damping across the axes. The lower, the more dampening occurs.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOFJointAxisParam.AngularRestitution
member.summary: The amount of rotational restitution across the axes. The lower, the more restitution occurs.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOFJointAxisParam.AngularForceLimit
member.summary: The maximum amount of force that can occur, when rotating around the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOFJointAxisParam.AngularErp
member.summary: When correcting the crossing of limits in rotation across the axes, this error tolerance factor defines how much the correction gets slowed down. The lower, the slower.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOFJointAxisParam.AngularMotorTargetVelocity
member.summary: Target speed for the motor at the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOFJointAxisParam.AngularMotorForceLimit
member.summary: Maximum acceleration for the motor at the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearLimitUpper
member.summary: The maximum difference between the pivot points on their x-axis before damping happens.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearLimitLower
member.summary: The minimum difference between the pivot points on their x-axis before damping happens.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearLimitSoftness
member.summary: A factor applied to the movement across the slider axis once the limits get surpassed. The lower, the slower the movement.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearLimitRestitution
member.summary: The amount of restitution once the limits are surpassed. The lower, the more velocityenergy gets lost.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearLimitDamping
member.summary: The amount of damping once the slider limits are surpassed.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearMotionSoftness
member.summary: A factor applied to the movement across the slider axis as long as the slider is in the limits. The lower, the slower the movement.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearMotionRestitution
member.summary: The amount of restitution inside the slider limits.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearMotionDamping
member.summary: The amount of damping inside the slider limits.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearOrthogonalSoftness
member.summary: A factor applied to the movement across axes orthogonal to the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearOrthogonalRestitution
member.summary: The amount of restitution when movement is across axes orthogonal to the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.LinearOrthogonalDamping
member.summary: The amount of damping when movement is across axes orthogonal to the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.AngularLimitUpper
member.summary: The upper limit of rotation in the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.AngularLimitLower
member.summary: The lower limit of rotation in the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.AngularLimitSoftness
member.summary: A factor applied to the all rotation once the limit is surpassed.

member.summary: The amount of restitution of the rotation when the limit is surpassed.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.AngularLimitDamping
member.summary: The amount of damping of the rotation when the limit is surpassed.

member.summary: A factor that gets applied to the all rotation in the limits.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SliderJointParam.AngularMotionRestitution
member.summary: The amount of restitution of the rotation in the limits.

member.summary: The amount of damping of the rotation in the limits.

member.summary: A factor that gets applied to the all rotation across axes orthogonal to the slider.

member.summary: End flag of SLIDER_JOINT_* constants, used internally.

member.summary: The maximum rotation across the Hinge.

member.summary: The minimum rotation across the Hinge.

member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is rotational motion possible.

member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is a rotational motor across these axes.

member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is a linear motor on this axis that targets a specific velocity.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSpaceOverrideMode.Disabled
member.summary: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSpaceOverrideMode.Combine
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSpaceOverrideMode.CombineReplace
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSpaceOverrideMode.Replace
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSpaceOverrideMode.ReplaceCombine
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaParameter.Gravity
member.summary: Constant to set/get gravity strength in an area.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaParameter.GravityVector
member.summary: Constant to set/get gravity vector/center in an area.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaParameter.GravityIsPoint
member.summary: Constant to set/get whether the gravity vector of an area is a direction, or a center point.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaParameter.GravityDistanceScale
member.summary: Constant to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity of an area. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaParameter.GravityPointAttenuation
member.summary: This constant was used to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity. It has been superseded by AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaParameter.LinearDamp
member.summary: Constant to set/get the linear dampening factor of an area.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaParameter.AngularDamp
member.summary: Constant to set/get the angular dampening factor of an area.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaParameter.Priority
member.summary: Constant to set/get the priority (order of processing) of an area.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.ShapeCreate(Godot.PhysicsServer.ShapeType)

member.summary: Marks a space as active. It will not have an effect, unless it is assigned to an area or body.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceIsActive(Godot.RID)

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetMonitorCallback(Godot.RID,Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the function to call when any body/area enters or exits the area. This callback will be called for any object interacting with the area, and takes five parameters: 1: AREA_BODY_ADDED or AREA_BODY_REMOVED, depending on whether the object entered or exited the area. 2: [RID] of the object that entered/exited the area. 3: Instance ID of the object that entered/exited the area. 4: The shape index of the object that entered/exited the area. 5: The shape index of the area where the object entered/exited.

member.name: T:Godot.Polygon2D
member.summary: A Polygon2D is defined by a set of points. Each point is connected to the next, with the final point being connected to the first, resulting in a closed polygon. Polygon2Ds can be filled with color (solid or gradient) or filled with a given texture.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Color
member.summary: The polygon's fill color. If [code]texture[/code] is defined, it will be multiplied by this color. It will also be the default color for vertices not set in [code]vertex_colors[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Offset
member.summary: The offset applied to each vertex.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Antialiased
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], polygon edges will be anti-aliased. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Texture
member.summary: The polygon's fill texture. Use [code]uv[/code] to set texture coordinates.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.TextureOffset
member.summary: Amount to offset the polygon's [code]texture[/code]. If [code](0, 0)[/code] the texture's origin (its top-left corner) will be placed at the polygon's [code]position[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.TextureScale
member.summary: Amount to multiply the [code]uv[/code] coordinates when using a [code]texture[/code]. Larger values make the texture smaller, and vice versa.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.TextureRotationDegrees
member.summary: The texture's rotation in degrees.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.TextureRotation
member.summary: The texture's rotation in radians.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.InvertEnable
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], polygon will be inverted, containing the area outside the defined points and extending to the [code]invert_border[/code]. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.InvertBorder
member.summary: Added padding applied to the bounding box when using [code]invert[/code]. Setting this value too small may result in a "Bad Polygon" error. Default value: [code]100[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Polygon
member.summary: The polygon's list of vertices. The final point will be connected to the first. Note that this returns a copy of the [PoolVector2Array] rather than a reference.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Uv
member.summary: Texture coordinates for each vertex of the polygon. There should be one [code]uv[/code] per polygon vertex. If there are fewer, undefined vertices will use [code](0, 0)[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.VertexColors
member.summary: Color for each vertex. Colors are interpolated between vertices, resulting in smooth gradients. There should be one per polygon vertex. If there are fewer, undefined vertices will use [code]color[/code].

member.summary: Add a new item with text "label". An id can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator keybinding. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index.

Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

member.name: T:Godot.ProceduralSky
member.summary: ProceduralSky provides a way to create an effective background quickly by defining procedural parameters for the sun, the sky and the ground. The sky and ground are very similar, they are defined by a color at the horizon, another color, and finally an easing curve to interpolate between these two colors. Similarly the sun is described by a position in the sky, a color, and an easing curve. However, the sun also defines a minimum and maximum angle, these two values define at what distance the easing curve begins and ends from the sun, and thus end up defining the size of the sun in the sky. The ProceduralSky is updated on the CPU after the parameters change and stored in a texture and then displayed as a background in the scene. This makes it relatively unsuitable for realtime updates during gameplay. But with a small texture size it is still feasible to update relatively frequently because it is updated on a background thread when multi-threading is available.

member.name: P:Godot.ProceduralSky.SkyTopColor
member.summary: Color of the sky at the top.

member.summary: Amount of energy contribution from the sky.

member.summary: Contains global variables accessible from everywhere. Use "ProjectSettings.get_setting(variable)", "ProjectSettings.set_setting(variable,value)" or "ProjectSettings.has_setting(variable)" to access them. Variables stored in project.godot are also loaded into ProjectSettings, making this object very useful for reading custom game configuration options.

member.name: M:Godot.ProjectSettings.AddPropertyInfo(Godot.Collections.Dictionary)
member.summary: Add a custom property info to a property. The dictionary must contain: name:[String](the name of the property) and type:[int](see TYPE_* in [@GlobalScope]), and optionally hint:[int](see PROPERTY_HINT_* in [@GlobalScope]), hint_string:[String]. Example: [codeblock] ProjectSettings.set("category/property_name", 0) var property_info = { "name": "category/property_name", "type": TYPE_INT, "hint": PROPERTY_HINT_ENUM, "hint_string": "one,two,three" } ProjectSettings.add_property_info(property_info) [/codeblock]

member.name: T:Godot.Range
member.summary: Range is a base class for [Control] nodes that change a floating point [i]value[/i] between a [i]minimum[/i] and a [i]maximum[/i], using [i]step[/i] and [i]page[/i], for example a [ScrollBar].

member.name: P:Godot.Range.MinValue
member.summary: Minimum value. Range is clamped if [code]value[/code] is less than [code]min_value[/code]. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Range.MaxValue
member.summary: Maximum value. Range is clamped if [code]value[/code] is greater than [code]max_value[/code]. Default value: [code]100[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Range.Step
member.summary: If greater than 0, [code]value[/code] will always be rounded to a multiple of [code]step[/code]. If [code]rounded[/code] is also [code]true[/code], [code]value[/code] will first be rounded to a multiple of [code]step[/code] then rounded to the nearest integer.

member.name: P:Godot.Range.Page
member.summary: Page size. Used mainly for [ScrollBar]. ScrollBar's length is its size multiplied by [code]page[/code] over the difference between [code]min_value[/code] and [code]max_value[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Range.Value
member.summary: Range's current value.

member.name: P:Godot.Range.Ratio
member.summary: The value mapped between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:Godot.Range.ExpEdit
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], and [code]min_value[/code] is greater than 0, [code]value[/code] will be represented exponentially rather than linearly.

member.name: P:Godot.Range.Rounded
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], [code]value[/code] will always be rounded to the nearest integer. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Range.AllowGreater
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], [member value] may be greater than [member max_value]. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Range.Unshare

member.name: T:Godot.RayCast
member.summary: A RayCast represents a line from its origin to its destination position, [code]cast_to[/code]. It is used to query the 3D space in order to find the closest object along the path of the ray. RayCast can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], by setting proper filtering with collision layers, or by filtering object types with type masks. RayCast can be configured to report collisions with [Area]s ([member collide_with_areas]) and/or [PhysicsBody]s ([member collide_with_bodies]). Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions. RayCast calculates intersection every physics frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between physics frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.

member.name: P:Godot.RayCast.Enabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], collisions will be reported. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RayCast.ExcludeParent
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], collisions will be ignored for this RayCast's immediate parent. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RayCast.CastTo
member.summary: The ray's destination point, relative to the RayCast's [code]position[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RayCast.CollisionMask
member.summary: The ray's collision mask. Only objects in at least one collision layer enabled in the mask will be detected.

member.name: P:Godot.RayCast.CollideWithAreas
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], collision with [Area]s will be reported. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RayCast.CollideWithBodies
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], collision with [PhysicsBody]s will be reported. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.IsColliding
member.summary: Return whether any object is intersecting with the ray's vector (considering the vector length).

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.ForceRaycastUpdate
member.summary: Updates the collision information for the ray. Use this method to update the collision information immediately instead of waiting for the next [code]_physics_process[/code] call, for example if the ray or its parent has changed state. Note: [code]enabled == true[/code] is not required for this to work.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.GetCollider
member.summary: Return the first object that the ray intersects, or [code]null[/code] if no object is intersecting the ray (i.e. [method is_colliding] returns [code]false[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.GetColliderShape
member.summary: Returns the shape ID of the first object that the ray intersects, or [code]0[/code] if no object is intersecting the ray (i.e. [method is_colliding] returns [code]false[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.GetCollisionPoint
member.summary: Returns the collision point at which the ray intersects the closest object. Note: this point is in the [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.GetCollisionNormal
member.summary: Returns the normal of the intersecting object's shape at the collision point.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.AddExceptionRid(Godot.RID)

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.AddException(Godot.Object)

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.RemoveExceptionRid(Godot.RID)

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.RemoveException(Godot.Object)

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.ClearExceptions

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.SetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.GetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the bit index passed is turned on. Note that bit indexes range from 0-19.

member.name: T:Godot.RayCast2D
member.summary: A RayCast represents a line from its origin to its destination position, [code]cast_to[/code]. It is used to query the 2D space in order to find the closest object along the path of the ray. RayCast2D can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], by setting proper filtering with collision layers, or by filtering object types with type masks. RayCast2D can be configured to report collisions with [Area2D]s ([member collide_with_areas]) and/or [PhysicsBody2D]s ([member collide_with_bodies]). Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions. RayCast2D calculates intersection every physics frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between physics frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.

member.name: T:Godot.Reference

member.name: M:Godot.Reference.Reference_

member.name: M:Godot.Reference.Unreference

member.name: T:Godot.ReferenceRect

member.name: T:Godot.RegEx
member.summary: Regular Expression (or regex) is a compact programming language that can be used to recognise strings that follow a specific pattern, such as URLs, email addresses, complete sentences, etc. For instance, a regex of [code]ab[0-9][/code] would find any string that is [code]ab[/code] followed by any number from [code]0[/code] to [code]9[/code]. For a more in-depth look, you can easily find various tutorials and detailed explanations on the Internet. To begin, the RegEx object needs to be compiled with the search pattern using [method compile] before it can be used. [codeblock] var regex = RegEx.new() regex.compile("\\w-(\\d+)") [/codeblock] The search pattern must be escaped first for gdscript before it is escaped for the expression. For example, [code]compile("\\d+")[/code] would be read by RegEx as [code]\d+[/code]. Similarly, [code]compile("\"(?:\\\\.|[^\"])*\"")[/code] would be read as [code]"(?:\\.|[^"])*"[/code] Using [method search] you can find the pattern within the given text. If a pattern is found, [RegExMatch] is returned and you can retrieve details of the results using functions such as [method RegExMatch.get_string] and [method RegExMatch.get_start]. [codeblock] var regex = RegEx.new() regex.compile("\\w-(\\d+)") var result = regex.search("abc n-0123") if result: print(result.get_string()) # Would print n-0123 [/codeblock] The results of capturing groups [code]()[/code] can be retrieved by passing the group number to the various functions in [RegExMatch]. Group 0 is the default and would always refer to the entire pattern. In the above example, calling [code]result.get_string(1)[/code] would give you [code]0123[/code]. This version of RegEx also supports named capturing groups, and the names can be used to retrieve the results. If two or more groups have the same name, the name would only refer to the first one with a match. [codeblock] var regex = RegEx.new() regex.compile("d(?<digit>[0-9]+)|x(?<digit>[0-9a-f]+)") var result = regex.search("the number is x2f") if result: print(result.get_string("digit")) # Would print 2f [/codeblock] If you need to process multiple results, [method search_all] generates a list of all non-overlapping results. This can be combined with a for-loop for convenience. [codeblock] for result in regex.search_all("d01, d03, d0c, x3f and x42"): print(result.get_string("digit")) # Would print 01 03 3f 42 # Note that d0c would not match [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.Clear
member.summary: This method resets the state of the object, as it was freshly created. Namely, it unassigns the regular expression of this object.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.Compile(System.String)
member.summary: Compiles and assign the search pattern to use. Returns OK if the compilation is successful. If an error is encountered the details are printed to STDOUT and FAILED is returned.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.Search(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the text for the compiled pattern. Returns a [RegExMatch] container of the first matching result if found, otherwise null. The region to search within can be specified without modifying where the start and end anchor would be.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.SearchAll(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the text for the compiled pattern. Returns an array of [RegExMatch] containers for each non-overlapping result. If no results were found an empty array is returned instead. The region to search within can be specified without modifying where the start and end anchor would be.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.Sub(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the text for the compiled pattern and replaces it with the specified string. Escapes and backreferences such as [code]\1[/code] and [code]\g<name>[/code] expanded and resolved. By default only the first instance is replaced but it can be changed for all instances (global replacement). The region to search within can be specified without modifying where the start and end anchor would be.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.IsValid
member.summary: Returns whether this object has a valid search pattern assigned.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.GetPattern
member.summary: Returns the original search pattern that was compiled.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.GetGroupCount
member.summary: Returns the number of capturing groups in compiled pattern.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.GetNames
member.summary: Returns an array of names of named capturing groups in the compiled pattern. They are ordered by appearance.

member.name: T:Godot.RegExMatch
member.summary: Contains the results of a single regex match returned by [method RegEx.search] and [method RegEx.search_all]. It can be used to find the position and range of the match and its capturing groups, and it can extract its sub-string for you.

member.name: P:Godot.RegExMatch.Subject
member.summary: The source string used with the search pattern to find this matching result.

member.name: P:Godot.RegExMatch.Names
member.summary: A dictionary of named groups and its corresponding group number. Only groups with that were matched are included. If multiple groups have the same name, that name would refer to the first matching one.

member.name: P:Godot.RegExMatch.Strings
member.summary: An [Array] of the match and its capturing groups.

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetGroupCount
member.summary: Returns the number of capturing groups.

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetString(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the substring of the match from the source string. Capturing groups can be retrieved by providing its group number as an integer or its string name (if it's a named group). The default value of 0 refers to the whole pattern. Returns an empty string if the group did not match or doesn't exist. <param name="name">If the param is null, then the default value is (object)0</param>

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetStart(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the starting position of the match within the source string. The starting position of capturing groups can be retrieved by providing its group number as an integer or its string name (if it's a named group). The default value of 0 refers to the whole pattern. Returns -1 if the group did not match or doesn't exist. <param name="name">If the param is null, then the default value is (object)0</param>

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetEnd(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the end position of the match within the source string. The end position of capturing groups can be retrieved by providing its group number as an integer or its string name (if it's a named group). The default value of 0 refers to the whole pattern. Returns -1 if the group did not match or doesn't exist. <param name="name">If the param is null, then the default value is (object)0</param>

member.name: T:Godot.RemoteTransform
member.summary: RemoteTransform pushes its own [Transform] to another [Spatial] derived Node (called the remote node) in the scene. It can be set to update another Node's position, rotation and/or scale. It can use either global or local coordinates.

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform.RemotePath
member.summary: The [NodePath] to the remote node, relative to the RemoteTransform's position in the scene.

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform.UseGlobalCoordinates
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], global coordinates are used. If [code]false[/code], local coordinates are used. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform.UpdatePosition
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the remote node's position is updated. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform.UpdateRotation
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the remote node's rotation is updated. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform.UpdateScale
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the remote node's scale is updated. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.RemoteTransform2D
member.summary: RemoteTransform2D pushes its own [Transform2D] to another [CanvasItem] derived Node (called the remote node) in the scene. It can be set to update another Node's position, rotation and/or scale. It can use either global or local coordinates.

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform2D.RemotePath
member.summary: The [NodePath] to the remote node, relative to the RemoteTransform2D's position in the scene.

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform2D.UseGlobalCoordinates
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], global coordinates are used. If [code]false[/code], local coordinates are used. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform2D.UpdatePosition
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the remote node's position is updated. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform2D.UpdateRotation
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the remote node's rotation is updated. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform2D.UpdateScale
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the remote node's scale is updated. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.Resource
member.summary: Resource is the base class for all resource types, serving primarily as data containers. They are reference counted and freed when no longer in use. They are also loaded only once from disk, and further attempts to load the resource will return the same reference (all this in contrast to a [Node], which is not reference counted and can be instanced from disk as many times as desired). Resources can be saved externally on disk or bundled into another object, such as a [Node] or another resource.

member.name: P:Godot.Resource.ResourcePath
member.summary: The path to the resource. In case it has its own file, it will return its filepath. If it's tied to the scene, it will return the scene's path, followed by the resource's index.

member.name: P:Godot.Resource.ResourceName
member.summary: The name of the resource. This is an optional identifier.

member.name: M:Godot.Resource.TakeOverPath(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the path of the resource. Differs from [code]set_path()[/code], if another [code]Resource[/code] exists with "path" it over-takes it, instead of failing.

member.name: M:Godot.Resource.GetRid
member.summary: Returns the RID of the resource (or an empty RID). Many resources (such as [Texture], [Mesh], etc) are high level abstractions of resources stored in a server, so this function will return the original RID.

member.name: M:Godot.Resource.Duplicate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Duplicates the resource, returning a new resource. By default, sub-resources are shared between resource copies for efficiency, this can be changed by passing [code]true[/code] to the [code]subresources[/code] argument.

member.name: T:Godot.ResourceFormatLoader
member.summary: Godot loads resources in the editor or in exported games using ResourceFormatLoaders. They get queried when you call [code]load[/code], or when a resource with internal dependencies is loaded. Each file type may load as a different resource type, so multiple ResourceFormatLoader are registered in the engine. Extending this class allows you to define your own. You should give it a global class name with [code]class_name[/code] for it to be registered. You may as well implement a [ResourceFormatSaver]. Note: You can also extend [EditorImportPlugin] if the resource type you need exists but Godot is unable to load its format. Choosing one way over another depends if the format is suitable or not for the final exported game. Example: it's better to import .PNG textures as .STEX first, so they can be loaded with better efficiency on the graphics card.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceFormatLoader.GetDependencies(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: If implemented, gets the dependencies of a given resource. If [code]add_types[/code] is [code]true[/code], paths should be appended [code]::TypeName[/code], where [code]TypeName[/code] is the class name of the dependency. Note that custom resource types defined by scripts aren't known by the [ClassDB], so you might just return [code]Resource[/code] for them.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceFormatLoader.GetRecognizedExtensions
member.summary: Gets the list of extensions for files this loader is able to read.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceFormatLoader.GetResourceType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the class name of the resource associated with the given path. If the loader cannot handle it, it should return [code]""[/code]. Note that custom resource types defined by scripts aren't known by the [ClassDB], so you might just return [code]"Resource"[/code] for them.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceFormatLoader.HandlesType(System.String)
member.summary: Tells which resource class this loader can load. Note that custom resource types defined by scripts aren't known by the [ClassDB], so you might just handle [code]"Resource"[/code] for them.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceFormatLoader.Load(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads a resource when the engine finds this loader to be compatible. If the loaded resource is the result of an import, [code]original_path[/code] will target the source file. Returns a resource object if succeeded, or an [code]ERR_*[/code] constant listed in [@GlobalScope] if it failed.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceFormatLoader.RenameDependencies(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: If implemented, renames dependencies within the given resource and saves it. [code]renames[/code] is a dictionary [code]{ String => String }[/code] mapping old dependency paths to new paths. Returns [code]OK[/code] on success, or an [code]ERR_*[/code] constant listed in [@GlobalScope] in case of failure.

member.name: T:Godot.ResourceFormatSaver
member.summary: The engine can save resources when you do it from the editor, or when you call [method ResourceSaver.save]. This is accomplished with multiple [code]ResourceFormatSaver[/code]s, each handling its own format. By default, Godot saves resources as [code].tres[/code], [code].res[/code] or another built-in format, but you can choose to create your own format by extending this class. You should give it a global class name with [code]class_name[/code] for it to be registered. You may as well implement a [ResourceFormatLoader].

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceFormatSaver.GetRecognizedExtensions(Godot.Resource)
member.summary: Gets the list of extensions for files this saver is able to write.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceFormatSaver.Recognize(Godot.Resource)
member.summary: Returns true if the given resource object can be saved by this saver.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceFormatSaver.Save(System.String,Godot.Resource,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves the given resource object to a file. [code]flags[/code] is a bitmask composed with [code]FLAG_*[/code] constants defined in [ResourceSaver]. Returns [code]OK[/code] on success, or an [code]ERR_*[/code] constant listed in [@GlobalScope] if it failed.

member.name: T:Godot.ResourceInteractiveLoader
member.summary: Interactive Resource Loader. This object is returned by ResourceLoader when performing an interactive load. It allows to load with high granularity, so this is mainly useful for displaying load bars/percentages.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceInteractiveLoader.GetResource
member.summary: Return the loaded resource (only if loaded). Otherwise, returns null.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceInteractiveLoader.Poll
member.summary: Poll the load. If OK is returned, this means poll will have to be called again. If ERR_FILE_EOF is returned, them the load has finished and the resource can be obtained by calling [method get_resource].

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceInteractiveLoader.GetStage
member.summary: Return the load stage. The total amount of stages can be queried with [method get_stage_count]

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceInteractiveLoader.GetStageCount
member.summary: Return the total amount of stages (calls to [method poll]) needed to completely load this resource.

member.name: T:Godot.ResourcePreloader
member.summary: This node is used to preload sub-resources inside a scene, so when the scene is loaded, all the resources are ready to use and can be retrieved from the preloader.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.AddResource(System.String,Godot.Resource)
member.summary: Adds a resource to the preloader with the given [code]name[/code]. If a resource with the given [code]name[/code] already exists, the new resource will be renamed to "[code]name[/code] N" where N is an incrementing number starting from 2.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.RemoveResource(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the resource associated to [code]name[/code] from the preloader.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.RenameResource(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Renames a resource inside the preloader from [code]name[/code] to [code]newname[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.HasResource(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the preloader contains a resource associated to [code]name[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.GetResource(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the resource associated to [code]name[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.GetResourceList
member.summary: Returns the list of resources inside the preloader.

member.name: T:Godot.ResourceSaver
member.summary: Resource saving interface, used for saving resources to disk.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceSaver.Save(System.String,Godot.Resource,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves a resource to disk.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceSaver.GetRecognizedExtensions(Godot.Resource)
member.summary: Returns the list of extensions available for saving a resource of a given type.

member.name: T:Godot.RichTextLabel
member.summary: Rich text can contain custom text, fonts, images and some basic formatting. The label manages these as an internal tag stack. It also adapts itself to given width/heights. Note that assignments to [member bbcode_text] clear the tag stack and reconstruct it from the property's contents. Any edits made to [member bbcode_text] will erase previous edits made from other manual sources such as [method append_bbcode] and the [code]push_*[/code] / [method pop] methods.

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.BbcodeEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the label uses BBCode formatting. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.BbcodeText
member.summary: The label's text in BBCode format. Is not representative of manual modifications to the internal tag stack. Erases changes made by other methods when edited.

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.VisibleCharacters
member.summary: The restricted number of characters to display in the label.

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.PercentVisible
member.summary: The text's visibility, as a [float] between 0.0 and 1.0.

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.MetaUnderlined
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the label underlines meta tags such as [code][url]{text}[/url][/code]. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.TabSize
member.summary: The number of spaces associated with a single tab length. Does not affect "\t" in text tags, only indent tags.

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.Text
member.summary: The raw text of the label. When set, clears the tag stack and adds a raw text tag to the top of it. Does not parse bbcodes. Does not modify [member bbcode_text].

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.ScrollActive
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the scrollbar is visible. Does not block scrolling completely. See [method scroll_to_line]. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.ScrollFollowing
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the window scrolls down to display new content automatically. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.SelectionEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the label allows text selection.

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.OverrideSelectedFontColor
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the label uses the custom font color. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.AddText(System.String)
member.summary: Adds raw non-bbcode-parsed text to the tag stack.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.AddImage(Godot.Texture)
member.summary: Adds an image's opening and closing tags to the tag stack.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.Newline
member.summary: Adds a newline tag to the tag stack.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.RemoveLine(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a line of content from the label. Returns [code]true[/code] if the line exists.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.PushFont(Godot.Font)
member.summary: Adds a [code][font][/code] tag to the tag stack. Overrides default fonts for its duration.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.PushColor(Godot.Color)
member.summary: Adds a [code][color][/code] tag to the tag stack.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.PushAlign(Godot.RichTextLabel.Align)
member.summary: Adds an alignment tag based on the given [code]align[/code] value. See [enum Align] for possible values.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.PushIndent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an [code][indent][/code] tag to the tag stack. Multiplies "level" by current tab_size to determine new margin length.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.PushList(Godot.RichTextLabel.ListType)
member.summary: Adds a list tag to the tag stack. Similar to the bbcodes [code][ol][/code] or [code][ul][/code], but supports more list types. Not fully implemented!

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.PushMeta(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a meta tag to the tag stack. Similar to the bbcode [code][url=something]{text}[/url][/code], but supports non-[String] metadata types.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.PushUnderline
member.summary: Adds a [code][u][/code] tag to the tag stack.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.PushStrikethrough
member.summary: Adds a [code][s][/code] tag to the tag stack.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.PushTable(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a [code][table=columns][/code] tag to the tag stack.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.SetTableColumnExpand(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Edits the selected columns expansion options. If [code]expand[/code] is [code]true[/code], the column expands in proportion to its expansion ratio versus the other columns' ratios. For example, 2 columns with ratios 3 and 4 plus 70 pixels in available width would expand 30 and 40 pixels, respectively. Columns with a [code]false[/code] expand will not contribute to the total ratio.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.PushCell
member.summary: Adds a [code][cell][/code] tag to the tag stack. Must be inside a [code][table][/code] tag. See [method push_table] for details.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.Pop
member.summary: Terminates the current tag. Use after [code]push_*[/code] methods to close bbcodes manually. Does not need to follow [code]add_*[/code] methods.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.Clear
member.summary: Clears the tag stack and sets [member bbcode_text] to an empty string.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.GetVScroll
member.summary: Returns the vertical scrollbar.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.ScrollToLine(System.Int32)
member.summary: Scrolls the window's top line to match [code]line[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.ParseBbcode(System.String)
member.summary: The assignment version of [method append_bbcode]. Clears the tag stack and inserts the new content. Returns [code]OK[/code] if parses [code]bbcode[/code] successfully.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.AppendBbcode(System.String)
member.summary: Parses [code]bbcode[/code] and adds tags to the tag stack as needed. Returns the result of the parsing, [code]OK[/code] if successful.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.GetTotalCharacterCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of characters from text tags. Does not include bbcodes.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.GetLineCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of newlines in the tag stack's text tags. Considers wrapped text as one line.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.GetVisibleLineCount
member.summary: Returns the number of visible lines.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.GetContentHeight
member.summary: Returns the height of the content.

member.name: T:Godot.RigidBody
member.summary: This is the node that implements full 3D physics. This means that you do not control a RigidBody directly. Instead you can apply forces to it (gravity, impulses, etc.), and the physics simulation will calculate the resulting movement, collision, bouncing, rotating, etc. A RigidBody has 4 behavior [member mode]s: Rigid, Static, Character, and Kinematic. [b]Note:[/b] Don't change a RigidBody's position every frame or very often. Sporadic changes work fine, but physics runs at a different granularity (fixed hz) than usual rendering (process callback) and maybe even in a separate thread, so changing this from a process loop will yield strange behavior. If you need to directly affect the body's state, use [method _integrate_forces], which allows you to directly access the physics state. If you need to override the default physics behavior, you can write a custom force integration. See [member custom_integrator].

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody.ModeEnum.Rigid
member.summary: Rigid body mode. This is the "natural" state of a rigid body. It is affected by forces, and can move, rotate, and be affected by user code.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody.ModeEnum.Static
member.summary: Static mode. The body behaves like a [StaticBody], and can only move by user code.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody.ModeEnum.Character
member.summary: Character body mode. This behaves like a rigid body, but can not rotate.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody.ModeEnum.Kinematic
member.summary: Kinematic body mode. The body behaves like a [KinematicBody], and can only move by user code.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Mode
member.summary: The body mode from the MODE_* enum. Modes include: MODE_STATIC, MODE_KINEMATIC, MODE_RIGID, and MODE_CHARACTER.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Mass
member.summary: The body's mass.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Weight
member.summary: The body's weight based on its mass and the global 3D gravity. Global values are set in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 3d".

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Friction
member.summary: The body's friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (max friction).

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Bounce
member.summary: RigidBody's bounciness.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.GravityScale
member.summary: This is multiplied by the global 3D gravity setting found in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 3d" to produce RigidBody's gravity. E.g. a value of 1 will be normal gravity, 2 will apply double gravity, and 0.5 will apply half gravity to this object.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.CustomIntegrator
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], internal force integration will be disabled (like gravity or air friction) for this body. Other than collision response, the body will only move as determined by the [method _integrate_forces] function, if defined.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.ContinuousCd
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], continuous collision detection is used. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided. Continuous collision detection is more precise, and misses less impacts by small, fast-moving objects. Not using continuous collision detection is faster to compute, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.ContactsReported
member.summary: The maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.ContactMonitor
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the RigidBody will emit signals when it collides with another RigidBody.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Sleeping
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the body is sleeping and will not calculate forces until woken up by a collision or the [code]apply_impulse[/code] method.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.CanSleep
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the RigidBody will not calculate forces and will act as a static body while there is no movement. It will wake up when forces are applied through other collisions or when the [code]apply_impulse[/code] method is used.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AxisLockLinearX
member.summary: Lock the body's movement in the x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AxisLockLinearY
member.summary: Lock the body's movement in the x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AxisLockLinearZ
member.summary: Lock the body's movement in the x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AxisLockAngularX
member.summary: Lock the body's rotation in the x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AxisLockAngularY
member.summary: Lock the body's rotation in the y-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AxisLockAngularZ
member.summary: Lock the body's rotation in the z-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.LinearVelocity
member.summary: The body's linear velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may run in another thread and runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop for precise control of the body state.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.LinearDamp
member.summary: The body's linear damp. Default value: -1, cannot be less than -1. If this value is different from -1, any linear damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AngularVelocity
member.summary: RigidBody's rotational velocity.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AngularDamp
member.summary: Damps RigidBody's rotational forces.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody._IntegrateForces(Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState)
member.summary: Called during physics processing, allowing you to read and safely modify the simulation state for the object. By default, it works in addition to the usual physics behavior, but the [member custom_integrator] property allows you to disable the default behavior and do fully custom force integration for a body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetAxisVelocity(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.AddCentralForce(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Adds a constant directional force without affecting rotation. This is equivalent to [code]add_force(force, Vector3(0,0,0))[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.AddForce(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Adds a constant force (i.e. acceleration).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.AddTorque(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Adds a constant rotational force (i.e. a motor) without affecting position.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.ApplyCentralImpulse(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Applies a directional impulse without affecting rotation. This is equivalent to [code]apply_impulse(Vector3(0,0,0), impulse)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.ApplyImpulse(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Applies a positioned impulse to the body. An impulse is time independent! Applying an impulse every frame would result in a framerate dependent force. For this reason it should only be used when simulating one-time impacts. The position uses the rotation of the global coordinate system, but is centered at the object's origin.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.ApplyTorqueImpulse(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Applies a torque impulse which will be affected by the body mass and shape. This will rotate the body around the passed in vector.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetCollidingBodies
member.summary: Return a list of the bodies colliding with this one. By default, number of max contacts reported is at 0, see the [member contacts_reported] property to increase it. Note that the result of this test is not immediate after moving objects. For performance, list of collisions is updated once per frame and before the physics step. Consider using signals instead.

member.name: T:Godot.RigidBody2D
member.summary: This node implements simulated 2D physics. You do not control a RigidBody2D directly. Instead you apply forces to it (gravity, impulses, etc.) and the physics simulation calculates the resulting movement based on its mass, friction, and other physical properties. A RigidBody2D has 4 behavior [member mode]s: Rigid, Static, Character, and Kinematic. [b]Note:[/b] You should not change a RigidBody2D's [code]position[/code] or [code]linear_velocity[/code] every frame or even very often. If you need to directly affect the body's state, use [method _integrate_forces], which allows you to directly access the physics state. If you need to override the default physics behavior, you can write a custom force integration. See [member custom_integrator].

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.ModeEnum.Rigid
member.summary: Rigid mode. The body behaves as a physical object. It collides with other bodies and responds to forces applied to it. This is the default mode.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.ModeEnum.Static
member.summary: Static mode. The body behaves like a [StaticBody2D] and does not move.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.ModeEnum.Character
member.summary: Character mode. Similar to [code]MODE_RIGID[/code], but the body can not rotate.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.ModeEnum.Kinematic
member.summary: Kinematic mode. The body behaves like a [KinematicBody2D], and must be moved by code.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.CCDMode.Disabled
member.summary: Continuous collision detection disabled. This is the fastest way to detect body collisions, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.CCDMode.CastRay
member.summary: Continuous collision detection enabled using raycasting. This is faster than shapecasting but less precise.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.CCDMode.CastShape
member.summary: Continuous collision detection enabled using shapecasting. This is the slowest CCD method and the most precise.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Mode
member.summary: The body's mode. See [code]MODE_*[/code] constants. Default value: [code]MODE_RIGID[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Mass
member.summary: The body's mass. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Inertia
member.summary: The body's moment of inertia. This is like mass, but for rotation: it determines how much torque it takes to rotate the body. The moment of inertia is usually computed automatically from the mass and the shapes, but this function allows you to set a custom value. Set 0 (or negative) inertia to return to automatically computing it.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Weight
member.summary: The body's weight based on its mass and the "Default Gravity" value in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 2d".

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Friction
member.summary: The body's friction. Values range from [code]0[/code] (frictionless) to [code]1[/code] (maximum friction). Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Bounce
member.summary: The body's bounciness. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.GravityScale
member.summary: Multiplies the gravity applied to the body. The body's gravity is calculated from the "Default Gravity" value in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 2d" and/or any additional gravity vector applied by [Area2D]s. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.CustomIntegrator
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], internal force integration is disabled for this body. Aside from collision response, the body will only move as determined by the [method _integrate_forces] function.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.ContinuousCd
member.summary: Continuous collision detection mode. Default value: [code]CCD_MODE_DISABLED[/code]. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide instead of moving it and correcting its movement after collision. Continuous collision detection is slower, but more precise and misses fewer collisions with small, fast-moving objects. Raycasting and shapecasting methods are available. See [code]CCD_MODE_[/code] constants for details.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.ContactsReported
member.summary: The maximum number of contacts to report. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.ContactMonitor
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the body will emit signals when it collides with another RigidBody2D. See also [member contacts_reported]. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Sleeping
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the body is sleeping and will not calculate forces until woken up by a collision or by using [method apply_impulse] or [method add_force].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.CanSleep
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the body will not calculate forces and will act as a static body if there is no movement. The body will wake up when other forces are applied via collisions or by using [method apply_impulse] or [method add_force]. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.LinearVelocity
member.summary: The body's linear velocity.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.LinearDamp
member.summary: Damps the body's [member linear_velocity]. If [code]-1[/code] the body will use the "Default Linear Damp" in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 2d". Default value: [code]-1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.AngularVelocity
member.summary: The body's rotational velocity.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.AngularDamp
member.summary: Damps the body's [member angular_velocity]. If [code]-1[/code] the body will use the "Default Angular Damp" in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 2d". Default value: [code]-1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.AppliedForce
member.summary: The body's total applied force.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.AppliedTorque
member.summary: The body's total applied torque.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D._IntegrateForces(Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState)
member.summary: Allows you to read and safely modify the simulation state for the object. Use this instead of [method Node._physics_process] if you need to directly change the body's [code]position[/code] or other physics properties. By default, it works in addition to the usual physics behavior, but [member custom_integrator] allows you to disable the default behavior and write custom force integration for a body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetAxisVelocity(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the body's velocity on the given axis. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.ApplyCentralImpulse(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a directional impulse without affecting rotation.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.ApplyImpulse(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a positioned impulse to the body. An impulse is time independent! Applying an impulse every frame would result in a framerate dependent force. For this reason it should only be used when simulating one-time impacts (use the "_force" functions otherwise). The position uses the rotation of the global coordinate system, but is centered at the object's origin.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.ApplyTorqueImpulse(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies a rotational impulse to the body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.AddCentralForce(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Adds a constant directional force without affecting rotation.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.AddForce(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Adds a positioned force to the body. Both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.AddTorque(System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a constant rotational force.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.TestMotion(Godot.Vector2,System.Boolean,System.Single,Godot.Physics2DTestMotionResult)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if a collision would result from moving in the given vector. [code]margin[/code] increases the size of the shapes involved in the collision detection, and [code]result[/code] is an object of type [Physics2DTestMotionResult], which contains additional information about the collision (should there be one).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetCollidingBodies
member.summary: Returns a list of the bodies colliding with this one. Use [member contacts_reported] to set the maximum number reported. You must also set [member contact_monitor] to [code]true[/code]. Note that the result of this test is not immediate after moving objects. For performance, list of collisions is updated once per frame and before the physics step. Consider using signals instead.

member.name: T:Godot.SceneState
member.summary: Maintains a list of resources, nodes, exported, and overridden properties, and built-in scripts associated with a scene.

member.name: F:Godot.SceneState.GenEditState.Disabled
member.summary: If passed to [method PackedScene.instance], blocks edits to the scene state.

member.name: F:Godot.SceneState.GenEditState.Instance
member.summary: If passed to [method PackedScene.instance], provides inherited scene resources to the local scene. Requires tools compiled.

member.name: F:Godot.SceneState.GenEditState.Main
member.summary: If passed to [method PackedScene.instance], provides local scene resources to the local scene. Only the main scene should receive the main edit state. Requires tools compiled.

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of nodes in the scene.

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodeType(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the type of the node at [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodeName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the name of the node at [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodePath(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the path to the node at [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodeOwnerPath(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the path to the owner of the node at [code]idx[/code], relative to the root node.

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.IsNodeInstancePlaceholder(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the node at [code]idx[/code] is an [InstancePlaceholder].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodeInstancePlaceholder(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the path to the represented scene file if the node at [code]idx[/code] is an [InstancePlaceholder].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodeInstance(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the scene for the node at [code]idx[/code] or [code]null[/code] if the node is not an instance.

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodeGroups(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the list of group names associated with the node at [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodePropertyCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of exported or overridden properties for the node at [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodePropertyName(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the name of the property at [code]prop_idx[/code] for the node at [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetNodePropertyValue(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value of the property at [code]prop_idx[/code] for the node at [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetConnectionCount
member.summary: Returns the number of signal connections in the scene.

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetConnectionSource(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the path to the node that owns the signal at [code]idx[/code], relative to the root node.

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetConnectionSignal(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the name of the signal at [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetConnectionTarget(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the path to the node that owns the method connected to the signal at [code]idx[/code], relative to the root node.

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetConnectionMethod(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the method connected to the signal at [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetConnectionFlags(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the flags for the signal at [code]idx[/code]. See [Object]'s [code]CONNECT_*[/code] flags.

member.name: M:Godot.SceneState.GetConnectionBinds(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the list of bound parameters for the signal at [code]idx[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.SceneTree
member.summary: As one of the most important classes, the [code]SceneTree[/code] manages the hierarchy of nodes in a scene as well as scenes themselves. Nodes can be added, retrieved and removed. The whole scene tree (and thus the current scene) can be paused. Scenes can be loaded, switched and reloaded. You can also use the SceneTree to organize your nodes into groups: every node can be assigned as many groups as you want to create, e.g. a "enemy" group. You can then iterate these groups or even call methods and set properties on all the group's members at once.

member.name: F:Godot.SceneTree.StretchAspect.Ignore
member.summary: Fill the window with the content stretched to cover excessive space. Content may appear elongated.

member.name: F:Godot.SceneTree.StretchAspect.Keep
member.summary: Retain the same aspect ratio by padding with black bars in either axes. No expansion of content.

member.name: F:Godot.SceneTree.StretchAspect.KeepWidth
member.summary: Expand vertically. Left/right black bars may appear if the window is too wide.

member.name: F:Godot.SceneTree.StretchAspect.KeepHeight
member.summary: Expand horizontally. Top/bottom black bars may appear if the window is too tall.

member.name: F:Godot.SceneTree.StretchAspect.Expand
member.summary: Expand in both directions, retaining the same aspect ratio. No black bars.

member.name: F:Godot.SceneTree.GroupCallFlags.Default
member.summary: Call a group with no flags (default).

member.name: F:Godot.SceneTree.GroupCallFlags.Reverse
member.summary: Call a group in reverse scene order.

member.name: P:Godot.SceneTree.Paused
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the SceneTree is paused. Doing so will have the following behavior: * 2D and 3D physics will be stopped. * _process and _physics_process will not be called anymore in nodes. * _input and _input_event will not be called anymore either.

member.name: P:Godot.SceneTree.RefuseNewNetworkConnections
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the SceneTree's [member network_peer] refuses new incoming connections.

member.name: P:Godot.SceneTree.UseFontOversampling
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], font oversampling is used.

member.name: P:Godot.SceneTree.EditedSceneRoot
member.summary: The root of the edited scene.

member.name: P:Godot.SceneTree.CurrentScene
member.summary: The current scene.

member.name: P:Godot.SceneTree.NetworkPeer
member.summary: The peer object to handle the RPC system (effectively enabling networking when set). Depending on the peer itself, the SceneTree will become a network server (check with [method is_network_server]) and will set root node's network mode to master (see NETWORK_MODE_* constants in [Node]), or it will become a regular peer with root node set to puppet. All child nodes are set to inherit the network mode by default. Handling of networking-related events (connection, disconnection, new clients) is done by connecting to SceneTree's signals.

member.name: P:Godot.SceneTree.Root
member.summary: The SceneTree's [Viewport].

member.name: P:Godot.SceneTree.Multiplayer
member.summary: The default [MultiplayerAPI] instance for this SceneTree.

member.name: P:Godot.SceneTree.MultiplayerPoll
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], (default) enable the automatic polling of the [MultiplayerAPI] for this SceneTree during [signal idle_frame]. When [code]false[/code] you need to manually call [method MultiplayerAPI.poll] for processing network packets and delivering RPCs/RSETs. This allows to run RPCs/RSETs in a different loop (e.g. physics, thread, specific time step) and for manual [Mutex] protection when accessing the [MultiplayerAPI] from threads.

member.name: M:Godot.SceneTree.HasGroup(System.String)

member.name: M:Godot.SceneTree.SetQuitOnGoBack(System.Boolean)

member.name: M:Godot.SceneTree.CreateTimer(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a [SceneTreeTimer] which will [signal SceneTreeTimer.timeout] after the given time in seconds elapsed in this SceneTree. If [code]pause_mode_process[/code] is set to false, pausing the SceneTree will also pause the timer. Commonly used to create a one-shot delay timer as in the following example: [codeblock] func some_function(): print("start") yield(get_tree().create_timer(1.0), "timeout") print("end") [/codeblock]
