member.name: T:Godot.SceneTreeTimer
member.summary: A one-shot timer managed by the scene tree, which emits [signal timeout] on completion. See also [method SceneTree.create_timer]. As opposed to [Timer], it does not require the instantiation of a node. Commonly used to create a one-shot delay timer as in the following example: [codeblock] func some_function(): print("start") yield(get_tree().create_timer(1.0), "timeout") print("end") [/codeblock]

member.name: P:Godot.SceneTreeTimer.TimeLeft

[method Object.set_script] extends an existing object, if that object's class matches one of the script's base classes.

member.name: T:Godot.ScrollBar
member.summary: Scrollbars are a [Range] based [Control], that display a draggable area (the size of the page). Horizontal ([HScrollBar]) and Vertical ([VScrollBar]) versions are available.

member.name: T:Godot.ScrollContainer
member.summary: A ScrollContainer node meant to contain a [Control] child. ScrollContainers will automatically create a scrollbar child ([HScrollBar], [VScrollBar], or both) when needed and will only draw the Control within the ScrollContainer area. Scrollbars will automatically be drawn at the right (for vertical) or bottom (for horizontal) and will enable dragging to move the viewable Control (and its children) within the ScrollContainer. Scrollbars will also automatically resize the grabber based on the minimum_size of the Control relative to the ScrollContainer. Works great with a [Panel] control. You can set EXPAND on children size flags, so they will upscale to ScrollContainer size if ScrollContainer size is bigger (scroll is invisible for chosen dimension).

member.name: P:Godot.ScrollContainer.ScrollHorizontalEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], enables horizontal scrolling.

member.name: P:Godot.ScrollContainer.ScrollHorizontal
member.summary: The current horizontal scroll value.

member.name: P:Godot.ScrollContainer.ScrollVerticalEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], enables vertical scrolling.

member.name: P:Godot.ScrollContainer.ScrollVertical
member.summary: The current vertical scroll value.

member.name: P:Godot.SegmentShape2D.B

member.name: T:Godot.Semaphore
member.summary: A synchronization Semaphore. Element used to synchronize multiple [Thread]s. Initialized to zero on creation. Be careful to avoid deadlocks. For a binary version, see [Mutex].

member.name: M:Godot.Semaphore.Wait
member.summary: Tries to wait for the [code]Semaphore[/code], if its value is zero, blocks until non-zero. Returns [code]OK[/code] on success, [code]ERR_BUSY[/code] otherwise.

member.name: M:Godot.Semaphore.Post
member.summary: Lowers the [code]Semaphore[/code], allowing one more thread in. Returns [code]OK[/code] on success, [code]ERR_BUSY[/code] otherwise.

member.name: T:Godot.Separator
member.summary: Separator is a [Control] used for separating other controls. It's purely a visual decoration. Horizontal ([HSeparator]) and Vertical ([VSeparator]) versions are available.

member.summary: This class allows you to define a custom shader program that can be used for various materials to render objects.

member.name: M:Godot.Shader.GetMode
member.summary: Returns the shader mode for the shader, either [code]MODE_CANVAS_ITEM[/code], [code]MODE_SPATIAL[/code] or [code]MODE_PARTICLES[/code]

member.name: T:Godot.ShaderMaterial
member.summary: A material that uses a custom [Shader] program to render either items to screen or process particles. You can create multiple materials for the same shader but configure different values for the uniforms defined in the shader.

member.name: P:Godot.ShaderMaterial.Shader
member.summary: The [Shader] program used to render this material.

member.summary: Changes the value set for this material of a uniform in the shader.

member.name: M:Godot.ShaderMaterial.GetShaderParam(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the current value set for this material of a uniform in the shader.

member.summary: Base class for all 3D shape resources. Nodes that inherit from this can be used as shapes for a [PhysicsBody] or [Area] objects.

member.name: T:Godot.Shape2D
member.summary: Base class for all 2D Shapes. All 2D shape types inherit from this.

member.name: M:Godot.Shape2D.Collide(Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Shape2D,Godot.Transform2D)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if this shape is colliding with another. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), and the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.Shape2D.CollideWithMotion(Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Shape2D,Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Return whether this shape would collide with another, if a given movement was applied. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the movement to test on this shape ([code]local_motion[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]), and the movement to test onto the other object ([code]shape_motion[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.Shape2D.CollideAndGetContacts(Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Shape2D,Godot.Transform2D)
member.summary: Returns a list of the points where this shape touches another. If there are no collisions the list is empty. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), and the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.Shape2D.CollideWithMotionAndGetContacts(Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Shape2D,Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns a list of the points where this shape would touch another, if a given movement was applied. If there are no collisions the list is empty. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the movement to test on this shape ([code]local_motion[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]), and the movement to test onto the other object ([code]shape_motion[/code]).

member.name: T:Godot.Skeleton
member.summary: Skeleton provides a hierarchical interface for managing bones, including pose, rest and animation (see [Animation]). Skeleton will support rag doll dynamics in the future. The overall transform of a bone with respect to the skeleton is determined by the following hierarchical order: rest pose, custom pose and pose. Note that "global pose" below refers to the overall transform of the bone with respect to skeleton, so it not the actual global/world transform of the bone.

member.name: M:Godot.Skeleton.AddBone(System.String)
member.summary: Add a bone, with name "name". [method get_bone_count] will become the bone index.

member.summary: Return the bone index that matches "name" as its name.

member.name: M:Godot.Skeleton.GetBoneName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the name of the bone at index "index".

member.name: M:Godot.Skeleton.GetBoneParent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the bone index which is the parent of the bone at "bone_idx". If -1, then bone has no parent. Note that the parent bone returned will always be less than "bone_idx".

member.name: M:Godot.Skeleton.SetBoneParent(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the bone index "parent_idx" as the parent of the bone at "bone_idx". If -1, then bone has no parent. Note: "parent_idx" must be less than "bone_idx".

member.summary: Deprecated soon.

member.summary: Return the pose transform of the specified bone. Pose is applied on top of the custom pose, which is applied on top the rest pose.

member.name: T:Godot.SoftBody
member.summary: A deformable physics body. Used to create elastic or deformable objects such as cloth, rubber, or other flexible materials.

member.name: P:Godot.SoftBody.CollisionLayer
member.summary: The physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers work like a tagging system, and are not visual. A collidable can use these layers to select with which objects it can collide, using the collision_mask property. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

member.name: P:Godot.SoftBody.CollisionMask
member.summary: The physics layers this area scans for collisions.

member.name: P:Godot.SoftBody.SimulationPrecision
member.summary: Increasing this value will improve the resulting simulation, but can affect performance. Use with care.

member.name: M:Godot.SoftBody.RemoveCollisionExceptionWith(Godot.Node)

member.name: T:Godot.Spatial
member.summary: Most basic 3D game object, with a 3D [Transform] and visibility settings. All other 3D game objects inherit from Spatial. Use [code]Spatial[/code] as a parent node to move, scale, rotate and show/hide children in a 3D project. Affine operations (rotate, scale, translate) happen in parent's local coordinate system, unless the [code]Spatial[/code] object is set as top level. Affine operations in this coordinate system correspond to direct affine operations on the [code]Spatial[/code]'s transform. The word local below refers to this coordinate system. The coordinate system that is attached to the [code]Spatial[/code] object itself is referred to as object-local coordinate system.

member.name: F:Godot.Spatial.NotificationTransformChanged
member.summary: Spatial nodes receives this notification when their global transform changes. This means that either the current or a parent node changed its transform. In order for [code]NOTIFICATION_TRANSFORM_CHANGED[/code] to work, users first need to ask for it, with [method set_notify_transform].

member.name: F:Godot.Spatial.NotificationEnterWorld
member.summary: Spatial nodes receives this notification when they are registered to new [World] resource.

member.name: F:Godot.Spatial.NotificationExitWorld
member.summary: Spatial nodes receives this notification when they are unregistered from current [World] resource.

member.name: F:Godot.Spatial.NotificationVisibilityChanged
member.summary: Spatial nodes receives this notification when their visibility changes.

member.name: P:Godot.Spatial.GlobalTransform
member.summary: World space (global) [Transform] of this node.

member.name: P:Godot.Spatial.Translation
member.summary: Local translation of this node.

member.name: P:Godot.Spatial.RotationDegrees
member.summary: Rotation part of the local transformation in degrees, specified in terms of YXZ-Euler angles in the format (X-angle, Y-angle, Z-angle).

member.name: P:Godot.Spatial.Rotation
member.summary: Rotation part of the local transformation in radians, specified in terms of YXZ-Euler angles in the format (X-angle, Y-angle, Z-angle). Note that in the mathematical sense, rotation is a matrix and not a vector. The three Euler angles, which are the three independent parameters of the Euler-angle parametrization of the rotation matrix, are stored in a [Vector3] data structure not because the rotation is a vector, but only because [Vector3] exists as a convenient data-structure to store 3 floating point numbers. Therefore, applying affine operations on the rotation "vector" is not meaningful.

member.name: P:Godot.Spatial.Scale
member.summary: Scale part of the local transformation.

member.name: P:Godot.Spatial.Transform
member.summary: Local space [Transform] of this node, with respect to the parent node.

member.name: P:Godot.Spatial.Visible
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], this node is drawn. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Spatial.Gizmo
member.summary: The [SpatialGizmo] for this node. Used for example in [EditorSpatialGizmo] as custom visualization and editing handles in Editor.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.GetParentSpatial
member.summary: Returns the parent [code]Spatial[/code], or an empty [Object] if no parent exists or parent is not of type [code]Spatial[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.SetIgnoreTransformNotification(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether the node ignores notification that its transformation (global or local) changed.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.SetAsToplevel(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes the node ignore its parents transformations. Node transformations are only in global space.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.IsSetAsToplevel
member.summary: Returns whether this node is set as Toplevel, that is whether it ignores its parent nodes transformations.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.GetWorld

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.UpdateGizmo
member.summary: Updates the [SpatialGizmo] of this node.

member.summary: Enables rendering of this node. Changes [member visible] to [code]true[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.Hide
member.summary: Disables rendering of this node. Changes [member visible] to [code]false[/code].

member.summary: Set whether the node notifies about its local transformation changes. [code]Spatial[/code] will not propagate this by default.

member.summary: Returns whether node notifies about its local transformation changes. [code]Spatial[/code] will not propagate this by default.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.IsTransformNotificationEnabled
member.summary: Returns whether the node notifies about its global and local transformation changes. [code]Spatial[/code] will not propagate this by default.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.Rotate(Godot.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Rotates the local transformation around axis, a unit [Vector3], by specified angle in radians.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.GlobalRotate(Godot.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Rotates the global (world) transformation around axis, a unit [Vector3], by specified angle in radians. The rotation axis is in global coordinate system.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.ScaleObjectLocal(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Scales the local transformation by given 3D scale factors in object-local coordinate system.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.RotateX(System.Single)
member.summary: Rotates the local transformation around the X axis by angle in radians

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.RotateY(System.Single)
member.summary: Rotates the local transformation around the Y axis by angle in radians.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.RotateZ(System.Single)
member.summary: Rotates the local transformation around the Z axis by angle in radians.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.Translate(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Changes the node's position by given offset [Vector3].

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.Orthonormalize
member.summary: Resets this node's transformations (like scale, skew and taper) preserving its rotation and translation by performing Gram-Schmidt orthonormalization on this node's [Transform].

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.SetIdentity
member.summary: Reset all transformations for this node. Set its [Transform] to identity matrix.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.LookAt(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Rotates itself so that the local -Z axis points towards the [code]target[/code] position. The transform will first be rotated around the given [code]up[/code] vector, and then fully aligned to the target by a further rotation around an axis perpendicular to both the [code]target[/code] and [code]up[/code] vectors. Operations take place in global space.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.LookAtFromPosition(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the node to the specified [code]position[/code], and then rotates itself to point toward the [code]target[/code] as per [method look_at]. Operations take place in global space.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.ToLocal(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Transforms [Vector3] "global_point" from world space to this node's local space.

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.ToGlobal(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Transforms [Vector3] "local_point" from this node's local space to world space.

member.name: T:Godot.StaticBody
member.summary: Static body for 3D physics. A static body is a simple body that is not intended to move. They don't consume any CPU resources in contrast to a [RigidBody] so they are great for scenario collision. A static body can also be animated by using simulated motion mode. This is useful for implementing functionalities such as moving platforms. When this mode is active the body can be animated and automatically computes linear and angular velocity to apply in that frame and to influence other bodies. Alternatively, a constant linear or angular velocity can be set for the static body, so even if it doesn't move, it affects other bodies as if it was moving (this is useful for simulating conveyor belts or conveyor wheels).

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody.Friction
member.summary: The body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (full friction).

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody.Bounce
member.summary: The body bounciness.

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody.ConstantLinearVelocity
member.summary: The constant linear velocity for the body. This does not move the body, but affects other bodies that touch it, as if it was in a state of movement.

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody.ConstantAngularVelocity
member.summary: The constant angular velocity for the body. This does not rotate the body, but affects other bodies that touch it, as if it was in a state of rotation.

member.name: T:Godot.StaticBody2D
member.summary: Static body for 2D Physics. A StaticBody2D is a body that is not intended to move. It is ideal for implementing objects in the environment, such as walls or platforms. Additionally, a constant linear or angular velocity can be set for the static body, which will affect colliding bodies as if it were moving (for example, a conveyor belt).

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody2D.ConstantLinearVelocity
member.summary: Constant linear velocity for the body. This does not move the body, but affects colliding bodies, as if it were moving.

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody2D.ConstantAngularVelocity
member.summary: Constant angular velocity for the body. This does not rotate the body, but affects colliding bodies, as if it were rotating.

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody2D.Friction
member.summary: The body's friction. Values range from [code]0[/code] (no friction) to [code]1[/code] (full friction).

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody2D.Bounce
member.summary: The body's bounciness. Values range from [code]0[/code] (no bounce) to [code]1[/code] (full bounciness).

member.name: T:Godot.StreamPeer
member.summary: StreamPeer is an abstraction and base class for stream-based protocols (such as TCP or Unix Sockets). It provides an API for sending and receiving data through streams as raw data or strings.

member.name: P:Godot.StreamPeer.BigEndian
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], this [code]StreamPeer[/code] will using big-endian format for encoding and decoding.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.PutData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send a chunk of data through the connection, blocking if necessary until the data is done sending. This function returns an Error code.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.PutPartialData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send a chunk of data through the connection, if all the data could not be sent at once, only part of it will. This function returns two values, an Error code and an integer, describing how much data was actually sent.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.GetData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a chunk data with the received bytes. The amount of bytes to be received can be requested in the "bytes" argument. If not enough bytes are available, the function will block until the desired amount is received. This function returns two values, an Error code and a data array.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.GetPartialData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a chunk data with the received bytes. The amount of bytes to be received can be requested in the "bytes" argument. If not enough bytes are available, the function will return how many were actually received. This function returns two values, an Error code, and a data array.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.GetAvailableBytes

member.name: T:Godot.StyleBox
member.summary: StyleBox is [Resource] that provides an abstract base class for drawing stylized boxes for the UI. StyleBoxes are used for drawing the styles of buttons, line edit backgrounds, tree backgrounds, etc. and also for testing a transparency mask for pointer signals. If mask test fails on a StyleBox assigned as mask to a control, clicks and motion signals will go through it to the one below.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBox.ContentMarginLeft
member.summary: The left margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the left. Refer to [member content_margin_bottom] for extra considerations.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBox.ContentMarginRight
member.summary: The right margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the right. Refer to [member content_margin_bottom] for extra considerations.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBox.ContentMarginTop
member.summary: The top margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the top. Refer to [member content_margin_bottom] for extra considerations.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBox.ContentMarginBottom
member.summary: The bottom margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the bottom. If this value is negative, it is ignored and a child-specific margin is used instead. For example for [StyleBoxFlat] the border thickness (if any) is used instead. It is up to the code using this style box to decide what these contents are: for example, a [Button] respects this content margin for the textual contents of the button. [method get_margin] should be used to fetch this value as consumer instead of reading these properties directly. This is because it correctly respects negative values and the fallback mentioned above.

member.name: M:Godot.StyleBox.TestMask(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Rect2)
member.summary: Test a position in a rectangle, return whether it passes the mask test.

member.name: M:Godot.StyleBox.GetMargin(Godot.Margin)
member.summary: Return the content margin offset for the specified margin Positive values reduce size inwards, unlike [Control]'s margin values.

member.name: M:Godot.StyleBox.GetMinimumSize
member.summary: Return the minimum size that this stylebox can be shrunk to.

member.name: M:Godot.StyleBox.GetOffset
member.summary: Return the "offset" of a stylebox, this is a helper function, like writing [code]Vector2(style.get_margin(MARGIN_LEFT), style.get_margin(MARGIN_TOP))[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.StyleBoxEmpty
member.summary: Empty stylebox (really does not display anything).

member.name: T:Godot.StyleBoxFlat
member.summary: This stylebox can be used to achieve all kinds of looks without the need of a texture. Those properties are customizable: - Color - Border width (individual width for each border) - Rounded corners (individual radius for each corner) - Shadow Setting corner radius to high values is allowed. As soon as corners would overlap the stylebox will switch to a relative system. Example: [codeblock] height = 30 corner_radius_top_left = 50 corner_radius_bottom_left = 100 [/codeblock] The relative system now would take the 1:2 ratio of the two left corners to calculate the actual corner width. Both corners added will [b]never[/b] be more than the height. Result: [codeblock] corner_radius_top_left: 10 corner_radius_bottom_left: 20 [/codeblock]

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BgColor
member.summary: The background color of the stylebox.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.DrawCenter
member.summary: Toggels drawing of the inner part of the stylebox.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderWidthLeft
member.summary: Border width for the left border.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderWidthTop
member.summary: Border width for the top border.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderWidthRight
member.summary: Border width for the right border.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderWidthBottom
member.summary: Border width for the bottom border.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderColor
member.summary: Sets the color of the border.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderBlend
member.summary: When set to true, the border will fade into the background color.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.CornerRadiusTopLeft
member.summary: The corner radius of the top left corner. When set to 0 the corner is not rounded.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.CornerRadiusTopRight
member.summary: The corner radius of the top right corner. When set to 0 the corner is not rounded.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.CornerRadiusBottomRight
member.summary: The corner radius of the bottom right corner. When set to 0 the corner is not rounded.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.CornerRadiusBottomLeft
member.summary: The corner radius of the bottom left corner. When set to 0 the corner is not rounded.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.CornerDetail
member.summary: This sets the amount of vertices used for each corner. Higher values result in rounder corners but take more processing power to compute. When choosing a value you should take the corner radius ([method set_corner_radius_all]) into account. For corner radius smaller than 10, 4-5 should be enough. For corner radius smaller than 30, 8-12 should be enough.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ExpandMarginLeft
member.summary: Expands the stylebox outside of the control rect on the left edge. Useful in combination with border_width_left. To draw a border outside the control rect.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ExpandMarginRight
member.summary: Expands the stylebox outside of the control rect on the right edge. Useful in combination with border_width_right. To draw a border outside the control rect.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ExpandMarginTop
member.summary: Expands the stylebox outside of the control rect on the top edge. Useful in combination with border_width_top. To draw a border outside the control rect.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ExpandMarginBottom
member.summary: Expands the stylebox outside of the control rect on the bottom edge. Useful in combination with border_width_bottom. To draw a border outside the control rect.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ShadowColor
member.summary: The color of the shadow. (This has no effect when shadow_size < 1)

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ShadowSize
member.summary: The shadow size in pixels.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.AntiAliasing
member.summary: Anti Aliasing draws a small ring around edges. This ring fades to transparent. As a result edges look much smoother. This is only noticeable when using rounded corners.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.AntiAliasingSize
member.summary: This changes the size of the faded ring. Higher values can be used to achieve a "blurry" effect.

member.name: T:Godot.StyleBoxTexture
member.summary: Texture Based 3x3 scale style. This stylebox performs a 3x3 scaling of a texture, where only the center cell is fully stretched. This allows for the easy creation of bordered styles.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxTexture.Texture
member.summary: The texture to use when drawing this style box.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxTexture.NormalMap
member.summary: The normal map to use when drawing this style box.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxTexture.RegionRect
member.summary: Species a sub region of the texture to use. This is equivalent to first wrapping the texture in an [AtlasTexture] with the same region.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxTexture.MarginBottom
member.summary: Increases the bottom margin of the 3x3 texture box. A higher value means more of the source texture is considered to be part of the bottom border of the 3x3 box. This is also the value used as fallback for [member StyleBox.content_margin_bottom] if it is negative.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxTexture.ExpandMarginLeft
member.summary: Expands the left margin of this style box when drawing, causing it be drawn larger than requested.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxTexture.ExpandMarginRight
member.summary: Expands the right margin of this style box when drawing, causing it be drawn larger than requested.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxTexture.ExpandMarginTop

member.summary: Expands the bottom margin of this style box when drawing, causing it be drawn larger than requested.

member.name: T:Godot.SurfaceTool
member.summary: The [code]SurfaceTool[/code] is used to construct a [Mesh] by specifying vertex attributes individually. It can be used to construct a [Mesh] from script. All properties except index need to be added before a call to [method add_vertex]. For example adding vertex colors and UVs looks like [codeblock] var st = SurfaceTool.new() st.begin(Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES) st.add_color(Color(1, 0, 0)) st.add_uv(Vector2(0, 0)) st.add_vertex(Vector3(0, 0, 0)) [/codeblock] The [code]SurfaceTool[/code] now contains one vertex of a triangle which has a UV coordinate and a specified [Color]. If another vertex were added without calls to [method add_uv] or [method add_color] then the last values would be used. It is very important that vertex attributes are passed [b]before[/b] the call to [method add_vertex], failure to do this will result in an error when committing the vertex information to a mesh. Additionally, the attributes used before the first vertex is added determine the format of the mesh. For example if you only add UVs to the first vertex, you cannot add color to any of the subsequent vertices.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.Begin(Godot.Mesh.PrimitiveType)
member.summary: Called before adding any Vertices. Takes the primitive type as an argument (e.g. Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES).

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddVertex(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Specify position of current Vertex. Should be called after specifying other vertex properties (e.g. Color, UV).

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddColor(Godot.Color)
member.summary: Specify a [Color] for the next Vertex to use.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddNormal(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Specify a normal for the next Vertex to use.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddTangent(Godot.Plane)
member.summary: Specify a Tangent for the next Vertex to use.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddUv(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Specify UV Coordinate for next Vertex to use.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddUv2(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Specify an optional second set of UV coordinates for next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Add an array of bones for the next Vertex to use. Array must contain 4 integers.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddWeights(System.Single[])
member.summary: Specify weight values for next Vertex to use. Array must contain 4 values.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddSmoothGroup(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specify whether current Vertex (if using only Vertex arrays) or current index (if also using index arrays) should utilize smooth normals for normal calculation.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddTriangleFan(Godot.Vector3[],Godot.Vector2[],Godot.Color[],Godot.Vector2[],Godot.Vector3[],Godot.Collections.Array)
member.summary: Insert a triangle fan made of array data into [Mesh] being constructed. Requires primitive type be set to [code]PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES[/code]. <param name="uvs">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2[] {}</param> <param name="colors">If the param is null, then the default value is new Color[] {}</param> <param name="uv2s">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2[] {}</param> <param name="normals">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector3[] {}</param> <param name="tangents">If the param is null, then the default value is new Godot.Collections.Array {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an index to index array if you are using indexed Vertices. Does not need to be called before adding Vertex.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.Index
member.summary: Shrinks Vertex array by creating an index array. Avoids reusing Vertices.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.Deindex
member.summary: Removes index array by expanding Vertex array.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.GenerateNormals(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates normals from Vertices so you do not have to do it manually. Setting "flip" [code]true[/code] inverts resulting normals. Requires primitive type to be set to [code]PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.GenerateTangents
member.summary: Generates a tangent vector for each vertex. Requires that each vertex have UVs and normals set already.

member.summary: Sets [Material] to be used by the [Mesh] you are constructing.

member.name: T:Godot.TabContainer
member.summary: Sets the active tab's [code]visible[/code] property to the value [code]true[/code]. Sets all other children's to [code]false[/code]. Ignores non-[Control] children. Individual tabs are always visible unless you use [method set_tab_disabled] and [method set_tab_title] to hide it. To hide only a tab's content, nest the content inside a child [Control], so it receives the [code]TabContainer[/code]'s visibility setting instead.

member.name: P:Godot.TabContainer.TabsVisible
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], tabs are visible. If [code]false[/code], tabs' content and titles are hidden. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.TCP_Server
member.summary: TCP Server class. Listens to connections on a port and returns a [StreamPeerTCP] when got a connection.

member.name: M:Godot.TCP_Server.Listen(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Listen on the "port" binding to "bind_address". If "bind_address" is set as "*" (default), the server will listen on all available addresses (both IPv4 and IPv6). If "bind_address" is set as "0.0.0.0" (for IPv4) or "::" (for IPv6), the server will listen on all available addresses matching that IP type. If "bind_address" is set to any valid address (e.g. "192.168.1.101", "::1", etc), the server will only listen on the interface with that addresses (or fail if no interface with the given address exists).

member.name: M:Godot.TCP_Server.IsConnectionAvailable
member.summary: Return true if a connection is available for taking.

member.name: M:Godot.TCP_Server.TakeConnection
member.summary: If a connection is available, return a StreamPeerTCP with the connection/

member.name: M:Godot.TCP_Server.Stop
member.summary: Stop listening.

member.name: T:Godot.Texture
member.summary: A texture works by registering an image in the video hardware, which then can be used in 3D models or 2D [Sprite] or GUI [Control]. Textures are often created by loading them from a file. See [method @GDScript.load].

member.name: F:Godot.Texture.FlagsEnum.Default
member.summary: Default flags. Generate mipmaps, repeat, and filter are enabled.

member.name: F:Godot.Texture.FlagsEnum.Mipmaps
member.summary: Generate mipmaps, which are smaller versions of the same texture to use when zoomed out, keeping the aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Godot.Texture.FlagsEnum.Repeat
member.summary: Repeats texture (instead of clamp to edge).

member.name: F:Godot.Texture.FlagsEnum.Filter
member.summary: Magnifying filter, to enable smooth zooming in of the texture.

member.name: F:Godot.Texture.FlagsEnum.AnisotropicFilter
member.summary: Anisotropic mipmap filtering. Generates smaller versions of the same texture with different aspect ratios. More effective on planes often shown going to the horrizon as those textures (Walls or Ground for example) get squashed in the viewport to different aspect ratios and regular mipmaps keep the aspect ratio so they don't optimize storage that well in those cases.

member.name: F:Godot.Texture.FlagsEnum.ConvertToLinear
member.summary: Converts texture to SRGB color space.

member.name: F:Godot.Texture.FlagsEnum.MirroredRepeat
member.summary: Repeats texture with alternate sections mirrored.

member.summary: Texture is a video surface.

member.name: T:Godot.TextureButton
member.summary: [code]TextureButton[/code] has the same functionality as [Button], except it uses sprites instead of Godot's [Theme] resource. It is faster to create, but it doesn't support localization like more complex Controls. The Normal state's texture is required. Others are optional.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureButton.StretchModeEnum.Scale
member.summary: Scale to fit the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureButton.StretchModeEnum.Tile
member.summary: Tile inside the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureButton.StretchModeEnum.Keep
member.summary: The texture keeps its original size and stays in the bounding rectangle's top-left corner.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureButton.StretchModeEnum.KeepCentered
member.summary: The texture keeps its original size and stays centered in the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureButton.StretchModeEnum.KeepAspect
member.summary: Scale the texture to fit the node's bounding rectangle, but maintain the texture's aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureButton.StretchModeEnum.KeepAspectCentered
member.summary: Scale the texture to fit the node's bounding rectangle, center it, and maintain its aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureButton.StretchModeEnum.KeepAspectCovered
member.summary: Scale the texture so that the shorter side fits the bounding rectangle. The other side clips to the node's limits.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureButton.TextureNormal
member.summary: Texture to display by default, when the node is [b]not[/b] in the disabled, focused, hover or pressed state.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureButton.TexturePressed
member.summary: Texture to display on mouse down over the node, if the node has keyboard focus and the player presses the enter key or if the player presses the [member BaseButton.shortcut] key.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureButton.TextureHover
member.summary: Texture to display when the mouse hovers the node.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureButton.TextureDisabled
member.summary: Texture to display when the node is disabled. See [member BaseButton.disabled].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureButton.TextureFocused
member.summary: Texture to display when the node has mouse or keyboard focus.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureButton.TextureClickMask
member.summary: Pure black and white [BitMap] image to use for click detection. On the mask, white pixels represent the button's clickable area. Use it to create buttons with curved shapes.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureButton.Expand
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the texture stretches to the edges of the node's bounding rectangle using the [member stretch_mode]. If [code]false[/code], the texture will not scale with the node. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureButton.StretchMode
member.summary: Controls the texture's behavior when you resize the node's bounding rectangle, [b]only if[/b] [member expand] is [code]true[/code]. Set it to one of the [code]STRETCH_*[/code] constants. See the constants to learn more.

member.name: T:Godot.TextureProgress
member.summary: TextureProgress works like [ProgressBar] but it uses up to 3 textures instead of Godot's [Theme] resource. Works horizontally, vertically, and radially.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FillModeEnum.LeftToRight
member.summary: The [member texture_progress] fills from left to right.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FillModeEnum.RightToLeft
member.summary: The [member texture_progress] fills from right to left.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FillModeEnum.TopToBottom
member.summary: The [member texture_progress] fills from top to bototm.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FillModeEnum.BottomToTop
member.summary: The [member texture_progress] fills from bottom to top.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FillModeEnum.Clockwise
member.summary: Turns the node into a radial bar. The [member texture_progress] fills clockwise. See [member radial_center_offset], [member radial_initial_angle] and [member radial_fill_degrees] to control the way the bar fills up.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FillModeEnum.CounterClockwise
member.summary: Turns the node into a radial bar. The [member texture_progress] fills counter-clockwise. See [member radial_center_offset], [member radial_initial_angle] and [member radial_fill_degrees] to control the way the bar fills up.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FillModeEnum.BilinearLeftAndRight
member.summary: The [member texture_progress] fills from the center, expanding both towards the left and the right.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FillModeEnum.BilinearTopAndBottom
member.summary: The [member texture_progress] fills from the center, expanding both towards the top and the bottom.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FillModeEnum.ClockwiseAndCounterClockwise
member.summary: Turns the node into a radial bar. The [member texture_progress] fills radially from the center, expanding both clockwise and counter-clockwise. See [member radial_center_offset], [member radial_initial_angle] and [member radial_fill_degrees] to control the way the bar fills up.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.TextureUnder
member.summary: [Texture] that draws under the progress bar. The bar's background.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.TextureOver
member.summary: [Texture] that draws over the progress bar. Use it to add highlights or an upper-frame that hides part of [member texture_progress].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.TextureProgress_
member.summary: [Texture] that clips based on the node's [code]value[/code] and [member fill_mode]. As [code]value[/code] increased, the texture fills up. It shows entirely when [code]value[/code] reaches [code]max_value[/code]. It doesn't show at all if [code]value[/code] is equal to [code]min_value[/code]. The [code]value[/code] property comes from [Range]. See [member Range.value], [member Range.min_value], [member Range.max_value].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.FillMode
member.summary: The fill direction. Uses FILL_* constants.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.TintUnder
member.summary: Multiplies the color of the bar's [code]texture_under[/code] texture.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.TintOver
member.summary: Multiplies the color of the bar's [code]texture_over[/code] texture. The effect is similar to [member CanvasItem.modulate], except it only affects this specific texture instead of the entire node.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.TintProgress
member.summary: Multiplies the color of the bar's [code]texture_progress[/code] texture.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.RadialInitialAngle
member.summary: Starting angle for the fill of [member texture_progress] if [member fill_mode] is [code]FILL_CLOCKWISE[/code] or [code]FILL_COUNTER_CLOCKWISE[/code]. When the node's [code]value[/code] is equal to its [code]min_value[/code], the texture doesn't show up at all. When the [code]value[/code] increases, the texture fills and tends towards [member radial_fill_degrees].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.RadialFillDegrees
member.summary: Upper limit for the fill of [member texture_progress] if [member fill_mode] is [code]FILL_CLOCKWISE[/code] or [code]FILL_COUNTER_CLOCKWISE[/code]. When the node's [code]value[/code] is equal to its [code]max_value[/code], the texture fills up to this angle. See [member Range.value], [member Range.max_value].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.RadialCenterOffset
member.summary: Offsets [member texture_progress] if [member fill_mode] is [code]FILL_CLOCKWISE[/code] or [code]FILL_COUNTER_CLOCKWISE[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.NinePatchStretch
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], Godot treats the bar's textures like [NinePatchRect]. Use [code]stretch_margin_*[/code], like [member stretch_margin_bottom], to set up the nine patch's 3x3 grid. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.StretchMarginLeft
member.summary: The width of the 9-patch's left column.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.StretchMarginTop
member.summary: The height of the 9-patch's top row.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.StretchMarginRight
member.summary: The width of the 9-patch's right column.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.StretchMarginBottom
member.summary: The height of the 9-patch's bottom row. A margin of 16 means the 9-slice's bottom corners and side will have a height of 16 pixels. You can set all 4 margin values individually to create panels with non-uniform borders.

member.name: T:Godot.TextureRect
member.summary: Used to draw icons and sprites in a user interface. The texture's placement can be controlled with the [member stretch_mode] property. It can scale, tile, or stay centered inside its bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.StretchModeEnum.ScaleOnExpand
member.summary: Scale to fit the node's bounding rectangle, only if [code]expand[/code] is [code]true[/code]. Default [code]stretch_mode[/code], for backwards compatibility. Until you set [code]expand[/code] to [code]true[/code], the texture will behave like [code]STRETCH_KEEP[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.StretchModeEnum.Scale
member.summary: Scale to fit the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.StretchModeEnum.Tile
member.summary: Tile inside the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.StretchModeEnum.Keep
member.summary: The texture keeps its original size and stays in the bounding rectangle's top-left corner.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.StretchModeEnum.KeepCentered
member.summary: The texture keeps its original size and stays centered in the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.StretchModeEnum.KeepAspect
member.summary: Scale the texture to fit the node's bounding rectangle, but maintain the texture's aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.StretchModeEnum.KeepAspectCentered
member.summary: Scale the texture to fit the node's bounding rectangle, center it and maintain its aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.StretchModeEnum.KeepAspectCovered
member.summary: Scale the texture so that the shorter side fits the bounding rectangle. The other side clips to the node's limits.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureRect.Texture
member.summary: The node's [Texture] resource.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureRect.Expand
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the texture scales to fit its bounding rectangle. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureRect.StretchMode
member.summary: Controls the texture's behavior when resizing the node's bounding rectangle. See [enum StretchMode].

member.name: T:Godot.Theme
member.summary: Theme for skinning controls. Controls can be skinned individually, but for complex applications it's more efficient to just create a global theme that defines everything. This theme can be applied to any [Control], and it and its children will automatically use it. Theme resources can be alternatively loaded by writing them in a .theme file, see docs for more info.

member.name: P:Godot.Theme.DefaultFont
member.summary: The theme's default font.

member.name: M:Godot.Theme.SetIcon(System.String,System.String,Godot.Texture)
member.summary: Sets Theme's icon [Texture] to [code]texture[/code] at [code]name[/code] in [code]type[/code]. Does nothing if Theme does not have [code]type[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Theme.GetIcon(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the icon [Texture] at [code]name[/code] if Theme has [code]type[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Theme.HasIcon(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if icon [Texture] with [code]name[/code] is in [code]type[/code]. Returns [code]false[/code] if Theme does not have [code]type[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Theme.ClearIcon(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Clears icon at [code]name[/code] if Theme has [code]type[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Theme.GetIconList(System.String)
member.summary: Returns all of the icons as a [PoolStringArray] filled with each [Texture]'s name, for use in [method get_icon], if Theme has [code]type[/code].

member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if [StyleBox] with [code]name[/code] is in [code]type[/code]. Returns [code]false[/code] if Theme does not have [code]type[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Theme.ClearStylebox(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Clears [StyleBox] at [code]name[/code] if Theme has [code]type[/code].

member.summary: Returns all of the [StyleBox] types as a [PoolStringArray] filled with each [StyleBox]'s type, for use in [method get_stylebox] and/or [method get_stylebox_list], if Theme has [code]type[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.Thread
member.summary: A unit of execution in a process. Can run methods on [Object]s simultaneously. The use of synchronization via [Mutex], [Semaphore] is advised if working with shared objects.

member.name: M:Godot.Thread.Start(Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts a new [code]Thread[/code] that runs "method" on object "instance" with "userdata" passed as an argument. The "priority" of the [code]Thread[/code] can be changed by passing a PRIORITY_* enum. Returns OK on success, or ERR_CANT_CREATE on failure.

member.name: M:Godot.Thread.GetId
member.summary: Returns the current [code]Thread[/code]s id, uniquely identifying it among all threads.

member.name: M:Godot.Thread.IsActive
member.summary: Returns true if this [code]Thread[/code] is currently active. An active [code]Thread[/code] cannot start work on a new method but can be joined with [method wait_to_finish].

member.name: M:Godot.Thread.WaitToFinish
member.summary: Joins the [code]Thread[/code] and waits for it to finish. Returns what the method called returned.

member.name: T:Godot.TileMap
member.summary: Node for 2D tile-based maps. Tilemaps use a [TileSet] which contain a list of tiles (textures plus optional collision, navigation, and/or occluder shapes) which are used to create grid-based maps.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.InvalidCell
member.summary: Returned when a cell doesn't exist.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.ModeEnum.Square
member.summary: Orthogonal orientation mode.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.ModeEnum.Isometric
member.summary: Isometric orientation mode.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.ModeEnum.Custom
member.summary: Custom orientation mode.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.TileOrigin.TopLeft
member.summary: Tile origin at its top-left corner.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.TileOrigin.Center
member.summary: Tile origin at its center.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.TileOrigin.BottomLeft
member.summary: Tile origin at its bottom-left corner.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.HalfOffset.X
member.summary: Half offset on the X coordinate.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.HalfOffset.Y
member.summary: Half offset on the Y coordinate.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.HalfOffset.Disabled
member.summary: Half offset disabled.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.Mode
member.summary: The TileMap orientation mode. Uses MODE_* constants. Default value: MODE_SQUARE.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.TileSet
member.summary: The assigned [TileSet].

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellSize
member.summary: The TileMap's cell size.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellQuadrantSize
member.summary: The TileMap's quadrant size. Optimizes drawing by batching, using chunks of this size. Default value: 16.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellCustomTransform
member.summary: The custom [Transform2D] to be applied to the TileMap's cells.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellHalfOffset
member.summary: Amount to offset alternating tiles. Uses HALF_OFFSET_* constants. Default value: HALF_OFFSET_DISABLED.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellTileOrigin
member.summary: Position for tile origin. Uses TILE_ORIGIN_* constants. Default value: TILE_ORIGIN_TOP_LEFT.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellYSort
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the TileMap's children will be drawn in order of their Y coordinate. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CollisionUseKinematic
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], TileMap collisions will be handled as a kinematic body. If [code]false[/code], collisions will be handled as static body. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CollisionFriction
member.summary: Friction value for static body collisions (see [code]collision_use_kinematic[/code]). Default value: 1.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CollisionBounce
member.summary: Bounce value for static body collisions (see [code]collision_use_kinematic[/code]). Default value: 0.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CollisionLayer
member.summary: The collision layer(s) for all colliders in the TileMap.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CollisionMask
member.summary: The collision mask(s) for all colliders in the TileMap.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.OccluderLightMask
member.summary: The light mask assigned to all light occluders in the TileMap. The TileSet's light occluders will cast shadows only from Light2D(s) that have the same light mask(s).

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.SetCollisionLayerBit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the given collision layer bit.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCollisionLayerBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given collision layer bit is set.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.SetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the given collision mask bit.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given collision mask bit is set.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.SetCell(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2})
member.summary: Sets the tile index for the cell given by a Vector2. An index of [code]-1[/code] clears the cell. Optionally, the tile can also be flipped, transposed, or given autotile coordinates. Note that data such as navigation polygons and collision shapes are not immediately updated for performance reasons. If you need these to be immediately updated, you can call [method update_dirty_quadrants]. <param name="autotileCoord">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.SetCellv(Godot.Vector2,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the tile index for the given cell. An index of [code]-1[/code] clears the cell. Optionally, the tile can also be flipped or transposed. Note that data such as navigation polygons and collision shapes are not immediately updated for performance reasons. If you need these to be immediately updated, you can call [method update_dirty_quadrants].

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCell(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the tile index of the given cell. If no tile exists in the cell, returns [constant INVALID_CELL].

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCellv(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the tile index of the cell given by a Vector2. If no tile exists in the cell, returns [constant INVALID_CELL].

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.IsCellXFlipped(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given cell is flipped in the x axis.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.IsCellYFlipped(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given cell is flipped in the y axis.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.IsCellTransposed(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given cell is transposed, i.e. the x and y axes are swapped.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.FixInvalidTiles
member.summary: Clears cells that do not exist in the tileset.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.Clear
member.summary: Clears all cells.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetUsedCells
member.summary: Returns a [Vector2] array with the positions of all cells containing a tile from the tileset (i.e. a tile index different from [code]-1[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetUsedCellsById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an array of all cells with the given tile id.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetUsedRect
member.summary: Returns a rectangle enclosing the used (non-empty) tiles of the map.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.MapToWorld(Godot.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the global position corresponding to the given tilemap (grid-based) coordinates. Optionally, the tilemap's half offset can be ignored.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.WorldToMap(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the tilemap (grid-based) coordinates corresponding to the given local position.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.UpdateDirtyQuadrants
member.summary: Updates the tile map's quadrants, allowing things such as navigation and collision shapes to be immediately used if modified.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.UpdateBitmaskArea(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies autotiling rules to the cell (and its adjacent cells) referenced by its grid-based x and y coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.UpdateBitmaskRegion(System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2},System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2})
member.summary: Applies autotiling rules to the cells in the given region (specified by grid-based x and y coordinates). Calling with invalid (or missing) parameters applies autotiling rules for the entire tilemap. <param name="start">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param> <param name="end">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: T:Godot.TileSet
member.summary: A TileSet is a library of tiles for a [TileMap]. It contains a list of tiles, each consisting of a sprite and optional collision shapes. Tiles are referenced by a unique integer ID.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.CreateTile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new tile with the given ID.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileClearBitmaskMap(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears all bitmask info of the autotile.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileSetIconCoordinate(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the subtile that will be used as an icon in an atlas/autotile given its coordinates. The subtile defined as the icon will be used as a fallback when the atlas/autotile's bitmask info is incomplete. It will also be used to represent it in the TileSet editor.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileGetIconCoordinate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the subtile that's being used as an icon in an atlas/autotile given its coordinates. The subtile defined as the icon will be used as a fallback when the atlas/autotile's bitmask info is incomplete. It will also be used to represent it in the TileSet editor.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileSetSubtilePriority(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the priority of the subtile from an autotile given its coordinates. When more than one subtile has the same bitmask value, one of them will be picked randomly for drawing. Its priority will define how often it will be picked.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileGetSubtilePriority(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the priority of the subtile from an autotile given its coordinates. When more than one subtile has the same bitmask value, one of them will be picked randomly for drawing. Its priority will define how often it will be picked.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileSetZIndex(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the drawing index of the subtile from an atlas/autotile given its coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileGetZIndex(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the drawing index of the subtile from an atlas/autotile given its coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileSetLightOccluder(System.Int32,Godot.OccluderPolygon2D,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the light occluder of the subtile from an atlas/autotile given its coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileGetLightOccluder(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the light occluder of the subtile from an atlas/autotile given its coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileSetNavigationPolygon(System.Int32,Godot.NavigationPolygon,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the navigation polygon of the subtile from an atlas/autotile given its coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileGetNavigationPolygon(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileSetBitmask(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the bitmask of the subtile from an autotile given its coordinates. The value is the sum of the values in [enum TileSet.AutotileBindings] present in the subtile (e.g. a value of 5 means the bitmask has bindings in both the top left and top right).

member.name: M:Godot.TileSet.AutotileGetBitmask(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Returns the bitmask of the subtile from an autotile given its coordinates. The value is the sum of the values in [enum TileSet.AutotileBindings] present in the subtile (e.g. a value of 5 means the bitmask has bindings in both the top left and top right).

member.name: T:Godot.Tween
member.summary: Tweens are useful for animations requiring a numerical property to be interpolated over a range of values. The name *tween* comes from *in-betweening*, an animation technique where you specify *keyframes* and the computer interpolates the frames that appear between them. Here is a brief usage example that causes a 2D node to move smoothly between two positions: [codeblock] var tween = get_node("Tween") tween.interpolate_property($Node2D, "position", Vector2(0, 0), Vector2(100, 100), 1, Tween.TRANS_LINEAR, Tween.EASE_IN_OUT) tween.start() [/codeblock] Many methods require a property name, such as "position" above. You can find the correct property name by hovering over the property in the Inspector. You can also provide the components of a property directly by using "property:component" (eg. [code]position:x[/code]), where it would only apply to that particular component. Many of the methods accept [code]trans_type[/code] and [code]ease_type[/code]. The first accepts an [enum TransitionType] constant, and refers to the way the timing of the animation is handled (see [code]http://easings.net/[/code] for some examples). The second accepts an [enum EaseType] constant, and controls the where [code]trans_type[/code] is applied to the interpolation (in the beginning, the end, or both). If you don't know which transition and easing to pick, you can try different [enum TransitionType] constants with [code]EASE_IN_OUT[/code], and use the one that looks best.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Linear
member.summary: The animation is interpolated linearly.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Sine
member.summary: The animation is interpolated using a sine function.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Quint
member.summary: The animation is interpolated with a quintic (to the power of 5) function.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Quart
member.summary: The animation is interpolated with a quartic (to the power of 4) function.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Quad
member.summary: The animation is interpolated with a quadratic (to the power of 2) function.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Expo
member.summary: The animation is interpolated with an exponential (to the power of x) function.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Elastic
member.summary: The animation is interpolated with elasticity, wiggling around the edges.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Cubic
member.summary: The animation is interpolated with a cubic (to the power of 3) function.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Circ
member.summary: The animation is interpolated with a function using square roots.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Bounce
member.summary: The animation is interpolated by bouncing at the end.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TransitionType.Back
member.summary: The animation is interpolated backing out at ends.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TweenProcessMode.Physics
member.summary: The tween updates with the [code]_physics_process[/code] callback.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.TweenProcessMode.Idle
member.summary: The tween updates with the [code]_process[/code] callback.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.EaseType.In
member.summary: The interpolation starts slowly and speeds up towards the end.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.EaseType.Out
member.summary: The interpolation starts quickly and slows down towards the end.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.EaseType.InOut
member.summary: A combination of EASE_IN and EASE_OUT. The interpolation is slowest at both ends.

member.name: F:Godot.Tween.EaseType.OutIn
member.summary: A combination of EASE_IN and EASE_OUT. The interpolation is fastest at both ends.

member.name: P:Godot.Tween.Repeat
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the tween loops.

member.name: P:Godot.Tween.PlaybackProcessMode
member.summary: The tween's animation process thread. See [enum TweenProcessMode]. Default value: [constant TWEEN_PROCESS_IDLE].

member.name: P:Godot.Tween.PlaybackSpeed
member.summary: The tween's speed multiplier. For example, set it to [code]1.0[/code] for normal speed, [code]2.0[/code] for two times normal speed, or [code]0.5[/code] for half of the normal speed. A value of [code]0[/code] pauses the animation, but see also [method set_active] or [method stop_all] for this.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.IsActive
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if any tweens are currently running. Note that this method doesn't consider tweens that have ended.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.SetActive(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Activates/deactivates the tween. See also [method stop_all] and [method resume_all].

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.Start
member.summary: Starts the tween. You can define animations both before and after this.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.Reset(Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Resets a tween to its initial value (the one given, not the one before the tween), given its object and property/method pair. By default, all tweens are removed, unless [code]key[/code] is specified.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.ResetAll
member.summary: Resets all tweens to their initial values (the ones given, not those before the tween).

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.Stop(Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Stops a tween, given its object and property/method pair. By default, all tweens are stopped, unless [code]key[/code] is specified.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.StopAll
member.summary: Stops animating all tweens.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.Resume(Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Continues animating a stopped tween, given its object and property/method pair. By default, all tweens are resumed, unless [code]key[/code] is specified.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.ResumeAll
member.summary: Continues animating all stopped tweens.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.Remove(Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Stops animation and removes a tween, given its object and property/method pair. By default, all tweens are removed, unless [code]key[/code] is specified.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.RemoveAll
member.summary: Stops animation and removes all tweens.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.Seek(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the interpolation to the given [code]time[/code] in seconds.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.Tell
member.summary: Returns the current time of the tween.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.GetRuntime
member.summary: Returns the total time needed for all tweens to end. If you have two tweens, one lasting 10 seconds and the other 20 seconds, it would return 20 seconds, as by that time all tweens would have finished.

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.InterpolateProperty(Godot.Object,Godot.NodePath,System.Object,System.Object,System.Single,Godot.Tween.TransitionType,Godot.Tween.EaseType,System.Single)
member.summary: Animates [code]property[/code] of [code]object[/code] from [code]initial_val[/code] to [code]final_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. Setting the initial value to [code]null[/code] uses the current value of the property. Use [enum TransitionType] for [code]trans_type[/code] and [enum EaseType] for [code]ease_type[/code] parameters. These values control the timing and direction of the interpolation. See the class description for more information

member.name: M:Godot.Tween.InterpolateMethod(Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Single,Godot.Tween.TransitionType,Godot.Tween.EaseType,System.Single)
member.summary: Animates [code]method[/code] of [code]object[/code] from [code]initial_val[/code] to [code]final_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. Methods are called with consecutive values. Use [enum TransitionType] for [code]trans_type[/code] and [enum EaseType] for [code]ease_type[/code] parameters. These values control the timing and direction of the interpolation. See the class description for more information

These values control the timing and direction of the interpolation. See the class description for more information

member.name: T:Godot.UndoRedo
member.summary: Helper to manage UndoRedo in the editor or custom tools. It works by registering methods and property changes inside 'actions'. Common behavior is to create an action, then add do/undo calls to functions or property changes, then committing the action. Here's an example on how to add an action to Godot editor's own 'undoredo': [codeblock] var undo_redo = get_undo_redo() # Method of EditorPlugin. func do_something(): pass # Put your code here. func undo_something(): pass # Put here the code that reverts what's done by "do_something()". func _on_MyButton_pressed(): var node = get_node("MyNode2D") undo_redo.create_action("Move the node") undo_redo.add_do_method(self, "do_something") undo_redo.add_undo_method(self, "undo_something") undo_redo.add_do_property(node, "position", Vector2(100,100)) undo_redo.add_undo_property(node, "position", node.position) undo_redo.commit_action() [/codeblock] [method create_action], [method add_do_method], [method add_undo_method], [method add_do_property], [method add_undo_property], and [method commit_action] should be called one after the other, like in the example. Not doing so could lead to crashes. If you don't need to register a method you can leave [method add_do_method] and [method add_undo_method] out, and so it goes for properties. You can register more than one method/property.

member.name: F:Godot.UndoRedo.MergeMode.Disable
member.summary: Makes [code]do[/code]/[code]undo[/code] operations stay in separate actions.

member.name: F:Godot.UndoRedo.MergeMode.Ends
member.summary: Makes so that the action's [code]do[/code] operation is from the first action created and the [code]undo[/code] operation is from the last subsequent action with the same name.

member.name: F:Godot.UndoRedo.MergeMode.All
member.summary: Makes subsequent actions with the same name be merged into one.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.CreateAction(System.String,Godot.UndoRedo.MergeMode)
member.summary: Create a new action. After this is called, do all your calls to [method add_do_method], [method add_undo_method], [method add_do_property], and [method add_undo_property], then commit the action with [method commit_action]. The way actions are merged is dictated by the [code]merge_mode[/code] argument. See [enum MergeMode] for details.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.CommitAction
member.summary: Commit the action. All 'do' methods/properties are called/set when this function is called.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.AddDoMethod(Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Register a method that will be called when the action is committed.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.AddUndoMethod(Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Register a method that will be called when the action is undone.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.AddDoProperty(Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Register a property value change for 'do'.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.AddUndoProperty(Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Register a property value change for 'undo'.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.AddDoReference(Godot.Object)
member.summary: Register a reference for 'do' that will be erased if the 'do' history is lost. This is useful mostly for new nodes created for the 'do' call. Do not use for resources.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.AddUndoReference(Godot.Object)
member.summary: Register a reference for 'undo' that will be erased if the 'undo' history is lost. This is useful mostly for nodes removed with the 'do' call (not the 'undo' call!).

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.ClearHistory(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clear the undo/redo history and associated references. Passing [code]false[/code] to [code]increase_version[/code] will prevent the version number to be increased from this.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.GetCurrentActionName
member.summary: Get the name of the current action.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.GetVersion
member.summary: Get the version, each time a new action is committed, the version number of the UndoRedo is increased automatically. This is useful mostly to check if something changed from a saved version.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.Redo
member.summary: Redo last action.

member.name: M:Godot.UndoRedo.Undo
member.summary: Undo last action.

member.name: T:Godot.UPNP
member.summary: Provides UPNP functionality to discover [UPNPDevice]s on the local network and execute commands on them, like managing port mappings (port forwarding) and querying the local and remote network IP address. Note that methods on this class are synchronous and block the calling thread.

member.summary: Sets the device at [code]index[/code] from the list of discovered devices to [code]device[/code].

member.summary: Returns the default gateway. That is the first discovered [UPNPDevice] that is also a valid IGD (InternetGatewayDevice).

member.name: M:Godot.UPNP.Discover(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Discovers local [UPNPDevice]s. Clears the list of previously discovered devices. Filters for IGD (InternetGatewayDevice) type devices by default, as those manage port forwarding. [code]timeout[/code] is the time to wait for responses in milliseconds. [code]ttl[/code] is the time-to-live; only touch this if you know what you're doing. See [enum UPNPResult] for possible return values.

member.name: M:Godot.UPNP.QueryExternalAddress
member.summary: Returns the external [IP] address of the default gateway (see [method get_gateway]) as string. Returns an empty string on error.

member.name: M:Godot.UPNP.AddPortMapping(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a mapping to forward the external [code]port[/code] (between 1 and 65535) on the default gateway (see [method get_gateway]) to the [code]internal_port[/code] on the local machine for the given protocol [code]proto[/code] (either [code]TCP[/code] or [code]UDP[/code], with UDP being the default). If a port mapping for the given port and protocol combination already exists on that gateway device, this method tries to overwrite it. If that is not desired, you can retrieve the gateway manually with [method get_gateway] and call [method add_port_mapping] on it, if any. If [code]internal_port[/code] is [code]0[/code] (the default), the same port number is used for both the external and the internal port (the [code]port[/code] value). The description ([code]desc[/code]) is shown in some router UIs and can be used to point out which application added the mapping, and the lifetime of the mapping can be limited by [code]duration[/code]. However, some routers are incompatible with one or both of these, so use with caution and add fallback logic in case of errors to retry without them if in doubt. See [enum UPNPResult] for possible return values.

member.name: M:Godot.UPNP.DeletePortMapping(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the port mapping for the given port and protocol combination on the default gateway (see [method get_gateway]) if one exists. [code]port[/code] must be a valid port between 1 and 65535, [code]proto[/code] can be either [code]TCP[/code] or [code]UDP[/code]. See [enum UPNPResult] for possible return values.

member.name: T:Godot.UPNPDevice
member.summary: UPNP device. See [UPNP] for UPNP discovery and utility functions. Provides low-level access to UPNP control commands. Allows to manage port mappings (port forwarding) and to query network information of the device (like local and external IP address and status). Note that methods on this class are synchronous and block the calling thread.
